title: Pipe Fitter
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:
We are growing!
Thermogenics supports your achievement of your Gas Fitter license.
Reporting to the Shop Supervisor, Pipe Fitters at Thermogenics complete all threaded piping as well as general boiler assembly according to blue prints and shop drawings. This role provides assistance and service in support of other jobs in the Plant and provide guidance and training to General Labourers.

WHY JOIN US?
§ We provide Gas Fitter 2s with a path to achieve their Gas Fitter 1 license and potentially a career as a field service technician
§ 4 day week - 4 X 10hours
§ Opportunity to learn other trades; welding, fabrication, pipe fitting, machine fitting
§ 4% vacation pay and paid statutory holidays
§ Paid overtime if evening and weekend work required
§ Co-pay Benefit Plan that includes coverage for employee and spousal life insurance, AD&D, Short and long term disability, hospital, prescription drugs, healthcare and dental care
§ Retirement Savings Plan matching
§ Family culture including volunteerism, Christmas party, golf tournament, BBQs and more
§ Team approach to learning and sharing opportunities

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Pipe Fitting and Boiler Assembly
Main Activities:
· Accurately read and interpret blue prints and drawings to independently execute jobs and tasks to specification.
· Ensure accuracy of drawings and layouts to drive operational efficiency and avoid the need to complete re-works.
· Measure and mark pipes for cutting and threading.
· Cut, thread, and hammer pipes to specifications using a variety of hand tools such as saws, cutting torches, pipe threader and benders.
· Assemble and secure pipes, tubes, fittings and related equipment, according to specifications. This may involve welding, brazing, cementing, soldering and threading joints.
· Inspect, examine and test installed systems and pipe lines, using pressure gauge, hydrostatic testing, observation, or other methods.
· Provide timely communication around drawing alterations and reworks.
· Work as a team to prioritize work orders and maximize efficiency.
· Monitor equipment for appropriate usage and temperature.
· Safely lift and manage the size and weight of materials and finished products throughout the process.
· Achieve production deadlines by communicating with colleagues in other departments to ensure on-time deliverables with minimal need for overtime.
· Identify any noticed imperfections or inconsistencies in work already completed.
· Other duties as required.
Safety and Professionalism
Main Activities:

  • Employ a safety-first mindset and contribute to a safe environment daily.
  • Fully participate in all provided or required training sessions related to pipe and gas fitting.
  • Provide professional feedback on received trainings and maintain an awareness of any expire dates related to training requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all safety training, policies, practices and procedures and consistently apply on the job to create a safe work environment.
  • Monitor work environment for hazards
  • Ensure proper use of personal protective equipment and the maintenance of engineered controls (e.g. guards).
  • Report any potential hazards (e.g. faulty equipment) or potentially hazardous conditions to management immediately.
  • Ensure good housekeeping in all work spaces.
  • Other duties as required.

TRAINING, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3 – 5 years relevant experience,
  • Hold a valid G2 Gas License or equivalent pipe fitter license or experience,
  • Accurate measuring and layout ability,
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints, drawings and technical bulletins,
  • Ability to read and interpret manuals,

· Mechanically inclined with an ability to confidently use a variety of hand tools, and

  • Knowledge of industry safety practices.

Term, Hours of Work and Compensation:
This position is a full-time role with a three (3) month probationary period.
Hours of work are 40 hours / week and structured according to the plant schedule as follows:
Monday – Thursday 6:30am – 5:00pm
May also be from 6:30 am to 3:45 pm Monday to Thursday and 6:30 am to 11:30 am on Friday.
Occasional overtime (e.g. weekends) work may become available as required in the business and paid at overtime rates.
We expect to compensate the successful candidate at hourly rates consistent with market and based on experience.
The role is entitled to 4% vacation pay and paid statutory holidays. We have a full benefit package and retirement savings plan.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Thermogenics is a leading manufacturer of coil-tube steam and hot-water boilers and related equipment used in industrial, commercial and institutional applications in North America. The company also provides best-in-class parts and maintenance services to its installed base, delivered through a robust team of factory-trained technicians. With its comprehensive product and service offering, Thermogenics functions as a one-stop shop for all of its customers’ steam and heating requirements.
The company currently operates from its Head Office, manufacturing and service facility in Aurora, Ontario, and maintains separate sales and service offices in Ottawa, Ontario, Cincinnati, Ohio and Jacksonville Florida.

Hiring Accessibility:

We are an equal opportunity employer. Thermogenics welcomes applications from candidates with disabilities; accommodations are available upon request for those who are selected to proceed with the interview process.

Work Remotely

· No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$24.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Our COVID protocols have been in place since March 2020 and include: social distancing, mask wearing and regular sanitizing.

Education:

  • AEC / DEP or Skilled Trade Certificate (preferred)

Experience:

  • pipefitting: 3 years (preferred)

title: newMaintenance Technician (Electrician)
description:
Tired of going site to site, working with new people all the time, looking for job stability? Baycoat may be the right place for you.

Baycoat is currently the largest steel coil coater in Canada. Baycoat employs a workforce of approximately 175, operating two coating lines that are capable of accommodating numerous paint systems, offering well over 1,000 colours. These coating lines currently paint over 200,000 tons of steel annually, serving customers in various markets including the residential and commercial construction markets.

Baycoat began operations in 1965, as a joint venture between Dofasco and Stelco, Canada’s two major steel companies. Baycoat was formed to meet a growing demand for pre painted steel. Over the years Baycoat has proven itself as a safe, reliable company, offering high quality products in a cost efficient and timely manner. Baycoat recently celebrated 11 years with Zero Lost Time.

We are seeking a strong Industrial Electrician to join our Maintenance department. The primary function of this position is to repair, inspect, replace, install, adjust and maintain plant equipment.

The ideal candidate must have their industrial electrician’s license (442) or Construction and Maintenance License (309A), related work experience in North American industry or equivalent. This position is a mix of mechanical and electrical/controls work.

The successful candidate must be willing to undergo the training required to obtain the Maintenance Gas Fitter (IMT) designation.

Working Hours:

· Working 12 hour continental shifts with 80 regular hours plus 4 hours of overtime bi-weekly.

Total Compensation Package:

· 12 hour Shifts –hourly rate plus shift premiums paid for afternoon, nights, Saturday, Sunday.

Variable Compensation:

· Gain Sharing Plan - up to 7.5% of earnings based on company performance.

Company Benefits:

· Medical, Dental, Vision.

· Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability.

· Life Insurance.

· Company pension of 8%.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and Baycoat’s AODA policy, upon request, Baycoat will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

While we appreciate your interest, only candidates chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to $36.47 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
The first interview is a phone interview/virtual meeting. If a candidate is selected to move forward, then a in house meeting will be scheduled following COVID protocols i.e. mask, declaration form, sanitizer etc.

Application question(s):

  • Do you have Industrial Electrician’s License 442?
  • Do you have a Construction and Maintenance License 309A?

title: newNight Shift Steamfitter / Pipefitter
description:
Phoenix Industrial is looking for Night Shift Steamfitter / Pipefitter - Journeyman - Fort Saskatchewan!!!!

We provide Field Construction, Fabrication, and Modularization services that are built upon our values of visibility, value and accountability. From project planning to turnover and maintenance, we aim to engage a top-level workforce through proven processes and efficient management practices.

At Phoenix Industrial we are always looking for talented individuals to join our team for upcoming opportunities and are currently accepting applications for the following:

Why Join Phoenix?

  • Great Company Culture
  • Industry leading Safety
  • Advanced Work Packaging so work days are planned and productive
  • Duration til fall, extra scoop to come
  • Home everyday; very competitive compensation package
  • 20 positions available
  • Project Shift is 5 days on and 2 days off, 10 hour days (Mon-Thu) and 8 hours on Fri and some weekends

Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrate knowledge of various piping system components for measuring, cutting, threading, grooving and bending of pipes, valves and fittings
  • Layout, assemble, fabricate, maintain and repair piping systems which carry water, steam, chemicals or fuel used in heating, cooling, lubricating and other processes
  • Hydrotest and install fabricated pipe spools within structural steel modular assemblies, adding designed supports as required
  • Maintain all tools, work area and equipment in a clean and orderly fashion
  • Read and interpret client and company supplied construction fabrication drawings and specifications
  • Follow various Phoenix and Client policies & procedures
  • Previous experience in the following is considered an asset, Pipefitter, steamfitter, pipefitter apprentice, journeyman pipefitter, apprentice pipefitter, steamfitter pipefitter welder, pipe fitter, pipefitters, apprentice

Requirements:

  • Valid Alberta Journeyman or Apprentice or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 or CSTS-20
  • Fall Protection Certificate
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Pipefitters
  • Must complete pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Must support a safety-orientated work environment
  • Must be willing to relocate for the position

20
Department:
Skilled Craft & Trades
State/Territory:
AB-Alberta

title: Pipe Fitter
description:
Heddle Shipyards is looking for experienced Pipefitters to join our team at our Port Weller location.

Position Summary:

The Pipefitter is responsible for the layout, assembly, installation and maintenance of piping systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Install and maintain piping and associated systems adhering to acts and regulations to company standards
  • Perform preventative maintenance procedures, to minimize downtime and maintenance costs, and manage equipment efficiencies
  • Operating accessory equipment for pipe fitting (pipe beveling, pipe threading, pipe cutting, torch or plasma cutter, drill press)
  • Measure, cut, thread, groove, bend, assemble and install metal pipe, valves and fittings.

Qualifications & Experience:

  • H2S Alive
  • Confined Space Entry and/or Rescue
  • CSTS 09
  • WHMIS 2015
  • Journeyman Ticket
  • Understanding of control systems is an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively in a variety of situation

Heddle Shipyards is an equal opportunity employer. All applicable provincial and federal laws will be followed to ensure consideration without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, age, disability or other classification protected by law. Heddle Shipyards will make reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities in accordance with applicable law. It is our intention that all qualified applicants be given equal opportunity and that selection will be made on job related factors. If you require any accommodation in the application process, please contact the HR department.

We want to thank everyone for applying, however only applicants that possess the required knowledge will be considered for the position.

description:
Currently we are looking for Journeyman Steamfitter / Pipefitters for projects North of Fort McMurray.

Who we Are - We are an Alberta based, family owned industrial contractor with over 25 years of successful industrial construction experience. We are a world-class leader in industrial fabrication, construction and maintenance and have built our company and reputation on ensuring visibility, value and accountability are always in the forefront. We are rapidly growing and are always seeking qualified and talented individuals to join our team and grow with us.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation packages Employee rate: $48.00/hr
  • Subcontractor $55.25/hr
  • Employee Benefit Program including medical and dental coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Training and Advancement Opportunities

Project Specifics

  • Fly-in and Fly- out
  • Edmonton and Calgary hubs
  • Flight travel assistance available for travelers living outside of Alberta for turnaround from April 4 to June 30th.
  • Currently Days and Nights
  • 10 days on and 4 days off
  • 10 Hours per day
  • Project located North of Fort McMurrary
  • Camp accomodations

Requirements:

  • Successfully complete a pre-access drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid Alberta Steamfitter/Pipefitter Journeyman or Red Seal Certification
  • CSTS-09 / WHMIS 2015 / H2S Alive / ESC Fall Protection
  • Physically capable of performing all tasks required of field Steamfitters/Pipefitters
  • Invested in a safety-oriented work environment
  • Keywords: Pipefitter, journeyman pipefitter, steamfitter, pipefitter apprentice, welder, steamfitter pipefitter, apprentice pipefitter, pipe fitter, steamfitters, pipefitters, apprentice, journeyman, shutdown, turnaround, oil, gas, oilsands, pipefitting, hydrotesting

At Phoenix Industrial, we believe we are stronger together. That’s why we believe that investing in our people and the communities in which we work and live returns to us ten-fold. We invest in your growth because we believe it is essential for our continued success.

We are proud of our company, our projects, our sustainable growth and most importantly our people. And we’d be proud to welcome you to the Phoenix family.

Come Grow With Us!

title: newPiping Designer
description:
Thermo Design engineering is a recognized leader in engineering, manufacturing, and construction in the energy industry around the world. From conceptual engineering and design to manufacturing of fully operational turnkey oil and gas plant solutions, TDE offers the equipment, services, and expertise to create industry-leading oil and gas facilities. We use innovative technology to stay at the forefront of our industry and provide superior solutions that are safe, reliable, and beneficial to our clients, our industry, and the world.

At TDE, we focus on partnering with you to provide customized solutions that solve everyday challenges and maintain optimum performance well into the future.

Why join our team?

  • Competitive base salary and variable pay that rewards individual, team, and company performance.
  • Comprehensive benefits and retirement savings programs that holistically support employee well-being.
  • Support and empowerment to promote work/life balance.
  • Ongoing learning and professional development opportunities within a diverse, inclusive and dynamic work environment.
  • On the job training, informal mentorships, company-sponsored job-specific training, and formal education programs.

TDE is seeking an Piping Designer to 3D model plant equipment and piping in accordance with company and client specifications. Locate plant equipment to ensure good design practice for operation and maintenance. Generate piping fabrication drawings, material take-offs and piping layout drawings. Provide drawing and data file support for stress calculations, purchasing, and quality assurance.

Responsibilities

  • Generate piping fabrication drawings in accordance with company and client specifications to meet scheduled timelines. Including the following:
  • Generate plan and elevation drawings from 3D models.
  • Generate piping isometric and spool drawings from models along with data files.
  • Provide as built updates as necessary.
  • Understand and utilize P&ID’s and piping specifications to produce drawings in accordance with TDE and client standards.
  • Check and provide markups to PID’s, structural, vessel, mechanical and vendor supplied drawings and data sheets.
  • Provide modeling support for electrical and structural disciplines.
  • Liaison with shop foreman and pipe fitters during the fabrication process.
  • Generate piping material and piping support take-offs.
  • Assist with estimates for project proposals.
  • Assist with other design/drafting disciplines.
  • Assist with development of piping design standards.

Qualifications

  • Must have at least 5 years experience in plant design and/or fabrication environment.
  • Must have working experience with AutoCad, AutoPlant, Plant 3D, PDMS, CadWorks, in a 3D modeling environment.
  • Proficient knowledge of industry best practices.
  • Proven ability to produce high quality work while facing competing priorities and strict deadlines.
  • Demonstrate an ability to prioritize activities and stay focused in a dynamic ever changing environment.
  • Demonstrate an ability to develop departmental “Key Performance Indicators”.
  • Good knowledge of Piping Design and Drafting of Petrochemical Plants.
  • Good knowledge of natural gas processing equipment, controls and piping codes.
  • Good experience working with P&ID drawings and piping codes.
  • Knowledge of MS Office suite (emphasis on Word & Excel), Lotus Notes and other software systems.
  • Excellent written communication skills.
  • Strong editing and proofreading skills.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills – must be able to interact successfully with all levels of staff, from Managers to Senior Executives, with a positive, enthusiastic attitude.
  • Ability to demonstrate sensitivity toward client engagements and confidentiality when interacting with TDE leadership.
  • Adaptability and the ability to handle ambiguity.

Please submit resume through Indeed.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newAssembleur (fitter) Transport
description:
Êtes-vous à la recherche d’emploi ? cherchez-vous de nouveaux défis ? Êtes-vous passionnés par le métier du transport aéronautique et terrestre ? …
Si oui, Joignez-vous à notre équipe et embarquez dans l’Aventure AAA Canada !
**
*PRÉSENTATION DE L’ENTREPRISE : *
AAA Canada est une entreprise manufacturière sur sites et hors sites qui offre des services spécialisés de sous-traitance et d’assistance technique liés aux processus d’industrialisation, de production et de maintenance dans les secteurs Aéronautique, Transport Terrestre, Énergie, Défense et Naval. AAA Canada exerce ses activités sur site client à l’échelle du pays, principalement au Québec et en Ontario.
Intégrer AAA Canada c’est accéder à une grande famille qui se soucie du bien-être, de l’épanouissement ainsi que l’évolution de carrière de ses collaborateurs. Nous sommes engagés à vous présenter l’opportunité qui correspond le plus à votre profil et nous avons l’avantage de vous former si cela est nécessaire pour la prise de fonction.
Dans le cadre de l’expansion de nos activités, nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) :
**
*Ce que AAA Canada peut vous offrir : *

  • Emploi permanent
  • Salaire compétitif
  • Formation continue
  • Programme d’assurances collectives
  • Journées maladie
  • Évolution de carrière
  • Rabais corporatif
  • Environnement stimulant
  • Prime d’éloignement

**
*** Assembleur de jour ***
**
Vos principales *missions** : *

  • Participer à la conception l’assemblage de chariots
  • Lire et analyser un plan;
  • Visser, driller, ajouter, coller et/ou ajuster les pièces ;
  • Évaluer les obstacles et élaborer les solutions appropriées pour les surmonter ;
  • Aller chercher les pièces, morceaux, outils et/ou accessoires nécessaires à l’assemblage:
  • Toutes autres tâches connexes.

**
Les *compétences recherchées : *

  • Habileté à lire des plans;
  • Savoir utiliser des outils;
  • Bonne dextérité manuelle;
  • Maîtrise du français ou de l’anglais;
  • Être soucieux des détails;
  • Longues périodes debout
  • Faire preuve d’autonomie et de rigueur.

Si vous êtes motivés et pensez être la personne avec le profil adéquat, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter. Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature !
candidatures@aaa-canada.ca
***Vous n’avez pas beaucoup d'expérience ? Vous pensez que cela pourrait être un frein lors de votre recherche d’emploi ? Vous vous démarquez par votre débrouillardise et votre souci du détail ?*

  • N’attendez plus ! Envoyez-nous votre CV ! Nos employés expérimentés pourront vous apprendre le métier! ***

title: newFactory-Trained Apprentice (Gas Fitter 2)
description:
Job description

Position Summary:

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to progress into a Field Service Technician role (e.g. Gas Fitter) pending completion of pre-requisite education / experience.

Thermogenics has an immediate employment opportunity for a General Labourer who will be responsible for supporting the Manufacturing operations. The expectation is that the candidate begins the role in an entry level capacity with oversight from supervisors and hands-on training from the Company.

Gas Tech 2 license is a prerequisite for this role.

General:

The successful candidate will have previous experience that demonstrates their ability to:

  • Operate with a safety first mindset
  • Work with minimal oversight but willing to follow directions closely
  • Communicate effectively with fellow employees, customers and suppliers
  • Operate various hand and power tools and welding machines in a safe and responsible manner.

Duties and Responsibilities: The primary duties of the role are outlined below, amongst others:

  • Light boiler fabrication and assembly
  • Operation and general maintenance functions on various equipment including fork lifts
  • Equipment painting
  • Supporting shipping and receiving functions
  • Loading and unloading equipment to / from trucks, cranes and trailers
  • Maintaining shop cleanliness
  • Parts pick-up / deliveries
  • Other general tasks as assigned

Qualifications and Experience: **

To be successful in this position, it is desired that you have some (or all) of the following:

  • 1-5 years of previous work experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills – desire to be a team player
  • Level 2 gas ticket - required
  • OB 2 oil ticket - desirable
  • College diploma in a related field
  • Previous experience in crane and forklift operation, WHMIS Training, Confined Space and Fall Arrest training.
  • Valid driver’s license

Work Environment: **

This job operates in a shop environment. The employee is occasionally exposed to a variety of conditions.

Physical Demands: **

The physical demands of the role are typical of a general labourer role on a plant floor in a manufacturing facility.

Term, Hours of Work and Compensation: This position is a full-time role with a three (3) month probationary period.

Hours of work are 40 hours / week and structured according to the plant schedule as follows:

Monday – Thursday 6:30am – 3:45pm

Friday 6:30am – 11:30am

Must also be available for potential afternoon shift.

Monday – Thursday 4pm – 2:30pm

Occasional overtime (e.g. evenings and weekends) work may become available as required in the business and paid at overtime rates.

We expect to compensate the successful candidate at hourly rates consistent with market and based on experience.

The role is entitled to 4% vacation pay and paid statutory holidays.

title: Maintenance Planner/Scheduler
description:
This position offers a 3k sign on bonus. Pay is $38.19 per hour.

The purpose of the Maintenance Planner is to safely deliver asset reliability performance by ensuring maintenance work is planned and executed efficiently using corporate standard methodologies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Plan and coordinate maintenance tasks across the mill
  • Create/change/display work orders in SAP and execute planned and unplanned maintenance tasks
  • Change notifications in SAP into work orders, and assign date, workcentre, and tradesman
  • Plan for shutdowns by ensuring work orders are ready for shutdown inclusion, generating standard shutdown listing/timeline, and conducting shutdown pre- and post-down meetings
  • Maintain reliability of machinery by identifying repeat failure parts and problem solving these areas
  • Take on responsibilities of maintenance crew leader for shutdowns if necessary, respond to maintenance work when needed, and be eligible for maintenance call-in breakdown work
  • Prepare and host weekly work order planning meeting report, as well as issuing weekly maintenance work plan document for each department
  • Create and track Purchase Orders for manpower and fabrication in each area
  • Track values for monthly accrual process
  • Participate in weekly meeting to track c-w work (timing and expense)
  • Approve service entry sheets in SAP
  • Participate in new maintenance employee candidate interviews

ESSENTIAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • SAFETY:
  • Demonstrate commitment to safety through decision making and utilization of our 3 Safety Obligations – take care of yourself, take care of others, and let others take care of you
  • QUALITY:
  • Actively contribute to KC quality goals by understanding our quality philosophy, making quality decisions, and escalating quality concerns and improvements
  • PRODUCTIVITY:
  • Actively contribute to goals and improvements
  • Think Customer: I anticipate my customer’s needs. I will be open to and adopt ideas wherever possible to ensure I am meeting customer needs. I will network with employees across the mill and KC organization
  • CULTURE:
  • Build Trust: I assume positive intent in others, and I am open to diverse perspectives
  • Make Decisions: I will make good decisions, get input and guidance from the appropriate people, and will always celebrate other’s successes
  • Win Consistently: I will always ask “what else can I do” to exceed expectations and deliver the overall best results for the enterprise
  • Continuous Improvement: I will reach across boundaries for new ideas to improve the business
  • Build Talent: I will continually develop my own skills and knowledge and be open to feedback and suggestions to achieve my full potential. I will also openly transfer my knowledge to my coworkers
  • FLEXIBILITY:
  • Willing to flex schedule to support personal and business objectives
  • Available for “call ins” to support business objectives

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School diploma
  • current Provincial “Certificate of Qualification” in the industrial trades (Electrician, Millwright, Pipe/Steam Fitter, Machinist, Welder, Instrumentation Technician) preferred
  • Experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Software (CMMS), SAP preferred
  • Working knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Lean Six Sigma certification/training (preference not required)

WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Industrial environment (noise, dust, moving equipment, fluctuating temperatures etc.) May include prolonged periods of standing, along with bending, reaching, lifting and carrying up to 40 lbs, PPE, heights and confined spaces
  • Day shift position but hours could vary based on business need

DISCLAIMER:

IMPORTANT-WHEN APPLYING FOR THIS, OR ANY POSITION WITHIN KIMBERLY-CLARK, IT IS IMPORTANT THAT YOU UPDATE YOUR CANDIDATE PROFILE IN WORKDAY WITH YOUR RESUME

Kimberly-Clark is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. With an inclusive culture, our employees – and the original thinking they bring to Kimberly-Clark – make us stronger. EOE disability/vet.

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $38.19 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • maintenance planning: 3 years (preferred)
  • maintenance scheduling: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Provincial “Certificate of Qualification”- industrial trades (preferred)

title: Supervisor, Maintenance
description:
Company Name: Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd.
Location: Windsor, ON
Hiram Walker & Sons Limited , a Pernod Ricard Company, is the place where ambition thrives. As part of a global enterprise, we are proud to be delivering the market such exciting brands as Wiser's Whisky, Polar Ice Vodka, Malibu Rum, and Lamb's rum. Let your ambition lead you toward outstanding opportunities with progressive rewards. For insight on our heritage please click
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VaXS-oxdU5U&feature=player_embedded
Note: All candidates must be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and present proof upon hiring unless you qualify for a reasonable accommodation based on a human rights protected ground (effective November 15, 2021).
Position Summary
This role will be responsible for supervising and leading a group of skilled trades personnel to ensure bottling operations perform on target. Committed to achieving excellence in quality, health and safety, the environment and product safety the Supervisor, Maintenance will reinforce the Company’s vision for world-class maintenance by placing an emphasis on the quality of workmanship, efficiency of assigned work and managing the expectations of internal customers. Prioritize day to day maintenance operations to ensure the production division can run with little disruption. Duties to include managing of assigned duties, preventative maintenance in the Bottling and material handling areas, as well as keeping focus on lean maintenance and continuous improvements within the maintenance department.
Key Responsibilities
  • OHSA - Ensure compliance of Occupational Health & Safety Act (section 25, 26, 27, and 28) per Hiram Walker & Son’s Ltd Policy- Management-Supervision-Worker Safety Responsibilities.
  • Ensures compliance to all the environmental quality and safety standards related to the department; Supports continuous improvement and root cause analysis processes.
  • Lead direct reports to meet or exceed cost savings initiative objectives
  • Support HACCP, GMP and technical audit requirements.
  • Facilitate open and effective communications with other departments, ensuring optimal quality standards.
  • Promotion and utilization of maintenance lean concepts. Ensuring the work order and time card processes are being followed and all work orders and time cards are entered in a timely basis after completion.
  • Ensure preventative & predictive maintenance program is followed and all work is tracked. Aid in process improvement through technical support.
  • Track and inspect Trades work for completeness, keeping records of all work performed via the CMMS work order system.
  • Oversee emergency breakdown repairs with the maintenance team to ensure repairs are completed in a timely manner.
  • Manpower: timely payroll reporting, control absenteeism, vacation planning.
  • Establish a plan to shape a high performance team; manages the development of the department's resources through training and coaching opportunities.
  • Professionally manages the relationship with union members and trades
  • Maintain zero non-conformance certification for ISO 9002
  • Direct supervision of: Electricians, Pipe-Fitters, Fire Protection & Mechanics
  • Financial responsibility for M&R and Labour Budgets
  • Internal, regular work related contact with:
  • Manufacturing
  • Central Maintenance: Coordination of trades
  • Industrial Relations: Discipline Procedure
  • External, regular work related contact with outside vendors for materials and services
Required Skills & Abilities
  • Knowledge of HACCP and GMP requirements
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Understanding Collective Agreements
  • Technical Skills (mechanical, electrical, etc.)
  • Knowledge of a CMMS
  • Knowledge of manufacturing equipment
  • Knowledge of Health & Safety Regulations
  • High Competency in: the ability to make things happen, customer focus, team building, influencing and partnering
  • Solid ability to have big picture thinking and step change innovation
Education
Required: College Diploma, Electrical/Mechanical Engineering or
Trade Certificate with related work experience
Preferred: Bachelor Degree, Electrical/Mechanical Engineering
Maintenance Management Professional (MMP) Certificate or
Certified Maintenance & Reliability Professional (CMRP) designation
We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including aboriginal, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, creed, family status, national origin, age and gender.
Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd. is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Should you require accommodation during any phase of the recruitment process or wish to view our accommodation policies, please contact the Human Resources Department at
Accessibilty.Canada@pernod-ricard.com
Thank you for your interest in Pernod Ricard and its subsidiaries, Corby Spirit and Wine Limited and Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd. All resumes submitted will be reviewed by our recruitment team and kept on file for six months in consideration for this and future opportunities. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Please do not contact provincial offices directly as all recruitment is coordinated through the Corporate Office in Toronto.
Job Posting End Date:
Target Hire Date:
2022-03-24-07:00
Target End Date:

title: Refrigeration/Air Conditioning Systems Mechanic
description:
About Ryerson

At the intersection of mind and action, Ryerson is on a transformative path to become Canada’s leading comprehensive innovation university. Integral to this path is the placement of equity, diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our institutional culture. Our current academic plan outlines each as core values and we work to embed them in all that we do.

Ryerson University welcomes those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion and will assist us to expand our capacity for diversity in the broadest sense. In addition, to correct the conditions of disadvantage in employment in Canada, we encourage applications from members of groups that have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples, Indigenous peoples of North America, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, and those who identify as women and/or 2SLGBTQ+. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, applications from Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

In August 2021, the university announced that it would begin a renaming process to address the legacy of Egerton Ryerson for a more inclusive future. Let's write the next chapter together. To learn more about our work environment, colleagues, leaders, students and innovative educational environment

About Facilities Management and Development

Ryerson University’s Facilities Management and Development (FMD) department involves care of the physical environment of the campus and strategic planning for existing and future spaces, including the impacts of those spaces. FMD is responsible for functions including Environmental Health and Safety, Facilities Services, Maintenance and Operations, Planning and Development, Project Management Office, Real Estate, and Sustainability.


The Opportunity

We are looking for a licensed and experienced Refrigeration/Air Conditioning Systems Mechanic to join our team! This is a full-time permanent position. In this position, you will be responsible for maintaining the mechanical equipment of Ryerson University in an efficient, safe and serviceable operating condition on a continuing basis. This includes coordinating preventive and corrective maintenance, inspecting, troubleshooting, repairing and modifying building mechanical systems, control systems and wide variety of machines and equipment. You will also be committed to providing excellent client service to staff, faculty, students and the Ryerson University community.

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Maintains and troubleshoots all heat pumps, packaged A/C units, and related auxiliary equipment.
  • Maintenance of steam traps, strainers, valves, packings, controls, etc, which form part of the boiler plant, cooling plant and HVAC systems.
  • Installs and relocates machines and equipment.
  • Maintains and operates heating and cooling equipment, and all machine tools in the maintenance shop for fabricating and metalworking.
  • Undertakes a comprehensive preventative maintenance program and ensures proper maintenance cycles are maintained and reported to the supervisor.
  • Assists the Supervisor in training of Maintenance Mechanic “B” personnel.
  • Follows safe work practices while undertaking duties.
  • Informs supervisor of all abnormalities, defects, and malfunctioned equipment.
  • Performs all duties of Maintenance Mechanic “B” if required.
  • Keeps up-to-date with changing technology and techniques pertinent to the trade.
  • Please refer to the job description for all responsibilities (Available upon request).

Qualifications

  • Successful completion of an Ontario license as a Journeyperson Refrigeration/Air Conditioning Systems Mechanic 313A, ODP license and Gas Fitter 2 license.
  • Minimum of five (5) years of related work experience carrying out general maintenance in a complex industrial, commercial or education facility.
  • Required experience includes:
    • Gas and arc welding; metal machining; light gauge metal fabrication;
    • Fitting and setting machine components as well as complete units;
    • Fitting and adjusting mechanical seals and packing glands;
    • Adjusting, repairing and modifying heating and ventilating systems and their auxiliary equipment. (Auxiliary equipment includes: electrostatic and media filters, fans, pneumatic and electronic controls and motors, ducts, dampers, diffusers, radiators, convectors, reheat coils, gas or oil burners, and combustion controls, centrifugal chiller units, cooling towers, heat pumps, air compressors, vacuum pumps, emergency generators etc.).
    • Reading and interpreting drawings and specifications applying to mechanical trades.
    • Using standard workshop tools (both hand and electric).
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills are required.
  • Knowledge of WHMIS and Occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Ability to use handheld communication devices.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and within a team environment.

Additional Requirements:

  • Ability to work in undesirable and disagreeable conditions such as dust, dirt, fumes, extreme temperatures (excessive cold or heat) and potential hazards, etc.
  • Must be capable of heavy lifting and other strenuous physical activity such as: continuous walking; standing; kneeling; climbing ladders; working on the back, sides and above shoulder for extended periods of time; working in confined spaces; working on scaffolds, air lifts or elevated equipment.
  • Must be willing and able to wear and use personal protective equipment (PPE) and clothing.
  • Must demonstrate a record of attendance, reliability and dependability.

What Ryerson University has to offer employees:

There is something for everyone! Employees are eligible for many benefits, services and discounts including:

  • Convenient location downtown at Yonge and Dundas, accessible by transit and car.
  • Consistent and guaranteed shifts (40 hours per week).
  • Competitive Benefits Package: Group benefits including comprehensive health and dental, emergency travel care, employee and family assistance program (EFAP), life and business travel accident insurance.
  • Ryerson Retirement Pension Plan (RRPP): Participation in a defined benefit pension plan.
  • Tuition Waiver/Rebate: Eligible employees and their spouses and dependents have access to various programs and courses offered by Ryerson University.
  • Health & Fitness: Reduced membership rate to two (2) Athletic Centres which includes group fitness classes, massage therapy, personal training and aquatics.
  • Medical Centre: Access to the Ryerson medical centre which provides a range of medical services on campus.
  • Onsite Daycare: Full-time and part-time daycare, and before and after school program.


Additional Information

Vacancy Type


FTCE Vacancy Notice



Start


A.S.A.P.



End Date


N/A



Department


Facilities Management and Development, Maintenance and Operations



Position Number


20000640

Entry rate is $35.50 per hour and Job rate $37.98 - shift premiums may apply



Hours of Work

Reporting to


Supervisor, Maintenance and Operations



Shift


Monday to Friday 7am to 3:30pm

Monday to Thursday 3pm to 11:30pm AND Friday 1pm to 9:30pm (2 vacancies)



On Call Pay


Yes



Notes


  • Qualified CUPE 233 employees will be considered before members of other employee groups
  • Must be flexible to work shifts, overtime or on call as needed
  • Candidates may be asked to demonstrate qualifications through occupational testing and an interview conducted by a panel of at least three (3) management representatives.
  • Candidates must have a demonstrated record of dependability/reliability & a commitment to maintain confidentiality.
  • A review of the employee's official personnel file, job performance and reference checks may be conducted.
  • Applications are accepted online or by email.

We encourage all First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples or Indigenous peoples of North America, to self-identify in their applications and also reach out to Tracey King, Indigenous Human Resources Lead for support during the selection process.

As part of the selection process, candidates may be required to complete an occupational assessment.
Applications will only be accepted online through Ryerson's careersite.

Ryerson University is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and aims to ensure that independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity are embedded in all aspects of the university culture.

We will provide an accessible experience for applicants, students, employees, and members of the Ryerson community.We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the recruitment process. If you have restrictions that need to be accommodated to fully participate in any phase of the recruitment process, please contact hr@ryerson.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

.


Important Notice Re: Job Postings during COVID-19

Following the advice of government and health authorities to slow the spread of COVID-19, all employees have been equipped to work from home until further notice. New employees will also work from home with the exception of those who have been deemed 'essential' and are required to be on campus. All recruiting activities including interviews and onboarding are being conducted virtually.

To protect the health and safety of community members on campus and to comply with the recommendations from public health authorities and requirements of the provincial government, Ryerson, like other post-secondary institutions in Ontario, will require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit proof of vaccination.

title: newPlumber
description:
Are you a Journeyman Plumber looking for a new and exciting opportunity? Here at Broadstreet Properties, we are currently looking for a Plumber to be responsible for the maintenance and repairs associated with plumbing of our multi-family residential apartment buildings!

Your contribution to the team includes:

  • Tend to service calls
  • Tend to the maintenance and preventative maintenance programs, including maintaining and cleaning of all plumbing equipment
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance
  • Maintain a supply of regularly used parts and filters in stock, ordering replenishment as necessary.
  • Propose changes or modifications to plans to enhance operation and efficiency of systems plans and specifications for sanitation facilities.
  • Develop goals and priorities; assign tasks and projects
  • Ensure accuracy and completion of assigned tasks and projects
  • Keep detailed and accurate maintenance reports and documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology, compliance and repair techniques
  • Train site staff on mechanical systems

What you need to be successful:

  • Red Seal Plumber certification
  • Minimum 5 years' experience as a Journeyman/Journeyperson Plumber
  • Leadership experience considered an asset
  • 5th Class Power engineering or Gas fitter A an asset
  • Experience servicing boilers, hot water tanks and make up air units
  • Possess a valid driver's license and reliable vehicle
  • Willing and able to travel as required
  • Effective communication both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work well independently under pressure in a busy environment
  • Experience with routine maintenance operations
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times
  • Proficient computer skills
  • Able to travel to southern Alberta regularly
  • Proof of COVID-19 vaccination

The perks:

  • Employer paid extended health, vision, and dental coverage (including family)
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
  • Yearly health and wellness benefit
  • RPP eligibility after one year
  • Employee recognition program

Why Broadstreet?

Broadstreet Properties is a family owned and operated property management company partnered with Seymour Pacific Developments to build apartment and townhome communities. We are a growing organization made up of diverse individuals who are driven to innovate our approach to asset management. We consider employee wellbeing a priority and are dedicated to protecting the health and safety of our teams while ensuring a workplace that is respectful of everyone. Broadstreet Properties Ltd. practices equal opportunity and safe hiring processes when filling positions, and hires only the most qualified individuals.

title: newJourneyperson Pipefitter - 1 Year Term - 2 Positions
location: Temporarily Remote in McClean Lake, SK
description:
General information

Organization

As a sustainable uranium producer, Orano Canada is committed to safety, environmental protection and contributing to the prosperity and well-being of neighbouring communities.

We have been exploring for uranium, developing mines and producing uranium concentrate for more than 55 years. Headquartered in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, we are a leading producer of uranium in Canada. The Orano-operated McClean Lake mill is a unique facility and the most technologically advanced mill in the world for the processing of high-grade uranium ore without dilution.

We value the knowledge, experience and cultures and commit to the advancement of Indigenous Peoples, Women, Visible Minorities and People with Disabilities, and strongly encourage all candidates from these designated groups to apply for our exciting career opportunities.

Job details

Position title

Journeyperson Pipefitter - 1 Year Term - 2 Positions

Job description

Responsibilities include:

  • Will work as part of a team to ensure the safe and efficient production of the mill
  • Maintain the mill piping and propane systems, and modify or construct piping as required
  • Follow piping diagrams
  • Maintain a safe and organized working environment
  • Follow company procedures and comply with the practices of our work order management system
  • Embrace and support Operational Excellence efforts and OE Culture
  • Comply with all Orano health, safety and environmental policies, practices and procedures
  • Promote and adhere to Orano Canada’s values: Customer Satisfaction, Continuous Improvement, Respect and People Development, Cohesion and Team Spirit, and Exemplarity, Integrity, Responsibility


Work Location & Schedule:

  • McClean Lake
  • 14 day in/ 14 day out rotating schedule
  • Normally an 11 hour work day, although some activity outside of normal working hours may be required
  • This position requires moderate physical ability


Fly Day- This position will fly in and fly out on Wednesday


Pick-Up Points: Saskatoon, Prince Albert, La Ronge, Buffalo Narrows and the designated communities in the Athabasca region of Camsell Portage, Uranium City, Stony Rapids, Fond du Lac, and Wollaston.


Orano is responsible for providing a healthy and safe workplace. As part of this, Orano employees, contractors and visitors at Orano offices, field sites and operations are required to be fully vaccinated. All new hires will require proof of vaccination as a condition of their employment.


“Fully vaccinated” means two weeks after a person has received a single dose of a single course COVID-19 vaccination approved for use in Canada, or two weeks after a person has received the second dose of a dual course COVID-19 vaccination approved for use in Canada.


As a condition of employment the successful candidate must complete Orano’s pre-employment checks including education verification and employment reference checks.


Drug (including marijuana) and alcohol substance testing is a requirement for all Safety Sensitive positions. Applicants who have recently used marijuana recreationally may not pass a substance test as marijuana can remain in the user’s system for as many as 30 days after use.


Orano is an equal opportunity employer. We value the knowledge, experience and cultures and commit to the advancement of Indigenous Peoples, Women, Visible Minorities and People with Disabilities and strongly encourage all candidates from these designated groups to apply for our career opportunities.

Skills and Qualifications

Skills and Qualifications for the position include:

  • Interprovincial Journeyperson pipefitter or plumber’s ticket is required
  • Saskatchewan General Gas Fitters ticket is required
  • Ability to follow piping diagrams is required
  • Experience with industrial piping materials such as HDPE, CPVC, FRP, SS and Victaulic is an asset
  • Industrial maintenance experience is an asset
  • Ability to work with minimum supervision at times
  • Ability to work as part of a diverse maintenance team
  • Willing to assist other trades in the completion of their duties
  • Physically capable of working 11 hour a day in many different work environments and conditions
  • Preference will be given to qualified Residents of Saskatchewan’s North (RSN)

Job type

Fixed term

Length of contract (in months)

1 Year Term

Employment classification

Union

Shift

Day job

Professions

Maintenance

Applications will be accepted until

5/23/2022

Additional job details

Overtime status

Non-exempt

Location of position

Job location

America / Caribbean / Canada, Canada, Saskatchewan

Geolocation by area

No

Adress

McClean Lake

Additional information

Telework

Telework not possible

Candidate criteria

Education level

Technical Diploma

Experience level

3 - 5 Years

Travel

No

title: Mechanical Fitter (Gear box fitter)
description:
Company description

Hofmann Engineering Pty Ltd was established in 1969 as a family business by the two brothers John P and Erich F Hofmann. It has grown, developed and diversified to become one of Australia’s foremost manufacturers of specialist engineered equipment.

The Hofmann Group of Companies operate from sites in Australia, Chile, Peru, China, India and North America.

Engineering excellence, innovation, quality and sustainability are the cornerstones of the Hofmannbusiness philosophy.

Key capabilities encompass high end design, product improvement manufacture, repair, refurbishment, onsite and emergency services of mining and industrial

equipment, gearing for heavy and light industries, precision engineering products, valves, special purpose tooling, specialist production-line and processing equipment & tooling

Job description

Job Description: Mechanical Fitter (Gear box fitter)

Location: Cambridge, ON

Summary/Objective:

Precise fit-out of gearboxes, pumps and valves; balancing and testing; assembly of equipment plus associated components and general fitting, as well as general Turning and Milling.

Responsibilities:

· Gear box rebuild and rebuild sections

· Ensure sufficient task analysis is completed to carry work out safely.

· Perform assigned duties in a timely and safe manner.

· General machining including use of: Large and Small Centre Lathes, Milling Machines etc.

· General fitting including the use of: Gear reduction Units of all size and type & other Rotating Assemblies

· Coordinate and work in a team environment.

· Maintain and use equipment as designed.

· Ensure all work is carried out to quality Hofmann standards or other specification requirements and that documentation is completed on time.

· Adherence to Company procedures.

· Application of fine tolerance to machined surfaces when fitting bearings, gearing, seals etc. to shafts and hubs with respect to heating/freezing techniques and the like.

· Ability to inspect, analysis and record critical mechanical information during the process of undertaking mechanical refurbishment work; this critical information would include the interpretations of wear and tear, mechanical damage to Gears, Shafts, Housing etc. recording of end floats, preloads, gear train, backlashes, tooth contacts and other at the start and completion of every refurbishment.

· Ability to make rough sketch and accurately measure mechanical components from Gearboxes other Drive Equipment.

· Perform mechanical repairs, manufacture components and other duties as directed by the Manager.

Qualifications:

· Machine Fitter Trade certification / Mechanical Technician / Millwright/Industrial Mechanic preferred

· 5 years experience including general machining and or knowledge of gearboxes, pumps, valves, mining equipment.

· Sound knowledge of Quality processes.

· Preferable welding and gas cutting competency.

· Previous experience with the installation, assembly, maintenance, or repair of equipment.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $30.00-$35.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Assembler Fitter
description:
Positions available at Soucy Plastiques, Soucy International, Soucy Caoutchouc


WHY JOIN US?

  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Shift: evening, night and weekend shifts
  • Salary: up to $26.00/hr depending on experience and skills
  • Varied shift premium of up to $2.50/hr depending on the shift
  • Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan
  • Personal and floating vacations
  • Employee and family assistance program
  • Safe work environment
  • Social activities.

HOW WILL YOU BE SPENDING YOUR TIME?

Are you physically fit and do you like mechanics? Then... We have a great opportunity for you!

  • Set up, prepare, repair, polish and handle molds on presses;
  • Carry out production starts and quality validations;
  • Calibrate temperature adjustments during mold production.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Possess a professional degree (electromechanic, mechanic, plasturgy etc.);
  • Master the mechanical, hydraulic, electrical and pneumatic aspects of manufacturing processes (good mechanical skills);
  • Ability to read plans, write and interpret information related to maintenance mechanics.

Even if you have little experience, don't hesitate to send us your application, our team will be there for you!


WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR TO APPLY?

We look forward to getting to know you and working with you!

title: newAssembler / Fitter
description:
Job Summary:

This position is for an Assembler with production experience in fit-up and fine adjustments, enjoys working with their hands, self-motivated, attentive to detail, and takes pride in achieving performance excellence.

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Demonstrates excellence in performing complex mechanical and electrical assemblies.
  • Ability to multitask
  • Knowledge of impellers, shafts, gearboxes, and bushings installation and fine adjustments.
  • Completes fit-up, welding, grinding, deburring, and polishing operations
  • Interpret assembly drawings, work order instructions, procedure manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions.
  • Complete standardized written documentation and forms.
  • Uses appropriate inspection gauges.
  • Report deviations from specifications and tolerances to supervisor.
  • Maintain inspection records and complete inspection reports.
  • Reports any malfunctions or equipment problems to management.
  • The job requires the use of hand/powered tools, wires, fixtures, parts, sub-assemblies, and operation of overhead crane and pallet jack.
  • Adheres to all company policies and procedures paying special attention to health and safety procedures.
  • Maintains clean, orderly, and safe work areas.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:

  • Physical:
    • Sitting, Standing, and Walking.
    • Carrying, Stooping, Lifting and Reaching.
    • Lifting Requirements: Up to 50 pounds.
  • Mental
    • Math.
    • The use of the English language, both Oral and Written.
    • Requires daily communication with multiple departments to insure maximum efficiency

Education & Training:

  • OSSD High School Diploma or GED required
  • Technical School Diploma, Trade Certificate or Equivalent Certificate of Qualifications
  • CWB Welding certificate is an asset
  • TSSA Certified Carbon and Stainless is an asset
  • Previous Certification Forklift and Overhead Crane
  • Advanced Math, including geometry and trigonometry


Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum 3 years with rotary equipment and complex assemblies
  • Familiarity with Duplex, Ni-hard, Alloy 20 is a plus
  • Knowledge of both manual and electrical tools
  • Understanding of metrology
  • Proficient knowledge and ability to read engineering drawings
  • Exceptional communication and technical skills
  • Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Proficient in English language, both Oral and Written.
  • Self-starter who takes initiative and maintains excellent follow-through and follow-up.
  • Performs well in a fast-paced environment and can multitask with ease.
  • Requires daily communication with multiple departments to insure maximum efficiency

Working Conditions:

  • Hours of operation: 2:30pm to 11:00pm

Benefits:

  • Competitive Wage
  • Vacation Pay
  • Holiday Pay
  • Medical/Dental and Vision Benefits
  • Pension Plan


Company Profile:

The Hayward Gordon Group is a manufacturer and supplier of innovative fluid handling systems, mixers, pumps, and parts. We aspire to ISO quality standards for each of our businesses. For over 60 years we have been a highly valued partner to our worldwide customers, providing engineered solutions for difficult applications. Our proven designs are installed in the mineral processing, municipal, chemical, sanitary, oil & gas and general industrial markets.

We are focused on maximizing value for our stakeholders, through a growth strategy that includes expanded market coverage, active product development, and synergistic acquisitions. We value our employees by promoting a culture that fosters personal and professional growth, in a safe working environment.

The Hayward Gordon group of companies is committed to employment equity and maintaining a diverse workforce, and does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, marital status or disability status in its employment actions, decisions, policies, and practices.


Afternoon shift 2:30pm to 11:00pm
Based on 40 hour work week
OT as required

title: Fitter/Welder
description:
Marwood Ltd. is a dynamic producer of value added forest products for residential, commercial and industrial construction industries. With several operations in Atlantic Canada, we serve markets throughout North America and Europe. Located just outside of Fredericton, in Tracyville, NB, Marwood Ltd is currently seeking applicants for a

Fitter / Welder

Working with the maintenance team, the key responsibilities include Fitting/Welding duties across Marwood as well as reading blue print and sketches proficiently to fabricate equipment and make modifications.

This position requires a candidate who is reliable, well organized and can work with minimal supervision. The successful candidate must be committed to ensure safe work practices are continuously followed. Candidates should have 5+ years experience and their Trade certification in Welding and/or Fitting with valid tickets/certifications. Experience pressure piping and working in an Industrial environment would be considered an asset.

If you are interested in joining the Marwood team, please submit your resume by Friday, April, 1st, 2022.

Marwood Ltd.

title: Apprentice Sprinkler Fitter
description:
*MUST BE AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY*

**MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL**

Summary

The Sprinkler Fitter, under the direction of the Mechanical Director, is primarily responsible for fitting pipes, specifically on sprinkler systems. The incumbent designs and installs sprinkler systems, hose systems, fire mains and underground systems. The Sprinkler Fitter tests and troubleshoots systems for issues or leaks.

Core Competencies

· Analytical Thinking

· Communication

· Critical Thinking

· Decision Making

· Planning and Organizing

· Problem Solving

· Results Orientation

Job Duties

· Install overhead sprinkler systems, hose systems, fire mains, underground systems, etc., in accordance with building and fire codes

· Test installed systems

· Repair any defective, worn or broken system parts

· Select correct pipe size and required materials as per design specifications

· Measure and mark pipes for cutting

· Fit and prepare pipes

· Assemble and secure pipes, tubes, fittings, etc.

· Fabricate and weld pipes and attach to fixtures

· Install clamps, brackets and hangers to support piping and sprinkling systems

· Connect piping systems to water mains, supply tanks, pumps and compressors

· Help complete preventive maintenance for sprinkler systems

· Clean, maintain and update current sprinkler systems

· Test and troubleshoot systems for leaks using testing equipment

· Other duties as assigned

Requirements
· Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner

· Effective verbal and listening communication skills

· Time management skills

· Mathematical and analytical skills necessary for pipefitting

· Ability to read building specifications and blueprints

· Ability to work well independently or as a member of a team

Qualifications
· Working with tools, pipes and materials

· Ability to lift and manipulate objects of up to 50 lbs.

· Proper use of personal protection equipment (e.g., hard-hat, safety boots, etc.)

· Ability to identify hazards associated with the industry

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $17.50-$28.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Apprentice Sprinkler Fitter: 2 years (preferred)
  • Residential Sprinkler Fitter: 2 years (preferred)
  • Commercial Sprinkler Fitter: 2 years (preferred)
  • Industrial Sprinkler Fitter: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class 5 Drivers Licence (preferred)

Willingness to travel:

  • 75% (preferred)

title: newMechanical Maintenance and Construction Foreman
description:
Under the direction of the Supervisor of Building Maintenance, the Mechanical Maintenance and Construction Foreman maintains mechanical systems under the division’s jurisdiction by supervising, planning, estimating, coordinating, prioritizing, and evaluating of a staff of Journeyman Plumbers/Pipefitters, and Building Servicer 3 staff. The Mechanical Maintenance and Construction Foreman ensures these systems are functioning and that alterations and replacements performed by staff or contractors, under his/her authority, take place in a safe, efficient and effective manner.

Implements planned and emergency activities that are key to risk management, reliability and acceptability of building assets. This position is responsible for ensuring that the work section maintains all appropriate training, licenses, permits, materials, tools and procedures required to fulfill the duties in a safe and efficient manner.

The Mechanical Maintenance and Construction Foreman provides subject matter expertise related to the construction field. This position works with project officers, the division’s Mechanical Engineer, consultants and other professionals in the design, modification and analysis of mechanical systems.

This position is also responsible for the approximate 300 overhead door inventory and backflow prevention devices for approximately the City’s 900 buildings:

  • Responds on a 24-hour basis to ensure emergency vehicle egress
  • Maintains a list of overhead door contractors

As the Mechanical Maintenance and Construction Foreman you will:

  • Supervise Mechanical Maintenance and Construction staff and Contractors, for the installation and maintenance of mechanical systems. This includes routine, non-routine, projects and emergency work to ensure the safe mechanical, and overhead door operation of the City’s facilities.
  • Ensure compliance with safety regulations and safe work practices relative to the asset and staff.
  • Responsible for managing overhead door systems, and provide training to staff.
  • Prepare, in conjunction with other Branch staff, and executes preventative maintenance programs based on regulatory requirements and asset preservation to ensure overall safety of buildings.
  • Coordinate work performed by contractors and sub trades.
  • Responsible for supervision and continuous improvement for staff performance.
  • Perform other related duties consistent with the classification and works within policies and regulations established by the City/Department.

Your education and qualifications include:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Possession of a Journeyman Steamfitter/Pipefitter (Red Seal) would be considered an asset.
  • Five (5) years’ experience coordinating and maintaining a wide variety of buildings.
  • Successful completion of Levels I, II and III of City of Winnipeg’s Foremanship Training Program.
  • Experience with various mechanical building systems in old and new construction, designs, materials and ability to interface between existing and current practices.
  • Supervisory experience, including training and developing staff, organizing, coordinating and managing schedules and work.
  • Written communication skills with the ability prepare written reports, estimates and other correspondence.
  • Verbal communication skills with the ability to articulate information in a clear and concise manner.
  • Organizational skills with the ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks under tight timelines.
  • Interpersonal skills with the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal staff, suppliers, contractors and the general public.
  • Understanding of the principles of mechanical maintenance, operation and preservation.
  • Ability to maintain an inventory of tools and equipment necessary to analyze and maintain mechanical systems.
  • Ability to assist in the design and modification and commissioning of mechanical systems, provide subject matter expertise on mechanical systems/installation, and communicate that knowledge to laypersons, professionals and peers.
  • Ability to read and interpret technical materials such as blue prints, construction drawings and specifications.
  • Ability to prepare and submit estimates for time and material
  • Ability to problem solve, make decisions and recommendations.
  • Ability to operate the Work Management System (MAXIMO) and PeopleSoft’s Human Resources module.
  • Knowledge of the occupational hazards and the safety precautions and regulations (Workplace Health & Safety Act) that are applicable to the mechanical work.
  • Knowledge of the Manitoba Building Code, Canadian Plumbing Code, Backflow Prevention Code and bylaws.

Conditions of employment:

  • The successful applicant must maintain legal eligibility to work in Canada. If the successful applicant possesses a work permit, it is their responsibility to ensure the permit remains valid.
  • Prior to commencement of employment, the successful applicant will be required to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination by providing a Government of Manitoba issued QR code and photo identification.
  • Police Information Check satisfactory to the employer will be required from the successful candidate, at their expense. To obtain a Police Information Check, please visit www.winnipeg.ca/police.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Class 5 Manitoba Driver’s License.
  • Must possess a St. John’s Ambulance Emergency First Aid Certificate or willingness and ability to obtain it within three (3) months.
  • Must possess a Plumbers Contractors License or willingness and ability to obtain it within twelve (12) months.
  • Must possess a Backflow Inspection Ticket or willingness and ability to obtain it within twelve (12) months.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Journeyman Plumber Certificate recognized by the Province of Manitoba.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid Gas Fitter “B” License.
  • Must possess or immediately obtain a valid Service Person’s License from Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service (for gas work).
  • Must successfully complete the City of Winnipeg Transportation of Dangerous Goods.
  • Must be physically capable of performing the duties of the position, including the ability to lift weights in excess of 50lbs and working outdoors in adverse weather conditions.

CORE COMPETENCIES FOR ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE CITY OF WINNIPEG:

  • Citizen & Customer Focus
  • Respecting Diversity
  • Ethics and Values
  • Integrity and Trust
  • Results Oriented

title: HVAC Maintenance Mechanic (UN)
description:
Job Details

What you will do:

Are you looking to increase your HVAC knowledge and learn firsthand from some of the top HVAC teams?

Our team will give you this opportunity, in addition, we provide factory certification through our Service Technical Academy (STA) with milestone recognition and monetary rewards and advancement, increased incentive opportunity for executed pull-through work, top of the line technology, equipment and uniforms and a #1 focus on employee safety. We will equip you with tools and a vehicle to perform your job at the highest standard.

Under leadership direction, you will work on the truck-based team, providing routine, periodic service, and inspections on Mechanical HVAC equipment at customer sites.

In addition, this role entails working on commercial sites, performing inspections, maintenance and assisting with repairs.

How you will do it:

  • Change and Service Filters
  • Oil and Grease Bearings
  • Perform Belt adjustment and replacement services.
  • Perform Cooling Tower and Condenser Maintenance (coils, evaporators, and tubes)
  • Operate maintenance tasks using basic hand tools as needed.
  • Perform Indoor Air Quality related maintenance including but not limited to the cleaning of duct systems and drain pans.
  • Transport rigging equipment to and from sites as needed.
  • Assist HVAC Journeymen as needed.

Qualifications - External

What we look for or require:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Familiarity with HVAC equipment and hand tools a plus.
  • Refrigeration certification a plus but not required for this entry-level position.
  • Must have (or be in the process of pursuing) at least a G3 gas fitter's license.
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently.
  • This position requires a current clean driver's license/abstract.
  • Must be a good standing member with the LOCAL 787 UNION

Canada Diversity Statement

Information obtained from the questions below will allow Johnson Controls to track the diversity of our applicants, employee training opportunities, promotions and employee retention in order to identify and remove barriers to employment and advancement. With your consent, you may also be contacted by the employment equity officer to get your opinions about Employment Equity (EE) Programs.

You have the right to review, correct, or change information relating to you at any time and you can be assured that the information will not be used for unauthorized purposes.

Please note that a person may belong to more than one designated group.

Your response to the self-identification questionnaire below is voluntary. It is however mandatory to answer the questions, even if you choose not to provide the information.

The responses that you provide on this form will be confidentially retained for statistical purposes.

This survey is available in alternative formats. Please do not hesitate to request.

Persons with disabilities are those that have a long-term or recurring physical, mental, sensory, psychiatric or learning impairment and who consider themselves to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, or believe that an employer or potential employer is likely to consider them to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment. This also includes persons whose functional limitations owing to their impairment have been accommodated in their current job or workplace.

An Aboriginal person is a North American Indian, Métis, or Inuit and/or a Treaty Indian or a Registered Indian and/or member of an Indian Band/First Nation.

Members of visible minorities are persons, other than Aboriginal peoples, who are non-Caucasian in race or non-white in colour, regardless of birthplace.
