title: newContinuing, full-time, Plant Mechanic
description:
A willingness and ability to work any recognized shift, including weekends, is expected. From time to time, hours of work may be adjusted to suit operational needs.

The modified work schedule is available for this position.

UVic contributes to you and your family’s health and wellness through comprehensive medical, dental and pension benefits. We also offer:

  • generous vacation time;
  • generous leave compensation including maternity, parental, adoption, sick, and personal;
  • equity and diversity support and initiatives including religious observances
  • on-site childcare: infant – 5 years
  • discounted athletic facility memberships
  • sustainability initiatives, including discounted transit passes
  • support through our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
  • funding for career development and a diverse range of learning and development opportunities
  • tools and resources to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance
Job Summary

As stewards of the campus, Facilities Management fosters and enriches an inviting and functional environment that welcomes and supports all who come here. Facilities Management clients include faculty, staff and students. As part of Facilities Management the Mechanical Shop reflects high service delivery standards and requirements. The team works together to ensure effective, efficient and safe performance for the operation, maintenance and repair of building systems on campus.

Under general supervision, the Plant Mechanic will provide journeyperson or technician level skills in any one of the following trades: machinist; pipe/steam fitter; millwright (industrial mechanic); power engineer (min 3rd class); pipefitter/welder(pressure); or refrigeration/air conditioning or other similar trade or technical qualification suitable to UVic Facilities Management as defined by the Industrial Training Authority of BC (ITA), BC Safety Authority and/or recognized licensing or training institutions.The Plant Mechanic will fabricate, install, alter, repair and/or service any plant mechanical system or equipment designed for the purposes of heating and/or cooling (transfer of heat energy) or other mechanical or hydraulic energy. Includes work such as piping, gas-fitting, controls and electrical work related to this classification of equipment and where licensed and qualified by the relevant jurisdiction(s) as having authority to do this work.

Regulated work shall be performed only by incumbents holding required qualifications. The incumbent also performs related duties of similar scope and complexity in collaboration or independently within a multidisciplinary shop and full service facilities department which provides such services as plant and facilities engineering maintenance services. The incumbent will also assist in emergent situations, as reasonably declared by employer, within the physical and skill capacity of the individual.

Shall conform to all best practices in relation to UVic, regulated and industry standards of work and behaviors, including compliance to Worksafe BC regulations.

Job Requirements

Skills:

  • Ability to use initiative and varied trade skills in diagnosing and effecting repairs.
  • Ability to carry out an effective work schedule, under general supervision and utilize materials and equipment for maximum benefit.
  • Ability to plan and organize work efficiently.
  • Ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with faculty, staff and students.
  • Ability to operate and maintain control systems.
  • Literate in the use of personal computers and the MS office suite.
  • Ability to use resources and supplies in an efficient and cost effective manner.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
  • Ability to use hand and fixed power tools effectively (both fixed and portable) i.e. tools associated with mechanical trades including multi meters and other diagnostic equipment.
  • Competency in soldering, brazing, tack and cutting (with torch or electric).


As a staff member, this role should demonstrate UVic's Core Competencies which include Personal Effectiveness, Commitment to Quality, Navigating Change, Communication, Building Equitable Relationships, Teamwork, Service Focus, and University Community. These competencies represent the skills, knowledge and behaviours required to advance the initiatives of the unit/department and the university.



Specialized Knowledge/Education:

  • Completion of an approved apprenticeship or training program acceptable to employer.
  • Millwright (Industrial Mechanic); Pipe/steam Fitter; Power Engineering 3rd Class; Pipefitter/Welder (Pressure) or Refrigeration & A/C Mechanic TQ or related mechanical trade or occupation within HVAC industry.
  • Extensive institutional HVAC experince or equivalent.
  • Ammonia plant experience desirable.


For All Crafts:

  • BC or IP Red Seal Trade or Certificate of Qualification.
  • Valid British Columbia driver's license.
  • Good physical health, sufficient strength, stamina and coordination to perform a variety of routine heavy manual and machine operation tasks continuously.


Experience:

  • 5 years at the journeyperson/technician level in applicable trade preferably in an institutional environment.


Additional Requirements:

  • Willingness and ability to work any recognized shift including weekends.
  • May be required to assist with departmental response to emergent and safety related concerns.

Equity and Diversity Statement

UVic is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our living, learning and work environments. In pursuit of our values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across levels of power. We actively encourage applications from members of groups experiencing barriers to equity.

Read our full equity statement here: www.uvic.ca/equitystatement.

Accessibility Statement

If you anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application and hiring process contact: uviccareers@uvic.ca Any personal information provided will be maintained in confidence.

COVID 19 On-Campus Requirements

The University of Victoria requires all students, staff and faculty coming to campus to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status. Your declaration is confidential and will be securely stored.

title: Plumber
description:
Marketing Statement

As the largest operating company in the integrated TransLink enterprise, Coast Mountain Bus Company (CMBC) operates a fleet of clean-fuel conventional and community shuttle buses, zero-emission trolley buses, and passenger ferry SeaBuses in Metro Vancouver, the largest single transit service area in Canada.

At CMBC, one of BC’s Top Employers, we're committed to providing an innovative, healthy, and engaging workforce. This is reflected in our workforce of over 5,500 employees performing over 400 unique jobs, who are committed and empowered to deliver service that attracts nearly 1.1 million passengers daily and connects people, businesses, and communities in the Metro Vancouver region.

We have the important job of helping our passengers get to work, appointments, visiting with family and friends, and back again every day. Metro Vancouver relies on us, and we take that as a point of pride.

Responsibilities

The installation, alteration or repair of any plumbing system, and includes all work usually done by a journeyman plumber who is governed by the BC Plumbing Code. Work such as installation and repair of piping, valves, pumps, fitting and fixtures associated with hot/cold water system, sewage system, hot water heating systems, and fuel and lubrication product delivery system. Also hydraulic hoists, air compressors, wash rack equipment and boilers.

Qualifications

Applicant must have Journeyman qualifications in the plumbing trade in the form of B.C. Trades Qualification (TQ) and/or Interprovincial certification. Possession of current BC Technical Safety “Class B” Gas Fitters License required, “Class A” would be an asset. Possession of a fire sprinkler installation ticket and or BCWWA Cross Connection Tester Licences would be an asset. A minimum of 2 years of progressive experience in an industrial/commercial building maintenance environment. A Class 5 driver’s licence is required. An up-to-date driver’s abstract must accompany application. Maximum 3 points in the past 2 years, and no more than 8 points in that last 5 years, no impaired convictions, roadside suspensions or prohibitions in the past 5 years.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy

To support public health, and protect the health and safety of our employees, customers, and their families, Coast Mountain Bus Company employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will need to provide proof of full vaccination status in compliance with the employer’s COVID-19 Safety Vaccination Policy.

Accommodations may be applicable under the BC Human Rights Code. Should an applicant be unable to provide proof of full vaccination and should an accommodation be requested, additional information will be required to determine whether the individual is entitled to be accommodated.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Rate of Pay

Wage: $47.72 per hour


The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How to Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner or go to https://www.translink.ca/About-Us/Careers.aspx to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: 27th April 2022
Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating and supporting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is free of all forms of discrimination. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, skills and perspectives.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@coastmountainbus.com

title: Supervisor, Plant Operations & Maintenance
description:
EllisDon is committed to being the safest employer. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture Team.

Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that our industry is changing at a rapid pace, and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers to one another and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most exciting projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of professionals with a variety of expertise within pre-construction, construction, and post-construction. To learn more, check out our Cradle to Grave services and hear from our Team directly about what a career at EllisDon could look like for you. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

Above all, we are a group of individuals with unique experiences and at EllisDon, we choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve to their full potential; to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another; and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.

In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some of the impacts we've made to the communities we work in.

You as Supervisor, Plant Operations & Maintenance will:

  • Assist in planning, control and supervision of maintenance work and operation of all base building systems as well as interior and exterior building components at the Brampton Civic Hospital.
  • Ensuring the continuity of all services through availability of redundant equipment and the shift staff who are employed on a 24/7 basis as well as the various tradespeople who provide maintenance and repair service to the physical plant and building’s elements.
  • Oversees daily routine and preventive maintenance works are completed on time and will play a key role in the development of preventive maintenance routines, frequencies and schedules, ensures the efficient utilization of manpower, supplies, utilities and equipment in a cost-effective manner while providing quality service delivery to all patients, staff and visitors at the hospital.
  • They participate in a staff hiring, promotion, demotion and disciplinary process and provides appropriate training to the new employees.
  • Will also coordinate external contractors work for a variety of repairs and maintenance projects as well as assists in development and control of departmental annual budget and assessing all conditions and modifications to the plant equipment and buildings to identify life cycle capital projects.

Is this the right role for you?

  • Minimum of 3 years previous supervisory experience
  • Valid Ontario second class stationary engineer or Building operator certificate or trade license (Millwright, Electrician, Plumber or Steam Fitter)
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to read, write and speak English fluently
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Proven leadership skills with excellent coaching, interpersonal and emotional intelligence skills
  • Excellent computer skills (excel, word, etc)
  • Preferred experience in CMMS’s and experience in a preventative maintenance management program
  • Preferred college or university level education with equivalent work related knowledge of building operations & maintenance OR a valid Ontario third class stationary engineers certificate OR a trade license (Millwright, Electrician, Refrigeration Mechanic)
  • Ability to read mechanical, electrical and control drawings; knowledge of building automation systems, life safety system, electrical systems and HVAC including boiler, chiller, cooling tower, pumps, motors, heat exchanger and AHU.
  • Preferred previous experience in a hospital or healthcare setting
  • Experience supervising under the conditions of a collective agreement in a unionized environment
  • An enthusiastic approach to leadership

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to Inclusive Diversity.

Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

title: newPlumber
description:
EllisDon is committed to being the safest general contractor. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated, or in the process of receiving the vaccine against COVID-19. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture team.
Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter
Thinking about a change?
We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers to one another and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most exciting projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of professionals with a variety of expertise within pre-construction, construction, and post-construction. To learn more, check out our Cradle to Grave services and hear from our team directly about what a career at EllisDon could look like for you. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.
Above all, we are a group of individuals with unique experiences and at EllisDon, we choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve to their full potential; to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another; and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.
In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some of the impacts we've made to the communities we work in.
As a Plumber, you will:

  • Inspect, install, repair and replace pipes, fittings and plumbing fixtures to maintain domestic hot and cold water system, heating water system, medical air piping system, drainage system and hospital related plumbing fixtures such as water cooled patient care machinery, sterilizers, bed pan washer, macerator, etc. throughout the hospital including patient rooms and treatment areas.
  • Will also perform an effective preventative maintenance and maintain all aforementioned equipment in a good working condition.
  • The Sault Area Hospital COVID-19 Health Care Worker management policy will require all our new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to starting with us. For clarity, fully vaccinated means 14 days after completion of your vaccine series. The Occupational Health team at Sault Area Hospital requires evidence of compliance prior to you starting with us. If you are not fully vaccinated, our Occupational Health team can assist you with setting up the necessary appointments to become fully vaccinated. In addition, our policy allows for consideration of accommodations based on the Ontario Human Rights Code when appropriate documentation is submitted.

*
Is this the right role for you?*

  • Grade 12 Diploma
  • Valid Ontario Plumbing Certificate
  • Preferred valid Ontario Steam Fitter Certificate
  • Ability to read Mechanical (plumbing and piping) blueprints
  • Must be able to perform various maintenance tasks within your skill set and experience
  • Experience with Automation, Electrical, Electronics, Mechanical would be an asset
  • May be required to undertake work on shift schedule
  • Ability to gather information, accurately assess issues, seek support and take direction as necessary
  • Team player and experience in performance based service delivery and have strong customer service
  • Ability to work in fast-paced environment and quickly develop working relationships with a broad range of individuals, both internally and externally
  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience
  • Ability to read, write and speak English fluently
  • Must have excellent written & verbal communication skills
  • Excellent attendance, punctuality and work record required
  • Ability to demonstrate EllisDon Facilities Services (SAH) Inc.’s core values
  • Candidate must show documented proof of completing Worker H&S Awareness Training

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.
Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!
We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be* your* commitment to Inclusive Diversity.
**Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.
We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

Behaviors
Preferred

  • Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Job Type: Full-time

title: Regular Part Time - Facilities Maintenance Technician
description:
FACILITIES MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN - PERMANENT PART TIME

Every other weekend 0800am-600pm - 20 hours per pay

Starting hourly rate $27.68

DUTIES:

This position requires a self-motivated individual who can work effectively with minimum supervision. Must possess excellent customer service skills and be able to interact with residents, co-workers and visitors. Involvement in all aspects of building operations including monitoring of building environment and equipment, energy management, maintenance of life safety equipment, preventive/predictive maintenance, electrical systems, plumbing systems, fire and emergency plans. While performing any and all duties of the position the employee will work in a safe and healthy manner and will follow the regulations outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act as outlined in the organization Health & Safety Policy, Infection Control and safe work procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to read, write and follow oral and written instructions in English

  • Current valid driver's license.

title: Gas Fitter
description:
Our corporate client is looking to hire foreign workers for the Gas Fitter position in a Toronto’s leading HVAC Contractor and Gas Maintenance Services Company.

We are currently looking for 5 talented Gas Fitters for a full-time position. The successful candidates will be working closely with dedicated staff and experts in the industry.
As Gas Fitter, you would be performing the following on a regular basis:

  • Study drawings and specifications to determine the layout of the installation, maintenance, and materials required
  • Measure and mark reference points for installation and maintenance of gas lines and equipment
  • Perform complete diagnostic, repair and maintenance and replace faulty equipment or components
  • Perform detailed inspections for future installations and scheduled maintenance and refer to manufacturer’s manuals while following all applicable building codes
  • Install and maintain gas meters and regulators and gas lines
  • Install, maintain and service gas heating units and their components
  • Test and adjust connections for gas leaks and ensure that all services performed pass company standards
  • Prepare reports on work performed and condition of facilities
  • Work under the supervision of management and advise clients regarding standards, safety features and maintenance of gas units and systems
  • May convert motor vehicles or appliances to use natural gas fuels
  • May repair and service gas appliances and related equipment.


Requirements

  • Completion of a two- or three-year gas fitter apprenticeship program OR several years of work experience (minimum of 2) in a pipefitting trade and completion of a high school, college or industry gas fitter program are required
  • Gas Fitter license is an asset
  • Excellent organizational, customer service and time management skills,
  • Ability to excel working in an extremely fast-paced environment
  • Good English language skills


Benefits

  • Support with getting Permanent Residency in Canada after 1 - 2 years of work will be provided
  • Full-time, permanent position
  • Benefits: WSIB, Vacation pay (as per ESA)
  • Location of Work: Locations across GTA

title: Sprinkler Fitter
description:
Rotaflow is Western Canada’s premier EPCM firm, specializing in fire protection services and solutions. Offering a professional level of service, quality, and reliability to our clients throughout Western Canada for 25 years. We are trusted by some of the world’s largest energy companies such as: Suncor, Enbridge, Gibson Energy, Husky, and Cenovus. We are proud members of APEGA, leaders in engineering best practices and quality of work, and handle complex projects with confidence and ease as a result of our span of experience and expertise.
We are seeking a Journeyperson Sprinkler Fitter to work at upcoming projects in 2022, Accommodations in Fort McMurray may be provided.

The Sprinkler Fitter will report to the Shift Supervisor. This role provides service and inspection of fire sprinkler systems and components in commercial and industrial fire protection and will perform both routine and preventive maintenance on systems including wet and dry systems, pre-action systems, fire pumps, fire hydrants, backflow preventers and special hazard systems.

Responsibilities:
  • Conducting inspections, testing, troubleshooting, repairing and/or replacing varied equipment and systems according to NFPA guidelines, including water-based fire protection systems, wet and anti-freeze sprinkler systems, electrical alarm sensors, dry fire sprinkler systems, fire hydrants, backflow preventers and special hazard systems and testing of gauges, standpipes, hoses and valves.
  • Locating test connections, risers, sprinkler locations, and alarm panels to conduct testing of facility.
  • Perform code mandated commissioning and recurring maintenance testing of fire and life safety systems.
  • Reviewing plans and specifications, and preparing cost estimates for labour and materials for installation projects.
  • Perform commissioning and Startup of Main Firewater Lines, Standpipe and Hose Systems.
  • Perform of all aspects of a weekly, monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, annual and bi-annual preventative maintenance activities on Fire pump, fire hydrants, hoses, Standpipes, PIV & Monitors.
  • Perform Hydrant test including flush test, glycol removal and glycol fill-in.
  • Perform Fire Suppression system inspections and testing.
  • Perform Annual Oil Change, Annual Flow Test, Annual inspections and tests on Sprinkler Pipe and Fittings, Standpipe, Hose Connections and Control Valve (PIVs inclusive).
  • Perform 2-yr and 3-yr maintenance on fire pump and fire water tanks.
  • Provide documented inspection reports on all maintenance, inspection, and tests activities through BRC reporting system.
  • Perform work in accordance with company and client’s safety procedures as well as O.H. & S. Acts and Regulations.
  • Attend to emergency calls.
  • Actively Participate in the development of JHA’s and Safe Work Practices relevant to the position.
  • Assist in the installation, maintenance, and operation of Fire systems and components.
Qualifications:
What do we value?
  • Red Seal Journeyman Sprinkler Fitter with 1-3 plus years industry experience.
  • Fire Pump Operations and Maintenance Training certification required.
  • Experience in testing and servicing Fire Pumps, PIV, Standpipes and Fire Hydrants.
  • Experienced in the Install/ Service/ Repair of Wet and dry pr- action, deluge and specialty Fire Suppression Systems.
  • Experience in Water-Based Fire Protection Systems.
  • Good oral/ written communications & Good computer skills
  • knowledge of NFPA 25, the Standard for Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance of Water-Based Fire Protection systems.
  • CFAA is an asset.
Condition of employment would require sign up with the Local 488 upon hiring, and continued employment remains being part of the Local 488.

Core Values
It is crucial for Rotaflow to ensure that all Employees not only have the training, experience, and skills to achieve their goals, but to ensure that they are aware and aligned with our core values. Rotaflow has five core values that are essential to every aspect of our business.

They are:
1. SAFETY FIRST
2. ONE TEAM SPIRIT
3. CUSTOMER-CENTRIC
4. CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT
5. ACCOUNTABLE.
Please visit our website to learn more about our company.

Rotaflow embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe diversity drives innovation. Please visit our website to learn more about our company.

Safety is a core value at Rotaflow and we are committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of our employees, clients, subcontractors, and communities. As such, all employees joining Rotaflow will be required to produce proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 prior to their start date. Rotaflow will provide reasonable accommodation if you are the successful candidate and cannot be fully vaccinated on the basis of a protected ground under human rights legislation.

title: Structural Fitter - Day
description:
Would you like to work for an industry-leading structural steel provider?



Steelcon Fabrication Inc. is looking to augment our team with highly motivated individuals striving for a career development opportunity, one where they can make an impact and contribute to the growth and success of the company. We are especially interested in recruiting a Structural Fitter.


Based in Brampton, Ontario and reporting to the Plant Manager, Structural Fitter will be responsible for fabricating, assembling, and fitting structural steel while maintaining quality and accuracy in accordance with the drawings provided.

As a structural fitter, you will contribute to our team by:

  • Positioning, aligning, fitting, and welding parts to form complete units or subunits, following drawings, layout specifications, and other verbal and written instructions and diagrams.
  • Designing, assembling, and using jigs and fixtures to ensure efficient and accurate assembly.
  • Performing needed cutting, forming, and welding using appropriate equipment, consumables and hand tools.
  • Verifying that material components and finished product meet specifications.
  • Monitoring, cleaning, troubleshooting, adjusting, and performing required routine maintenance to maintain uptime and equipment reliability and tolerances.
  • Reporting major concerns and recommended solutions, as necessary.
  • Cleaning and de-burring components and finished product to achieve reliable weld and required quality finish.
  • Maintaining a safe, clean, and organized work environment.
  • Providing instructions to other personnel (e.g. material handler/labour) as required.
  • Complying with all safety protocols and procedures and adhere to all company practices, procedures, codes of conduct and participate in all Health and Safety training conducted by the company.
  • Contributing to team effort by performing other related tasks as needed.

What you will bring to this role:

  • 3+ years industrial experience
  • Experience in the structural fabrication environment is preferred
  • Ability to understand and read blueprints
  • Must be thoroughly familiar with the set up and operation of welding machine and other equipment and metal fabrication equipment
  • Possesses strong attention to detail
  • Team player with good interpersonal skills, work ethic, and a positive attitude.
  • Aware of and comply with all relevant safety policy and procedures


Working Conditions / Physical Demands

The individual should be able to work in a fast-paced environment while meeting all safety requirements. The work assigned must be completed correctly and in a timely manner. The individual must physically be able to lift materials up to 50 pounds.


We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Steelcon group of companies. However only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Steelcon group of companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to accommodating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants.

Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

title: HVAC/R Technician
description:
COLLINS HVAC/R is seeking a licensed 313A refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic with either a gas fitter 1 or 2 license for commercial & industrial HVAC/R installation, service & repair, and preventative maintenance. This is a full-time permanent position.

Minimum Requirements:

-313A Refrigeration License

-Gas Fitter 2 License (minimum)

-A full G Driver's License.

-Process and comfort cooling chiller experience is considered an asset.

Who we are:

-COLLINS HVAC/R Inc. was founded in 2018, by Chris and Marc Collins. With a combined experience of nearly 50 years in the HVAC/R industry, our mission is to build lasting relationships with our customers while providing quality workmanship at a fair price.

-We have a solid client base and steady work.

-Gas, Oil & Propane Licensed.

-GTAA Airside Access & Insured.

-TSSA Certified.

-WSIB Compliant.

Salary & Compensation:

-Up to $56.00/hour

-Benefits Program

-RRSP Matching Program

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $56.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have process & comfort cooling chiller experience ?

Experience:

  • HVAC & Refrigeration Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)
  • Gas 2 (minimum (preferred)
  • 313A Refrigeration & Air Conditioning (preferred)

title: Steamfitter
description:
Posting Period

Open: April 12, 2022

Closes: May 12, 2022


Department Description

Steamfitter - University Hospital

Reporting to the Coordinator Facilities Engineering, the steamfitter is responsible for the safe and adequate distribution of the steam and other process piping systems. This encompasses the installation, maintenance, repair and monitoring of each system and associated equipment.

Rate of Pay: $31.27/hour - $31.86/hour

Hours of Work: 37.5 hours per week

Qualifications

  • Current Provincial or Interprovincial Steamfitter’s Certificate of Qualification
  • Certificate of Qualification for Gas fitter II preferred
  • Minimum 4 years mechanical and/or industrial steamfitting experience, preferably within an institutional environment
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain sterilizers and other pressure vessels
  • Demonstrated experience with installation, maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of steam and process piping systems and equipment
  • Demonstrated ability to install, maintain and repair heating distribution systems and equipment such as, steam traps, expansion joints, PRV’s, converters, heat exchangers condensate receivers and pumps
  • Demonstrated a working knowledge of control systems and Building Automation Systems
  • Proficient at welding and soldering
  • Ability to work in confined spaces such as pits and tunnels
  • Familiar with Pressure Vessels Act, Occupational Health and Safety Act, current Asbestos and Confined Space regulations, WHMIS
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain a current awareness of technological advances and be familiar with drawings and specifications
  • Excellent interpersonal and communications skills and the ability to interact positively and effectively with patients, public and staff
  • Self-starter, conscientious, motivated with a willingness to learn, and take on additional responsibilities
  • Demonstrated strong problem solving & troubleshooting skills
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to the principles of patient and family centered care
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to patient and staff safety at LHSC
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to LHSC’s Mission, Vision and Values
  • Demonstrated ability to attend work on a regular basis
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to the principles of patient and family centered care
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to patient and staff safety at LHSC
  • Demonstrated practice and commitment to LHSC’s Mission, Vision and Values
  • Demonstrated ability to attend work on a regular basis

Immunizations Requirements:

Successful candidates will be required to complete a health review which includes providing vaccination records or proof of immunity against Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella(Chicken Pox). In addition candidates will need to provide documentation of Tuberculosis Skin testing and a completed COVID vaccine series (two vaccines).

We are committed to providing a safe, healthy and inclusive work environment that inspires respect. LHSC is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ2+ persons. We are committed to providing persons with disabilities equal opportunities and standards of goods and services, and are also fully compliant with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (2005), as applicable.

Your interest in this opportunity is appreciated. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates, as a condition of job offer, would be required to provide a satisfactory Police Information Check (original document) completed in the last 3 months.

Together we care, we learn, we discover.

title: Supervisor, Mechanical Services
description:
A willingness and ability to work any recognized shift, including weekends, is expected. From time to time, hours of work may be adjusted to suit operational needs.

The modified work schedule is available for this position.

This position requires related experience, a strong interest in and a good working knowledge of the equipment and best practices associated with the work done in Building Maintenance at the University of Victoria.

UVic contributes to you and your family’s health and wellness through comprehensive medical, dental and pension benefits. We also offer:

  • generous vacation time;
  • generous leave compensation including maternity, parental, adoption, sick, and personal;
  • equity and diversity support and initiatives including religious observances
  • on-site childcare: infant – 5 years
  • discounted athletic facility memberships
  • sustainability initiatives, including discounted transit passes
  • support through our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
  • funding for career development and a diverse range of learning and development opportunities
  • tools and resources to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance
  • reimbursement of tools that are stored on campus, per Collective Agreement
  • reimbursement for steel toed boots per Collective Agreement
Job Summary

As stewards of the campus, Facilities Management fosters and enriches an inviting and functional environment that welcomes and supports all who come here. Facilities Management clients include faculty, staff and students. Facilities Management reflects high service delivery standards and requirements. The team works together to ensure effective, efficient and safe performance for the operation, maintenance and repair of campus buildings.

Reporting to the Maintenance Manager, Mechanical, Plumbing, Electrical, Energy Systems and Controls, the Supervisor, Mechanical Services provides leadership to, and is responsible for the coordination of the following trade units within the Mechanical section: lead-hand (bld. systems mechanics), heavy duty mechanic, maintenance worker.

Job Requirements

Skills:

  • Demonstrated ability to supervise, motivate and coach others
  • Ability to use good judgment and experience to solve complex operational challenges
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Collaborative and constructive style
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, administration, clients, and the general campus community
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Proficient in the use of standard office hardware and software including MS Office (excel, word, outlook) and database applications (computerized maintenance management systems).
  • Effective use of modern business administration including financial/budget administration and basic accounting processes.
  • Dedication to industry standards and improvements, continuous learning and development and improvements

Specialized Knowledge/Education:

  • Interprovincial BC Red Seal Mechanical, an asset
  • Trade certification (pipe fitter, millwright, HVAC mechanic)
  • Training or education in the areas of leadership, management and supervision
  • Safety training and knowledge of applicable codes, standards and WorkSafeBC regulations
  • Valid BC Class 5 driver's licence
  • Gas Fitter qualification is desirable
  • Swimming Pool operator certification is desirable

Experience:

  • 10 years experience as a Mechanical Trade Worker
  • 5 years recent successful experience supervisory experience obtained in a unionized building trades or plant organization
  • Working knowledge of building mechanical systems
  • Delivering an effective plant and machinery maintenance program
  • Swimming Pool operation and maintenance
  • DDC controls systems and champion of energy efficiency

Preference may be given to experience gained in a post-secondary or similarly large, complex and unionized organization.

Where available, equivalent combination of training, education or related experience may be considered.



Additional Requirements:

Willingness to work any recognized shift, including weekends when required.

Equity and Diversity Statement

UVic is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our living, learning and work environments. In pursuit of our values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across levels of power. We actively encourage applications from members of groups experiencing barriers to equity.

Read our full equity statement here: www.uvic.ca/equitystatement.

Accessibility Statement

If you anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application and hiring process contact: uviccareers@uvic.ca Any personal information provided will be maintained in confidence.

COVID 19 On-Campus Requirements

The University of Victoria requires all students, staff and faculty coming to campus to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status. Your declaration is confidential and will be securely stored.

title: newJM Plate Fitter - Night Shift
description:
Weldco-Beales Manufacturing designs and manufactures specialized heavy equipment attachments for the construction, forestry, mining, scrap recycling, road maintenance and resource industries throughout Canada, the USA and internationally. Weldco prides itself on providing a great employee experience where safety is a way of life. Weldco-Beales is currently recruiting a Plate Fitter for the Edmonton manufacturing team. This position will report to the General Foreman.

Our Culture

Weldco-Beales prides itself on maintaining a strong culture of safety, hard work, and customer satisfaction. We embrace the values of safety, quality, and community. We are looking for hard working people who will stand behind our products and services to help us become the trusted leader in the heavy equipment industry.

What you will do:

  • Work with heavy plate steel to fit heavy machine attachments
  • Read and interpret blueprints
  • Fabricate steel weldments and use measuring instruments to fit heavy machine attachments
  • Assemble and fit metal sections and plates together to form complete units or sub-units
  • Fasten components together (by tack weld) in preparation for a welder to complete the process
  • Operate and use various other tools and hand grinders

Your qualifications:

  • Journeyman certification in welding and or plate fitting
  • A minimum of 3+ years related experience in the manufacturing industry
  • Experience plate fitting heavy machine attachments would be an asset
  • Overhead crane experience

What you bring to the position:

  • Knowledge of safe use of tools pertaining to a fabrication shop
  • Interpersonal skills to work collaboratively and cooperatively with others
  • Time management, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to lift items weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • Excellent safety record

If you feel you fit the overall profile, please clearly demonstrate this in your cover letter and resume when applying.

What we bring:

  • Multiple schedule options with shorter work weeks
  • Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package
  • Employee Assistance Program, MSP (BC)
  • Company Pension Plan with 3% company matching
  • Rewards:
    • monthly incentive program with monetary rewards
    • service awards in 5-year increments
    • company/team events
    • personal growth
    • career advancement opportunities
  • Education and apprenticeship support including EI top-up payments
  • A workplace that prides itself on safety, cleanliness, respect, and results.

Please Note: Successful candidates will undergo a pre-employment medical evaluation upon hiring.

Weldco Companies is a subsidiary of IDC (Inuvialuit Development Corporation) and is 100% Inuvialuit owned. Weldco provides Employment and Career Development opportunities for its beneficiaries and employees. As an equal opportunity employer, Weldco’s goal is for our employees to be as diverse as our products. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply. If you require accommodation at any point throughout this process we will work with you to meet your needs.

Applications for this position may be kept on file for twelve months and may be considered for future positions within Weldco or IDC. Your interest in Weldco is appreciated. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.



Monday - Thursday 4:00PM - 2:30AM
10 hours a day for 4 days with breaks

title: Maintenance Technician / Pipefitter
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.

How you will contribute

You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:

  • Operating machines with coaching
  • Safety and quality standards for operating machines
  • Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site
  • Collaborating well in a diverse work environment

What you need to know about this position:


Main Responsibilities

  • Maintenance and emergency repairs of oven system in process area requiring proven ability to braze, weld, work on pipe repairs in hot/humid environment

  • Maintaining, diagnosing issues and repairing steam and chiller systems in fast paced environment

  • Perform safety inspections, lubricate and make repairs or adjustments on machines when required

  • Check machines in operation on a continual basis to detect problems; exercise judgement in executing necessary adjustments as required to maintain quality control standards.

  • Ability and willingness to work various shifts, including alternate shift structures. This includes weekends, nights and holidays.

  • Work from blueprints and operate machine shop equipment.

  • Share questions, learning's and best practices with fellow mechanics to contribute to machine efficiency levels and decreasing machine breakdowns and downtime.

  • Keep accurate maintenance records and journals.

  • Work in conjunction with the Engineering department with regards to machine modifications and the installation of new machinery and production systems.

  • Work closely with operating colleagues to ensure that high quality products are produced while maintaining budgeted efficiencies.

  • Knowledge and understanding of SOP's and work instructions

  • Understand, participate and support all safety programs, policies, and initiatives within the manufacturing location

  • Understands and follows Ewen Manufacturing food safety systems and procedures

  • Responsible for ensuring all products produced meets all GMP and food safety requirements

  • All other duties as assigned by supervisor

Physical Effort:

  • Work requires ability to work in hot and humid conditions >35 deg. for long period of times

  • Work normally requires a moderate level of physical effort in bending, lifting, and manual dexterity.

Working Conditions

  • This position occurs in a food manufacturing setting (plant environment).

  • Exposure to noise, raw materials, some dust and variable temperatures is common

  • The use of personal protective equipment is required, particularly protective footwear and hearing protection as well as hard hats and safety glasses when required

What extra ingredients you will bring:

Education and Certifications

  • High School Diploma

  • Either Steam Fitter Certification 307A or 3rd class Stationary Engineer certification.

Job specific requirements:

  • 2+ years of experience operating and Maintaining steam and chillers preferred

  • Proven welding experience – Brazing, Stick and MIG welding

  • Initiative, good communication skills, ability to work as part of a team with little direct supervision.

  • Ability to meet physical demands of lifting and maneuvering heavy objects.

  • Sound judgement and problem-solving skills.

  • Computer literacy Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel

  • Results-oriented and a strong sense of urgency/focus.

Travel requirements: No

Work schedule: Day shift with possibility to switch to 12 hour continental shift

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury , Oreo , Mr. Christie and Maynards . We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Manufacturing core

Manufacturing

title: Welder/Fitter
description:
CAMERON STEEL is looking for a skilled WELDER/FITTER to join our growing Team.

Since 1975, we have been an employer of choice in the Kawartha’s. Our reputation for quality workmanship and our ability to respond quickly to clients’ lead times, keeps our 75,000 square foot manufacturing plant busy.

We need to fill this job immediately, so it’s important that you can hit the ground running. We offer competitive wages, excellent benefits and a generous vacation package.

Applicants must be able to work with minimal supervision and have a minimum of 3 years experience as a welder/fitter.

Skills/Abilities include:

  • Must be able to work in a fast paced, quality-production environment
  • Confident with reading and interpreting documents such as safety rules, assembly, operating and maintenance instructions, blueprints, technical drawings and procedural manuals
  • Must possess good communication skills and teamwork attitude
  • Strong mathematical and mechanical skills required
  • Able to multi-task projects and meet production deadlines

Responsibilities include:

  • Read work orders and manufacturing standards, follows production drawings and assembly instructions
  • Study engineered drawings and blueprints, determine the materials required, and the planning of tasks
  • Assemble and fit metal sections to form complete units or subunits using tact welding and other fabrication methods
  • Perform all welding tasks and related fabrication and finishing processes
  • Rig, hoist, and move materials within worksite
  • Understand all quality requirements for products and meet those requirements
  • Make adjustments to meet precise specifications
  • Detect and report defective material to Supervisor
  • Complete any special projects as required. May be assigned to other areas of operation based on business or customer requirements
  • Observe all legislated H&S regulations (including OHSA & WSIB) as well as establish workplace safety procedures
  • Must provide own helmet and certain trade tools

Experience with:

· Set up and operate heavy duty metal working machines including torches, drills, dye grinders, hammers, levels, plasma cutters

· Overhead cranes

Shift: Monday – Friday 7:00 a.m. – 3:30 p.m. (Overtime and some flexible hours are required for this position)

Salary: $26.00 - $32.00/hr – Depending on experience

We wish to thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $26.00-$32.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Welder/Fitter: 3 years (preferred)
  • Overhead cranes: 1 year (preferred)

title: Temporary, full-time, Plant Mechanic
description:
A willingness and ability to work any recognized shift, including weekends, is expected. From time to time, hours of work may be adjusted to suit operational needs.

Job Summary

As stewards of the campus, Facilities Management fosters and enriches an inviting and functional environment that welcomes and supports all who come here. Facilities Management clients include faculty, staff and students. As part of Facilities Management the Mechanical Shop reflects high service delivery standards and requirements. The team works together to ensure effective, efficient and safe performance for the operation, maintenance and repair of building systems on campus.

Under general supervision, the Plant Mechanic will provide journeyperson or technician level skills in any one of the following trades: machinist; pipe/steam fitter; millwright (industrial mechanic); power engineer (min 3rd class); pipefitter/welder(pressure); or refrigeration/air conditioning or other similar trade or technical qualification suitable to UVic Facilities Management as defined by the Industrial Training Authority of BC (ITA), BC Safety Authority and/or recognized licensing or training institutions.The Plant Mechanic will fabricate, install, alter, repair and/or service any plant mechanical system or equipment designed for the purposes of heating and/or cooling (transfer of heat energy) or other mechanical or hydraulic energy. Includes work such as piping, gas-fitting, controls and electrical work related to this classification of equipment and where licensed and qualified by the relevant jurisdiction(s) as having authority to do this work.

Regulated work shall be performed only by incumbents holding required qualifications. The incumbent also performs related duties of similar scope and complexity in collaboration or independently within a multidisciplinary shop and full service facilities department which provides such services as plant and facilities engineering maintenance services. The incumbent will also assist in emergent situations, as reasonably declared by employer, within the physical and skill capacity of the individual.

Shall conform to all best practices in relation to UVic, regulated and industry standards of work and behaviors, including compliance to Worksafe BC regulations.

Job Requirements

Skills:

  • Ability to use initiative and varied trade skills in diagnosing and effecting repairs.
  • Ability to carry out an effective work schedule, under general supervision and utilize materials and equipment for maximum benefit.
  • Ability to plan and organize work efficiently.
  • Ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with faculty, staff and students.
  • Ability to operate and maintain control systems.
  • Literate in the use of personal computers and the MS office suite.
  • Ability to use resources and supplies in an efficient and cost effective manner.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
  • Ability to use hand and fixed power tools effectively (both fixed and portable) i.e. tools associated with mechanical trades including multi meters and other diagnostic equipment.
  • Competency in soldering, brazing, tack and cutting (with torch or electric).


As a staff member, this role should demonstrate UVic's Core Competencies which include Personal Effectiveness, Commitment to Quality, Navigating Change, Communication, Building Equitable Relationships, Teamwork, Service Focus, and University Community. These competencies represent the skills, knowledge and behaviours required to advance the initiatives of the unit/department and the university.



Specialized Knowledge/Education:

  • Completion of an approved apprenticeship or training program acceptable to employer.
  • Millwright (Industrial Mechanic); Pipe/steam Fitter; Power Engineering 3rd Class; Pipefitter/Welder (Pressure) or Refrigeration & A/C Mechanic TQ or related mechanical trade or occupation within HVAC industry.
  • Extensive institutional HVAC experince or equivalent.
  • Ammonia plant experience desirable.


For All Crafts:

  • BC or IP Red Seal Trade or Certificate of Qualification.
  • Valid British Columbia driver's license.
  • Good physical health, sufficient strength, stamina and coordination to perform a variety of routine heavy manual and machine operation tasks continuously.


Experience:

  • 5 years at the journeyperson/technician level in applicable trade preferably in an institutional environment.


Additional Requirements:

  • Willingness and ability to work any recognized shift including weekends.
  • May be required to assist with departmental response to emergent and safety related concerns.

Equity and Diversity Statement

UVic is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our living, learning and work environments. In pursuit of our values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across levels of power. We actively encourage applications from members of groups experiencing barriers to equity.

Read our full equity statement here: www.uvic.ca/equitystatement.

Accessibility Statement

If you anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application and hiring process contact: uviccareers@uvic.ca Any personal information provided will be maintained in confidence.

COVID 19 On-Campus Requirements

The University of Victoria requires all students, staff and faculty coming to campus to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status. Your declaration is confidential and will be securely stored.

title: Journeyman - Welder/Fitter
description:
Job Description – Journeyman Welder/Fitter/Fabricator

Title

Journeyman Welder/Fitter/Fabricator

Reports To

Project Manager, Shop Manager or Site Supervisor

Summary

The position of Journeyman Welder/Fitter includes, some production welding, service & repair welding, prototype building, and fitter welding. This position requires a proficiency in knowledge and use of fabrication techniques involved in the fabrication and manufacture of custom machinery and projects. The Journeyman will be well versed in the operation of machinery and hand tools involved in the fabrication of various types of machinery and structures.

The ability to multi-task and move from job to job is a must. Additionally, the Journeyman Welder/Fitter/Fabricator will be required to read and understand production drawings, blueprints, work orders and other written instructions.

Company Values

TRUST means we will trust each other to be accountable for our actions. We accept the consequences of our actions and inactions. We realize we are not perfect. When we err, we will admit our error and learn from it.

RESPECT means we will respect the dignity of each other, our clients, our suppliers and everyone we come in contact with.

INTEGRITY means that as a corporation and as individuals we will always do what is right. If we have to ask ourselves the question, “is this right”, we already know the answer.

PROFESSIONALISM means we will conduct ourselves in a professional manner in all of our dealings, so that as members of the Kilmarnock team we can always be proud of the way we conduct ourselves with everyone inside and outside the company.

Job Duties

  • Read and interpret blueprints or welding process specifications
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic welding equipment to fuse metal segments using processes such as gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW), gas metal arc welding (GMAW), flux-cored arc welding (FCAW), plasma arc welding (PAW), shielded metal arc welding (SMAW) and oxy-acetylene welding (OAW)
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic flame-cutting equipment
  • Operate brazing and soldering equipment
  • Operate metal shaping machines such as brakes, shears and other metal straightening and bending machines
  • Assemble, fit and weld metal sections and plates to create complete projects
  • Monitor quality of fabrication and production
  • Repair parts of metal products by welding on extra layers.
  • Maintain safe work practices
  • Conduct repairs, modifications and retrofits
  • Liaise with internal and external customers for resolution of data and technical problems
  • Provide data to assist in monitoring and tracking project budgets and project status
  • Assist in training, directing & supervision of junior employees and apprentices, inspecting and certifying their work
  • Assists in conducting project review and post mortems
  • Reviews blueprints and specifications; ensures drawings and specifications will function as designed in environment intended for use
  • Implements corrective actions
  • Ensures accuracy and completion of assigned tasks and projects
  • Keep detailed and accurate reports and documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology, compliance and repair techniques
  • Other assigned work as required

Requirements

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • 5 years’ experience as a Journeyman Welder/Fitter
  • Interprovincial Red Seal or CWB tickets
  • Valid welding certification, Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW), Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW), certified in all positions
  • Possess a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment
  • Experience with routine maintenance operations
  • Solid interpersonal skills
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Computer literate

Work Conditions

  • 24/7 availability may be required
  • Ability to lift and carry objects up to 50 lbs.
  • Travel to off-site locations as work requires
  • Manual dexterity required to use power and hand tools
  • Frequently noisy working environment
  • Safety equipment will be required, e.g. steel-toed safety boots, safety glasses/goggles, etc.
  • Overtime as required
  • Hazards associated with the trade
  • Work both indoors and outdoors
  • May be exposed to construction sites
  • Employee may be exposed to uncomfortable work settings; may have long combinations of standing, crouching or sitting

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$71,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Maintenance Mechanic (Carrier Commercial Service)
description:

2021-09-13-07:00

Country:

Canada

Location:

LOC13002 2740 Matheson Blvd E,Unit 1,Mississauga,Ontario,L4W 4X3,Canada

Maintenance Mechanic

Carrier is a world leader in high-technology heating, ventilating, air-conditioning and refrigeration solutions, building controls and automation, and fire and security systems leading to safer, smarter, sustainable, and high-performance buildings.

Job Description:

Carrier Commercial Service is currently accepting applications for a Maintenance Mechanic (2 positions) to work with the GTA and Southwestern Ontario Region (Stoney Creek) Service Team to support the light and heavy applied HVAC service market segments.

Key Job Responsibilities

  • Establish and maintain professional customer relations.
  • Provide equipment service and maintenance for existing customer base.
  • General building mechanic maintenance.
  • Comply with company Environment, Health and Safety Policies and Procedures.
  • Recommend ways to reduce costs and eliminate unnecessary expenses.

Educational /Technical Requirements

  • Must be a member of Union Local 787, or eligible to become a member
  • Prepared to work towards achieving a Gas Fitter 3 and 2.
  • Must hold a valid driver’s license
  • Working knowledge of HVAC system maintenance
  • College diploma or other post-secondary accreditation in HVAC studies preferred
  • Must be computer literate with a general knowledge of HVAC DDC systems

Other Requirements

  • Proven analytical and diagnostic skills
  • Customer-focused with proven problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Team player
  • Ability to work well under pressure to meet deadlines and customer commitments
  • Excellent time management, planning and organizational skills

Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

title: Welder/Fitter
description:
About Us

Ward was founded in 1965 by Maurice Ward on the simple principal of engineering & manufacturing high quality equipment built to last. The equipment stood the test of time and so has that principal, it is still our driving force today.

Many years of experience have allowed Ward to develop a broad product line of industrial equipment and become an industry leader in bulk material handling.

Our advantage is having a complete compliment of resources in house combined with a professional approach to safety, customers and employees. Our resources include welding, mobile services, complete metal processing services as well as machining, finishing and engineering.

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary Welding training (CWB Certification) would be preferred.
  • Minimum of 1 year of welding experience in a manufacturing environment with manual or semi-automatic welding equipment.
  • Minimum of 1 year of Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) experience.
  • All candidates will be required to pass a Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) test.
  • Crane training / experience is preferred in the use of Overhead Cranes.

Responsibilities

  • Read and interpret fabrication drawings to manufacture component parts or assemblies to manufacturers specifications, work orders, bills of materials or welding process specifications.
  • Process raw materials working from blue prints, and specifications.
  • Create components free of weld faults, performing in process and final inspection of own work.
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic welding equipment to fuse metal segments using gas metal arc welding (GMAW).
  • Use hand, air, power tools, welding equipment for production welding in horizontal and flat positions.
  • Examine weld for bead size and other specifications.
  • Perform basic troubleshooting of welding machine and welding accessories.
  • Repair welds, fix broken or cracked metal components, fill holes and build up metal parts. Chip or grind off excess weld, slag, or spatter.
  • Perform routine, maintenance (wire, nozzle, and tips) to ensure proper functioning equipment.
  • Assist other team members with technical issues and/or production concerns.
  • Support the movement of materials for fabrication to paint areas.
  • Perform other duties/projects as assigned.

Safety Skills

  • Physically able to lift up to 75 pounds
  • Safe handling of material using a forklift and crane
  • Individuals must follow all company safety rules and policies.
  • The use of personal protective equipment will be required.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $21.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • fitting: 1 year (preferred)
  • welding: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • CWB ticket (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: newHVAC Helper/Assistant
description:
Precision HVAC Helper

We are looking for an HVAC Helper to join our Precision Team! You will install, service, and repair heating and air conditioning systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Install new heating, ventilation, and air conditioning systems
  • Inspect and perform equipment repairs and replacements
  • Perform routine preventative maintenance
  • Respond to emergency maintenance requests
  • Adhere to all safety policies and procedures

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in HVAC or other related fields
  • Familiarity with HVAC wiring diagrams
  • Ability to handle physical workload
  • Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

HVAC CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Installation capabilities associated with various heating and air conditioning equipment and ventilation systems
  • Able to accurately diagnose the cause of problems and/or failures in either heating or air conditioning and ventilation systems so as to assess and identify equipment and/ or systems repair
  • Inspect HVAC systems and their components (e.g. heating units, building exhaust fans, ventilation units, etc.) to evaluate their condition as needed
  • Identify necessary repairs and recommend preventative maintenance upon inspection
  • Install/repair heating and air conditioning systems and/or their components (e.g. pumps, motors, air handlers, furnaces, c/c units, piping, etc.)
  • Perform routine and preventive maintenance of commercial rooftop systems
  • Ensure tools and equipment are in good working order
  • Transport equipment, tools and supplies to and from job sites when required
  • Read and interpret shop drawings and control schematics
  • Be safety conscious
  • Inform management and/or team regarding status of work orders – repair status, updating activity log etc.
  • Perform any other duties, deemed necessary that may arise and are assigned

REQUIRED CERTIFICATES

  • Gas Fitter 3 or Gas Fitter 2 License, valid and issued by T.S.S.A.
  • Air Conditioning & Refrigeration License
  • Ozone Depletion certification (ODP)
  • WHIMIS and Fall Arrest
  • Valid Ontario Driver’s License – a driver’s abstract is to be submitted once an interview is scheduled for confirmation

PROFESSIONAL QUALITIES

  • Performs dutifully and, possesses excellent time management and organizational skills, be trustworthy, exhibits a sound work ethic, works well with management and team, displays exceptional interpersonal skills, practices superior customer service and is customer oriented, have good decision making ability, possess sound judgment, practices honesty, is able to adapt, respectful, courteous and communicates at a high standard

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Paid time off
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)
  • Gas (preferred)
  • air conditioning & refrigeration license (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-06-02

title: Shop Welders and Fitters
description:
Talon Energy Services, provides energy services and solutions to the oil & gas, resource, and heavy industrial sectors. With a single point of contact for personnel, engineering, fabrication, fabric maintenance, construction, commissioning, and maintenance services, the client can experience a full-service solution with Talon.

Talon Energy Services is seeking the following positions to support our upcoming fabrication projects. Talon is seeking Shop Fitters and Welders and open to Apprentices and Journeypersons.

Job Summary:

  • Set up welding equipment according to established weld procedures,
  • Fit and tack components to engineering drawing specifications and work instructions,
  • Weld components in accordance with approved welding procedures
  • Operate all tools and material handling devices in a safe manner

Required Education, Skills and Qualifications:

  • Candidates must have valid:
  • F,H,V-up & O position FCAW and SMAW CWB welder qualifications
  • WHMIS 2015 Training
  • Ability to read fabrication and erection drawings
  • Good working knowledge of manual oxy-acetylene and plasma cutting
  • Safe working knowledge of the operation of various metal working tools, such as angle and die grinders, band and chop saws, magnetic and hand drills, drill presses, Piranha ironworker, etc.
  • Attendance, punctuality and reliability is required for position
  • Ability to work overtime considered an asset
  • Relevant safety training, such as, but not limited to: Telehandler, Overhead Cranes, Rigging Awareness, 2-Day NL Fall Protection, 2-Day NL Confined Spaces, Aerial Work Platforms, First Aid considered an asset
  • Class 5 NL Drivers License (incl. additional classes) considered an asset
  • Team players only

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Welding: 5 years (preferred)

description:
