title: Base Camp Manager/ Handy man
description:
Position: Base Camp Manager/Mechanic
Location: Onsite
Department: Production
Reporting to: Race Director

Founded in 2010, Spartan Race is the global leader in the sport of obstacle racing. Spartan races cater to individuals looking to test their physical limits and change their frame of reference for what they can accomplish, from everyday people looking to get off the couch and lead a fitter lifestyle, to elite endurance athletes who seek the ultimate physical test.

The Base Camp Management division of the Logistics Department is a vital component to the success and production of every event reporting to the Race Director.

Main Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all production tools and equipment are in good working order.
  • Perform regular inspection, maintenance and repair of tools and equipment.
  • Submit work orders and procurement requests for materials, tools, and other stock items.
  • Maintain inventory records of select company assets.
  • Manage a fleet of semi trailers including inspection, maintenance and DOT documentation.
  • Prepare obstacle packages ready for deployment.
  • Ensure rented heavy equipment is in good working order and assist with troubleshooting and repair.
  • Oversee on-site fueling station and fueling of all equipment and vehicles.
  • Unload production trailers and strategically position materials.
  • Set up and maintain the base camp area to serve as the event operations center.
  • Support production staff requests.
  • Manage transfer of materials while inventorying from trailer and base-camp to build and festival team.
  • Assist with unloading of deliveries.
  • Maintain records of all activities and processes pertaining to basecamp & trailers.
  • Delegate and oversee duties carried out by night security and volunteers.
  • Responsible for inventory and setting up café (beverages and snacks on display).
  • Manage errands for essential materials for on-site staff involving the use of up to 26 foot U-Haul trucks, flatbeds, and trucks.
  • Pack up all cafe and cage items and ensure they are loaded into the appropriate trailers for shipping to the next event.

*This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions, however, it does not restrict other tasks that may be assigned.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Compliance and completion of all safety training.
  • Willingness and ability to travel 11+ days at a time with approximately 100% travel.
  • Frequently works 10-15+ hour days outdoors in adverse conditions for extended periods of time.
  • Demonstrate full range of movement including but not limited to lifting, standing, bending, reaching, twisting, and crawling.
  • Occasionally lifts, pushes, pulls, and moves equipment and material weighing up to 100 pounds.
  • Regularly required to stand, walk, use hands and fingers to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls.
  • Be able to arrive two (2) weeks prior to the event and depart three (3) days after - first-in/last out.
  • Possess excellent mechanical skills.
  • Knowledge of MS Word, MS Excel and Google Docs.
  • Have experience as a dock or warehouse supervisor with shipping and receiving department experience.
  • Work efficiently in a fast paced ever changing environment.
  • Must be able to meet deadlines with severe time constraints.
  • Have a proven attention to detail yet the ability to manage from a high level and often change from one task to another of a different nature.
  • Have excellent problem solving skills.

Qualities required of all Spartan team members:

Spartan Race is a high-performance organization, and successful team members must therefore possess a strong work ethic and hands-on approach to business. We are innovative, create inventive solutions, and are exceptionally service minded. Team members at Spartan Race change lives, and have a passion for the organization. Paramount to the organization is the maturity to embrace ambiguity and the ability to adapt according to the market and the continuing innovation of the organization.

  • Ability to hold one-self accountable and an aptitude for prioritizing multiple projects
  • Strong sense of teamwork with the ability to foster relationships
  • Proactive, solutions-oriented; capability to identify efficiencies and decrease costs while maintaining a quality workplace environment and product
  • Collegial approach to a business environment and cooperative work style
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Valid, updated Passport

Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract, Seasonal
Contract length: 6 months

Salary: $300.00 per day

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
COVID-19 protocols will be communicated to all hired staff.

Experience:

  • Mechanic: 2 years (preferred)

Willingness to travel:

  • 75% (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: newWelder / Fitter
description:
Meridian Manufacturing Inc. is North America’s industry leading manufacturer of heavy gauge welded hopper bottom bins for the agricultural, commercial and industrial markets. Meridian also manufactures delivery equipment for bulk seed and a comprehensive line of petroleum and oil field storage tanks. Meridian is a member of The Westman Group of Companies, a dynamic, entrepreneurial group dedicated to the growth of their employees, customers and the communities in which they operate.

Progress creates the following career opportunity in Cambridge, ON.

WELDER/FITTER (Aft. Shift)

Mon-Thu - 4-Day week

The position of includes but is not limited to production welding of smooth-walled, hopper-style storage bins and fuel tank, and related custom prototypes from supplied drawings; fabrication of custom jigs and fixtures to produce production parts that meet customer specifications, as well as the fabrication of metal structures using jigs and fixtures in a high paced production environment. The successful applicants must have superior work ethics, excellent time management skills and positive attitude.

Job duties will include:

  • Read and interpret blueprints or welding process specifications
  • Gas metal arc welding (MCAW)
  • Operate Over Head Cranes in compliance with Meridian MFG Safety Policies
  • Maintain safe work practices
  • Conduct Quality Inspections of their work
  • Maintain equipment in good working condition and report maintenance and safety concerns
  • Other assigned work as required

Requirements:

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • 2-3 years of experience as a Welder
  • Interprovincial CWB tickets or the ability to acquire them within the first three months of work
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment
  • Highly flexible, with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Strong attention to detail

Meridian Manufacturing Inc. offers:

  • Competitive Wages
  • Excellent Benefits Package
  • Signing Bonus
  • Fitness Program
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan and more

We thank all applicants for their interest.

Only those being considered for interviews will be contacted.

Meridian Manufacturing Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Profit sharing
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • Night shift

title: Gas Installation Foreman
description:
Job ID: 12739
PNR RailWorks is the leading subcontractor in new rail construction and rail maintenance in Canada, covering projects from new track construction, maintenance to large signalling upgrade projects. With the rail industry continuing to grow, we are looking for experienced individuals in the electrical and civil construction fields. PNR offers a competitive salary, benefits, vacation and RRSP’s. Apply today!!

Job Summary and Purpose

Reporting to the Superintendent or Construction Manager, the gas installation foreman. Leads installation team to support installation of wayside signals, signal cable, gas line installation, snow clearing devices (SCD) and support test and commissioning of wayside systems

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Reviews all contracts, project documentation and plans to ensure that the work in the field is built to the most recent specifications.
  • Pre-plans work activities with Superintendent to develop best means and methods, including safety action plans.
  • Plans the day to day operations on assigned project and ensures that proper resources are in place for the timely completion of work i.e., labour, equipment and material.
  • Takes responsibility for crew performance as related to company goals, safety audits, administration of company policies and procedures. Conducts tailgate meetings. Initiates follow up action as necessary including training, orientation, discipline, etc.
  • Conducts daily briefing with crew to review production goals, performance feedback, safety and schedule, hazards, and to solicit feedback from the workers.
  • Maintains a dedication to safety at all times by modeling, providing education and enforcing safe work practices, Company policies and procedures. Ensures that proper safety equipment is available and used by all field personnel.
  • Communicates with customer and ensures a high level of customer satisfaction.
  • Communicates with contractors or sub-contractors to coordinate work, goals, etc.
  • Performs a variety of related administrative tasks such as production reports, timesheets, equipment logs, inspection reports, change orders and updating project files.
10. Other project based duties as assigned.

Education, Training & Experience:
  • Qualified gas fitter license G1
  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent.
  • Valid and clean driver’s license.
  • 5 years construction related experience.
  • Railway or construction experience would be an asset.
  • Training in First Aid, WHMIS, Working at Heights, Confined Space, CSTS.

Talents & Abilities:
  • Ability to lead, guide , motivate and teach others
  • Proficient with computer, phone online tools and MS Office package
  • Ability to perform physical work in a field environment including bending, lifting and maneuvering uneven surfaces
  • Ability to operate pickup truck, towing trailer, utilize hand, power tools air compressors and other speciality tools
  • Sound knowledge of testing and troubleshooting gas line and gas powered equipment
  • Excellent vision and hearing
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to exercise sound judgment and common sense.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment as a contributing and essential team player.

Working Conditions

  • Physical Demands: Standing and walking around the project site; frequent bending, lifting, digging, shoveling and moving of objects on site; loud noise
  • Environmental Conditions: On site, field environment and subject to all weather conditions; working in and around live commuter trains, high voltage, confined space, safety sensitive cabling; day, evening and weekend shift work

This job description is not intended to represent a complete, comprehensive list of all duties and responsibilities that may be required in this position. There may be unplanned activities and other duties as assigned
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.
PNR RailWorks Inc. is committed to fostering an equitable, accessible, and inclusive workplace. As such, PNR RailWorks Inc. will ensure reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process, including the interview. If selected for an interview, requests for accommodation can be confidentially made to a member of the recruitment team who will arrange in advance for reasonable and appropriate accommodation for fair and equitable assessment throughout the process.
All successful applicants must be in compliance with PNR RailWorks Inc. Mandatory COVID Vaccination Policy, which will be provided prior to hire.

title: Fitter/Metal Fabricator
description:
We are currently searching for a Fitters/Metal Fabricator with experience. If you want to work in a fun environment with sharp teammates who embrace our core values, in a culture of mutual respect and continuous training and development, we look forward to hearing from you.

Steel 2000 Inc. is focusing on the industrial, institutional, and commercial structural steel segment has allowed our staff to achieve expert status in those fields. We participate in steel fabrication for mining, mineral refining, petrochemical, hydroelectric, private, and governmental environments. Whether the requirements are major CAPEX infrastructure or small maintenance repairs and upgrades we are the right choice.

Steel2000 Inc. is led by a diverse team of individuals that each carry distinctive abilities and strengths. Together, we are always focused on providing an experience where everyone has a role in the success of the company.

Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Good attendance is mandatory
  • Licensed Welder/Fitter trade certification
  • Structural Steel fitting experience is preferred
  • Some weekend work is required on occasion.
  • Must have your own vehicle and valid driver's license.
  • Must have own welding helmet.
  • 1 year of experience is preferred
  • A weld test will be required for the interview.

Steel2000 Inc. is a plate and structural steel shop.

Kindly no phone calls, please.

For more information about our company, please visit our website at http://steel2000inc.com/

We thank everyone who applies, however, only those selected will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Labourer- Fording River
description:
Position: Labourer- Fording River

Project Type: Industrial

Project Location: Teck - Fording River, Elkford BC

Shift: Day

Schedule: 14/7 10 hour days

Accommodations: Camp

Travel Details: Allowance

GC: Graham

Allied Partner: Technical Workforce Inc.

Reference Number: 13662


AS A SKILLED LABOURER YOU WILL BE INVOLVED WITH THE FOLLOWING:


Environmental measures, Equipment Spotting, assisting carpenters and pipe fitters, backfilling various soils and gravels, with compaction, site fueling, janitorial, etc


  • Duration 5-6 months
  • Start date of April 21 and April 28
  • 14/7 shift
  • 10 hour days
  • Camp
  • Travel Allowance


CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:


CSTS 2020

Ground Disturbance Level 2

Confined Space level 1 (ESC/OSSA)

Fall Protection (ESC/OSSA)

WHMIS 2015

Drivers License


COME AND GET YOUR BOOTS DIRTY


With a significant presence in the construction, industrial maintenance, and turnaround sectors, Jardeg is the largest recruiter of skilled trades in Canada. In 2022 alone, we’ll be supporting over 10 million manhours of work and a peak headcount over 10,000.


If you’re a tradesperson working in Canada, our position across commercial, infrastructure, and industrial construction, plus maintenance and turnarounds means we have more than just a job for you. We have a lifetime of work.

title: Licensed Plumbers
description:
Job Summary
Arcadian Projects Inc. is a Kitchener based contractor, involved in a number of construction and energy
projects in Ontario. We are looking for a certified Plumber Journeyperson to join our team of professional
trades. The successful candidate will have experience in the industrial and commercial fields; energy
project experience is an asset.

  • Candidates must have a valid 306A certificate of qualifications, registered with the Ontario

College of Trades.

  • Candidates must have valid Working at Heights, WHMIS and an Ontario Driver’s License with

clean Driver's Abstract.

Qualifications:

  • G2 or G1 Gas Fitter ticket is considered an asset.
  • Steamfitter ticket is considered an asset.
  • Ability to repair, troubleshoot and install mechanical equipment for a variety of mechanical
systems.
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance .
  • Energy project experience an asset.
  • Self-motivated individual.
  • Ability to collaborate with others and/or work independently.
  • Believes, promotes and adheres to safe work practices, and complies with all applicable
legislative health and safety policies and procedures.
  • Highly reliable individual dedicated to continuous improvement with proven leadership abilities.
  • Good housekeeping process to ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times.
  • Punctual disposition.
  • Able to demonstrate appropriate and effective interpersonal skills with peers, partners, and public
as well as clients and co-workers.
  • Carry out a variety of tasks to support company trade services.
  • Strong problem-solving skills in all areas of the business.
  • Experience in material & equipment ordering & procurement.
  • Ability to interpret & meet job schedules.
  • Ability to effectively co-ordinate work activities.


Job Type: Full-time, to start immediately.



We Offer

  • Competitive compensation and benefits package with RRSP matching.
  • Opportunities for growth and development.
  • Diversified work opportunities in the ICI and energy markets.
  • An open and collaborative work environment.


Please send resumes to arcadianhr@arcadianprojects.ca

At Arcadian Projects we support a culture of inclusion, equity and equality; this promotes growth,
confidence and cohesion amongst our team of partners, clients and peers. We look to connect with
individuals that are career minded professionals who can collaborate with team members to promote a
healthy and safe work environment.

title: Operating Engineer 2nd Class
description:
Description

Operating Engineer 2nd Class $50.42 - $53.72/hr

''Innovation is facilitated by having the right people in the right roles with the right skills and values.''
- Charles Koch, Koch Industries Chairman and CEO

Flexible Benefits Package and Competitive Pension Plan

INVISTA has invested significantly in the Kingston Manufacturing Site recently completing projects in power cogeneration, energy efficiency, and automation. Come join the Power Services Operation as a 2nd Class Operating Engineer as we continue to transform.

The Power Services Operation manages the provision of services for building and process heating, compressed air, water and electrical power to the Kingston Manufacturing Site. Equipment and facilities are located across the site and include pumps, compressors, chillers, treatment facilities, boilers and a cogeneration unit.

Want to learn more about the INVISTA experience? Watch this!

Job Responsibilities:

  • Operate, maintain and improve equipment to supply uninterrupted services such as compressed air, water, water inlet and discharge treatment, chilled water, steam, inert gas, hot oil system (DP:DPO) and electricity to the Kingston site.
  • Work in conjunction with other engineers and plant operations to monitor and control key services variables including rates, pressures and temperatures. Individual and team troubleshooting and problem solving are an integral part of this assignment.
  • Responsibilities include adherence to area standard practices and operating procedures, procurement, measurement and transfer of chemicals, documentation and record keeping.
  • Work in a respectful manner in a team environment

Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Currently possess a 2nd Class Operating Engineer Certificate
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing, chemical, petrochemical or refinery plant environment
  • Demonstrated ability to use necessary computer and process control tools in a control room environment
  • Ability to work a twelve-hour rotating shift, modified twelve-hour shift, or eight-hour days, on a rotational basis, and as required for training and development purposes
  • Ability to work in an industrial environment with varying temperatures and conditions

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Past work experience demonstrating strong personal commitment to work safely with an ability to adhere to standard practices and procedures
  • Demonstrated work performance that is consistent with a team environment
  • Demonstrated self-motivation to identify resources to resolve problems
  • Established experience in utilizing discretionary time to complete value adding work
  • Demonstrated interest in mechanical equipment, control systems and major energy transformations
  • Related maintenance experience and/or certification in one or more of the following trades: instrumentation technician, electrician, gas fitter, pipe fitter or industrial mechanic

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions

  • There is a requirement to work from heights, work in confined spaces, work in areas of elevated temperatures or outside in inclement weather, and wear breathing apparatus and respirators.

Why Work for INVISTA?

  • A culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance
  • Opportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the world
  • Encouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledge
  • Ability to contribute to a shared vision of innovation while conserving resources

We Provide:

  • $50.42 /hr plus shift premiums paid during evenings, nights and Sundays, in addition to hourly rates above (an additional $3.30 per hour for Shift Engineers)
  • Flexible benefits package
  • Competitive pension plan
  • Performance bonus program with possibility to earn and additional 2,4,8 or 12% on every hour worked
  • Additional vacation purchase program
  • Additional floating holidays
  • Education Assistance Program for enhanced job-related training

How to apply:

Picture yourself at INVISTA and submit a detailed resume in English along with a covering letter to www.kochcareers.com

Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage

title: HVAC Controls Technician
description:
Applications are invited for the position of HVAC Controls Technicians in the Facilities Management Services department, located at the Daniel J. Patterson Campus and the Welland Campus. The starting salary is $33.05/hr for a 40-hour work week. Additional hours may be required as necessary.

Reporting to the Manager, Facilities Management Services, the successful candidate is responsible for ensuring the continued operation of the college HVAC systems, which includes, but is not limited to troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance of rooftop units, boiler systems, chillers, cooling towers, and air distribution components.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Assisting with the selection and co-ordination of external contractors
  • Monitoring and troubleshooting the Building Automation System, analysing trends, and recommending or implementing corrective actions
  • Providing input to projects requiring new or modified HVAC or BAS equipment
  • Ensuring regular inspection and/or testing of building life safety systems - including but not limited to fire panels, emergency generators, and sprinkler systems
  • Working seamlessly with the FMS team and participating in all other aspects of the general maintenance worker requirements
  • Adhering to safe work practices with respect to provincial Occupational Health and Safety regulations and Niagara College Health and Safety Policies and Practices

Qualifications:

  • Trade certification in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Systems Mechanic - Trade Code 313A and/or 3rd Class Power Engineer License – Stationary Operating Engineer (TSSA)
  • Minimum three (3) years’ experience as a licensed Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Systems Mechanic or Stationary Operations Engineer with specific experience in an industrial or educational environment
  • Certifications in the following areas considered an asset: Gas Fitter 1; Building Automation Control Systems; ODP (ozone depletion/prevention); Fire and Life Safety; other relevant certifications
  • Demonstrated experience in gas fired boiler systems and centrifugal chillers, computerized maintenance management software, networking, and automated building controls
  • Strong working knowledge of TSSA regulations, as well as the Ontario Fire Code, Ontario Building Code, and other relevant regulations

Close Date: Posting will remain open until filled.

The Position Description Form is available for review from Human Resources during the posting period. Please contact humres@niagaracollege.ca to request a copy.

If selected for an interview, candidates must present proof of education (original transcripts/credentials).

Note: Credentials obtained outside of Canada require an evaluation to determine the Canadian educational equivalence. This evaluation must support the educational requirements for the position as a condition of employment. For further information, visit: World Education Services http://www.wes.org/ca/.

While we thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Niagara College is strongly committed to diversity and inclusion within its community. We offer an inclusive work environment and welcome applications from all qualified individuals who feel they can further enhance campus diversity and equity efforts.

If requested, accommodations will be made to support applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process.

title: GAS FITTER
description:
JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education

  • Registered Apprenticeship certificate

Experience

  • 3 years to less than 5 years

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

  • Gas Fitter Certificate - Level 1 or A
  • Gas Fitter Certificate - Level 2 or B
  • Gas Fitter Trade Certification

Additional Skills

  • Supervise other workers

Work Setting

  • Residential
  • Commercial

Specific Skills

  • Test and replace defective equipment or components
  • Measure and mark reference points for installation of gas lines and equipment
  • Install and maintain meters and regulators and gas lines between gas unit and gas meter
  • Install, maintain and service gas heating units and their components
  • Attend to gas escape calls and assist in the investigation of gas fires and explosions
  • Advise clients regarding standards, safety features and maintenance of gas units and systems
  • Repair and service gas appliances and related equipment
  • Study drawings and specifications to determine the layout of the installation and materials required
  • Test and adjust control mechanisms and check pipes and piping connections for gas leaks using gas detecting devices

Security and Safety

  • Bondable
  • Driver's validity licence check

Own Tools/Equipment

  • Tools
  • Steel-toed safety boots

Transportation/Travel Information

  • Valid driver's licence

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities

  • Handling heavy loads
  • Physically demanding
  • Attention to detail
  • Bending, crouching, kneeling

Ability to Supervise

  • 1 to 2 people

Work Location Information

  • Willing to relocate

Personal Suitability

  • Accurate
  • Team player
  • Excellent oral communication
  • Excellent written communication
  • Client focus
  • Dependability
  • Judgement

Screening questions

  • Are you currently legally able to work in Canada?
  • Are you willing to relocate for this position?
  • What is the highest level of study you have completed?
  • Are you available for shift or on-call work?
  • Do you have the above-indicated required certifications?

HOW TO APPLY

By email:
nicplumb@telus.net
By phone:
(250) 378-4943
Between 9:00 AM and 4:00 AM
In person:
Room 2064 Coutlee Ave
Merritt
British Columbia
V1K 1B8
Between 9:00 AM and 4:00 AM

title: Welder
description:
Cherubini Metal Works, a member of the Cherubini Group of Companies, is looking for Welders to join our team in Dartmouth, NS!

We have an outstanding Safety Culture that focuses on the health and wellbeing of our workforce. The desire to be an active participant in our Safety Program is a vital aspect of employment within the Cherubini Group of Companies. We also offer competitive compensation and benefits.

Summary

The position of Welder includes, but is not limited to production welding, service & repair welding, prototype building, and fitter welding. Responsibilities will include the fabrication of custom prototypes from supplied drawings, fabrication of custom jigs and fixtures to produce production parts that meet customer specifications, as well as the fabrication of metal structures using jigs and fixtures in a high paced production environment. Knowledge of Steel structures such as bridge components, steel beams, steel channels, shell structures etc.

The use of various hand tools, machinery and equipment will be required to manufacture metal products. This position will work with Foremen and Lead Hands to ensure continuous improvements in work cells, hitting quotas, welding according to pre-set parameters using Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW), Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW) processes. Possess strong knowledge and skill in operating all metalworking machinery. Additionally, the Welder will be required to read and understand production drawings, blueprints, work orders and other written instructions.

Core Competencies

  • Quality Orientation
  • Time Management
  • Creative and Innovative Thinking
  • Development and Continual Learning
  • Problem Solving
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Decision making and Judgement
  • Operating Equipment
  • Providing Consultation
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Mathematical Reasoning
  • Enforcing Laws, Rules and Regulations
  • Mediating and Negotiating
  • Communication
  • Energy & Stress management skills
  • Teamwork

Job Duties

  • Read and interpret blueprints or welding process specifications
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic welding equipment to fuse metal segments using processes such as gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW), gas metal arc welding (GMAW), flux-cored arc welding (FCAW), plasma arc welding (PAW), shielded metal arc welding (SMAW), oxy-acetylene welding (OAW), resistance welding and submerged arc welding (SAW)
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic flame-cutting equipment
  • Operate brazing and soldering equipment
  • Operate metal shaping machines such as brakes, shears and other metal straightening and bending machines
  • Repair parts of metal products by welding on extra layers.
  • Maintain safe work practices
  • Conduct repairs, modifications and retrofits
  • Monitor parts usage and report on any material issues
  • Assist in training, directing & supervision of junior employees and apprentices, inspecting and certifying their work
  • Reviews blueprints and specifications; ensures drawings and specifications will function as designed in environment intended for use
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology, compliance and repair techniques

Requirements

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • 5-7 years’ experience as a Welder
  • Current CWB tickets (all positions)
  • Valid welding certification, Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW), Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW), certified in all positions
  • FCAW certification considered an asset
  • GMAW certification considered an asset
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment
  • Experience with routine maintenance operations
  • Experience in working with Overhead cranes with or without load attached.
  • Highly flexible, with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Strong attention to detail

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $19.00-$30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Overtime

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Dartmouth, NS: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Welding: 5 years (preferred)
  • Overhead Crane: 2 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • CWB tickets (all positions) (preferred)

title: Operations Technician Supervisor
description:
Description

Summary of Position

RTI employs a staff of Operations Management personnel that are highly experienced in operating petroleum refining and/or chemicals processes and equipment. On a daily basis, our Operations Managers work with refinery operations personnel and turnaround professionals to plan and carry out chemical cleaning strategies. The Operations Technician Supervisor will assist with the planning and coordination of Ops Tech assignments and travel/training requirements; oversee equipment readiness and maintenance and perform other support activities as they assist with the execution objectives of our Operations Managers on RTI projects.

Duties & Responsibilities

1. Maintains and tracks all of RTI’s pneumatic injection pumps (ARO 4:1 and 9:1). This includes having a complete knowledge of injection pump repair and troubleshooting.

2. Work with Operations Technicians to assemble new injection pump dollies.

3. Ensure Operations Technicians inspect equipment before and after each project and provide repair and preventive maintenance services as needed, including following the optimal pump operating and readiness procedures.

4. Communicates the mechanical needs (injection points, hoses, spools, pumps) to refinery maintenance personnel and executes chemical cleaning activities.

5. Schedule and coordinate repair and maintenance of all equipment and facilities.

6. Train new and existing personnel on processes/procedures and equipment operation and repair. This includes on-boarding of new Operations Technicians.

7. Develop new and continually improved equipment and processes.

8. Review individual performance of assigned personnel.

9. Assists in the creation and maintenance of a schedule of Operations Technician assignments to projects based on the needs established by the RTI team.

10. Coordinates Operations Technician travel plans with the travel department.

11. Ensures that Operations Technicians fully meet Client and RTI training requirements.

12. Manages the mentoring program for new Operations Technicians.

13. Trains contractor personnel (fitters or Ops Techs) on RTI’s chemical injection strategy.

14. Conducts business in a safe manner consistent with the RTI Quality Policy.

15. Maintains proper inventory of all key items in company trailers and regionally located shops for assigned markets.

Supervisory Responsibilities (Direct and indirect)

Has direct supervisory responsibility over the Operations Technicians including hiring, termination, performance reviews, training, etc.

Requirements

Please be aware that RTI requires Covid-19 vaccinations for all new hires.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Experience leading teams. A preference is given to those with upgrader or refinery craft supervisory experience.

· Ability to use hand tools to create and maintain operating equipment.

· Ability to organize and maintain regional repair shops to provide for timely and effective repairs of RTI equipment.

· Primary understanding of fluid dynamics as related to RTI pumping equipment.

Acceptable Experience and Training

· Documented mechanical aptitude or formal mechanical education. A preference is given to those with process knowledge of refinery or petrochemical units.

Required Certificates and/or Licenses

· Valid passport and driver’s license

Working Conditions

· Performs his duties in a combination of office, regional shop and refinery environments

Physical Demands

· Physical ability to lift, climb ladders and spend 12-16 hours on shift

Safety Equipment/Apparel

· This position requires the use of company supplied PPE in connection with various refinery and safety council standards.

Required Travel

· Ability to travel 125 overnights per year to multiple North American markets for supporting a growing list of clients. Out of town assignments can range from 3-15 days in length.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $37,451.00-$94,135.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Fort McMurray, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

title: newService Technician
description:
We are currently seeking a skilled and dedicated Service Technician to provide boiler repair services within the Service Department and working out of our Port Coquitlam branch. The successful candidates will not only be knowledgeable about boilers we sell and repair, but also provide leading customer support and quality service. In addition to providing quality and timely service work, the successful candidate should be comfortable making boiler-related improvement recommendations on the spot including promoting various products/services and collecting pertinent information for the sales group.

PLEASE NOTE: This job requires travel throughout multiple cities in BC, mainly focusing on the Lower Mainland.

PRIMARY QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years experience in a related field
  • Journeyman Burner Mechanic or Gas related ticket is preferred, BC Class A
  • Familiarity with fuel-fired boilers and all related controls an asset
  • Ability to travel regularly
  • Ability to connect and understand customer needs
  • Availability for on-call schedule
  • Ability to physically lift a minimum of 35 pounds without restrictions
  • Possess a valid class 5 driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract
  • Obtain and maintain valid security clearances from municipal/provincial authorities

The ideal candidate will be able to perform strongly in the following areas:

  • Passion for excellent Customer Satisfaction
  • Adhere to company safety policies and procedures
  • Clean driving record and abstract
  • Possess own hand tools
  • Highly motivated and able to work independently
  • Exhibit initiative, responsibility, flexibility, salesmanship, and leadership
  • Troubleshoot, repair, and maintain equipment such as burners on steam and hot water boilers
  • Service calls in British Columbia, Alberta and Saskatchewan as needed
  • Provide preventative maintenance of company and customer equipment
  • Interpret equipment manuals and work orders to perform required maintenance and service
  • Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas
  • Maintaining mobile inventory of service truck
  • Use the electronic time-sheet portal
  • Ensure availability while on-call as scheduled
  • Remain current with federal, provincial and local codes and regulations
  • In-shop service as required

Opportunities:

  • Competitive salary, benefits and commission
  • Supported work-life balance
  • Support with learning and career development

Experience:

  • Class A Gas Fitter: 3 years OR Class B + Refrigeration/Controls is preferred
  • Plumbing is an asset
  • Boiler Water Treatment is an asset

Primary Residence Location:

  • Abbotsford to Port Coquitlam, BC (Preferred)

Head Office Location:

  • Port Coquitlam

Prime Boiler Services Ltd. is a family-owned Alberta business, which has become a symbol of trust and quality in building, servicing, and renting high-performance boiler systems. The industries that we support are diversified; Food Manufacturers, Breweries & Distilleries, Commercial, Public Institutions and Rentals to the Oil & Gas sector. Behind our symbol lies an experienced team of professionals who are committed to supporting our clientele’s success by providing the best steam and heating solutions.

Please apply in confidence before May 19, 2022. Prime Boiler Services is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all candidates for their interest in this position however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40.00-$50.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Licence/Certification:

  • Class A Gasfitter OR Class B + Refrigeration/Controls (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-19

title: Appliance Technician
description:
About us

Smarthome Devices Inc. is a small business in Toronto, ON. We are rewarding and demanding.

Our work environment includes:

  • Growth opportunities
  • Lively atmosphere

Creating sustainability as an organization is a core value at SmartHome Devices. We are currently looking for an Appliance Technician to join our team. SmartHome Devices opened in 2019 with a mission to provide consumers with affordable and high-quality smart home products. Each year, our team of experts saves our customers hundreds of dollars on electronics and appliances. Offering a variety of new, refurbished, and closeout brands of consumer products allows us to cater to a wide range of consumer needs.

*
Job Responsibilities

  • Diagnose and complete appliance repairs
  • Cosmetic repairs on appliances
  • Observe and test operation of appliances following installation; make adjustments as necessary
  • Read and interpret blueprints
  • Prepare detailed and complete work orders for each repair
  • Ensure proper maintenance of work orders and service requests
  • Keep a clean workspace and part inventory
  • Maintain consistent communication with warehouse team and management team
  • Retain practical knowledge of hazardous materials and manufacturer's and employer standards in regards to appliances
  • Proper use of using hand and power tools, measuring devices and testing equipment, in compliance with health and safety standards
  • Other duties may be assigned based on business needs

Required Skills:

  • Strong understanding of appliance configuration and repairs
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • High mechanical aptitude is required
  • Ability to lift up to 60 lbs
  • Ability to read wiring diagrams
  • Reading comprehension is required
  • Must have transportation

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in repairing home appliances (preferred, not required)
  • Ability to do sealed system work
  • Gas Fitter Ticket (preferred, not required)
  • Full Driver's License (must be able to provide a three year driving abstract)
  • Ability to obtain appropriate ODP Certification
  • Refrigeration, sealed systems (R134a and R600a) experience (preferred)
  • Prior Home Electronics or Air Conditioning experience would also be considered an asset

Benefits:

  • Long term professional career growth
  • Effective training and development programs
  • Fantastic employee product purchase program
  • Fun & Friendly workplace

We thank all candidates for their resumes, all applicants will be contacted in regards to their next steps in the hiring process.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$60.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Well established HVAC company is located in Markham, looking to hire Full Time Service Technicians and Maintenance Technicians.

The Plumber performs skilled plumbing work in the maintenance, repair, and service work of gas, air, water, and waste water disposal systems and of the interior and exterior water mains and drainage systems throughout the University.

Qualifications:

  • Red Seal Plumbing certificate, Class B Gas Fitter certificate, and five years experience in areas such as in-site service and building preventative maintenance, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid BC driver's license (Class 5) and basic computer skills required.
  • Good organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
  • Ability to exercise mature judgment and initiative.

  • Ability to lift 50 pounds.
  • Ability to stand, bend, twist, reach, and walk for an extended period of time.
  • Ability to work in small or confined spaces.
  • Ability to work at heights.
  • Ability to work in extreme temperatures.
  • Ability to work in unsanitary environments.
  • Ability to work in biohazardous, radioactive, and chemically hazardous environments.
  • Satisfactory Criminal Record Check

Applicants will be, or eligible to be, a member of the United Association of Journeymen & Apprentices of the Plumbing and Pipefitting Industry of the United States and Canada, Local 170.

Please include your cover letter and resume in one attachment.

title: title
description: description

title: Maintenance Technician, Mechanical
location: St John’s, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
description:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.

We’re hiring a Mechanical Maintenance technician in Newfoundland. Do you have experience and skill in industrial maintenance and repairs? We want to talk to you!

Minimum Requirements:

  • Five years of mechanical experience with the operation and maintenance of gas turbine driven generators, diesel engines, multi-stage centrifugal pumps and compressors, HVAC systems, hydraulic systems and associated auxiliary equipment
  • Mechanical Technologist or Inter-Provincial Journeyman’s Certificate in Mechanical or Millwright
  • Working knowledge of regulatory and industry codes applicable to the mechanical discipline
  • Working knowledge of preventive and predictive maintenance, condition monitoring and with the application of computerized maintenance management systems
  • Demonstrated strong safety mindset and alignment with our values

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain the integrity and perform safe and efficient maintenance of all mechanical systems and equipment
  • Coordinate and communicate daily mechanical maintenance activities
  • Respond quickly and effectively to problems and breakdowns
  • Capture data in support of equipment condition monitoring
  • Report all accidents, near misses and hazardous conditions

Location and other Key Details:

  • You will work onboard the Terra Nova FPSO. Transportation to / from the FPSO is provided from St. John’s, Newfoundland
  • As this an offshore position, you will be required to maintain mandatory training and certification for continued offshore work
  • The shift schedule is a 21 days on / 21 days off rotation, 12-hour shifts
  • This position is safety sensitive
  • Pay rate in accordance with Appendix A of the Collective Agreement between Terra Nova Employers’ Organization and Unifor Local 2121
  • Qualified residents of the province of Newfoundland and Labrador will be given first consideration in the staffing of this position
  • This role will be posted until May 18, 2022

Why Suncor?

Our operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and our product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our renewable energy portfolio includes investments in four operating wind farms and the operation of an ethanol plant. And our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business.

With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

title: Maintenance Technician - Electrician
location: Labrador City, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
description:
Welcome to Vale in Canada. As a leader in the mining industry, our responsibility is to positively impact our people, communities and the environment. We value our workforce and offer continuous training and career development opportunities for our people.

Vale is a global leader in the production of iron ore and one of the largest producers of nickel. Active in Canada for over 100 years, Vale employs nearly 6,000 people across our corporate office in Toronto and sites in Manitoba, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador. Applying the latest technologies to sustainably produce nickel, copper, cobalt, platinum group metals, gold and silver is at the heart of what we do.

With our global headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and approximately 125,000 employees in over 30 countries, Vale is constantly growing and changing. We invite you to be part of our evolution.

Our open-pit mine and concentrator in Voisey’s Bay - Vale’s only fly-in/fly-out operation in Canada - produces nickel-cobalt-copper concentrate and copper concentrate. An underground expansion will see a transition to a leading edge underground mine extending the life of the mine until 2034. Our state-of the-art facility in Long Harbour is the first nickel processing plant in the world to use hydrometallurgy technology to produce Plating RoundsTM from hard rock (sulphide) concentrate, with low carbon footprint compared to traditional smelter technology. Our offices in St. John’s and Goose Bay provide support to the Newfoundland and Labrador Operations.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking a MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN – ELECTRICAN to join our Maintenance Team at our remote mine site in Voisey’s Bay, Labrador, a fly-in fly-out operation.

This permanent position is based at the Voisey’s Bay mine site in Labrador, a fly-in fly-out operation. This position is on a two week on, two week off rotation.

Reporting to the Underground Electrical Supervisor, the Maintenance Technician – Electrician will be responsible for installing, repairing, troubleshooting, adjusting, overhauling, servicing and maintaining equipment within surface and underground electrical installations, power distribution, mobile equipment, preventative maintenance programs and process equipment systems.

In This Position, You Will
  • Participate and advocate in a Zero Harm safety culture and all Health, Safety, Environment and Security programs within Vale;
  • Install, replace and repair electrical control and distribution equipment such as equipment starters, switches, relays, circuit breaker panels, lighting;
  • Perform checks and maintenance according to preventive maintenance plans on equipment including generators, mills, crushers, pumps, conveyors, PLC’s, diesel motors, and other equipment;
  • Complete breakdown, corrective and minor reports;
  • Inspect, examine and test parts to recommend the extent and nature of the work to be done;
  • Test, adjust and calibrate repaired systems for accurate performance and to ensure that work meets manufacturer’s specifications and the functional needs of the operation;
  • Adjust, calibrate, repair or replace defective parts and components of the equipment systems;
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on equipment;
  • Conduct final inspections to ensure that work detailed on work order has been completed to meet safety standards;
  • Provide feedback improvement suggestions to the supervisor and planner and implement those that are within your ability;
  • Improve equipment availability and efficiency through quality maintenance and failure analysis.
About You
  • Industrial and/or Construction Electrician or 3-year engineering technology diploma;
  • Red seal certification in Industrial and/or Construction Electrician required;
  • Preference may be candidates with above qualifications and including an Industrial/Construction electrician red seal certification or registered apprenticeship;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ Journeyperson experience;
  • Previous mining or heavy industrial experience is required;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ underground experience an asset;
  • Previous experience with high voltage, underground conveyors, dewatering systems and communication systems would be an asset;
  • Demonstrate an excellent attendance record and proven safety performance;
  • Display strong troubleshooting capabilities;
  • Familiarity with Variable Frequency Drives, high voltage equipment, mobile mining equipment and the ability to read and understand electrical drawings;
  • Knowledge of the repair and maintenance of fixed plant equipment;
  • Innovation and ability to use initiative;
  • Flexibility regarding work activities and type of work requirements;
  • The ability to work in a multi-discipline, multi-tasking, team environment.
What We Offer
  • Competitive Salary and Site Premiums.
  • Opportunity to earn an annual Employee Bonus.
  • Attractive pension and benefits (company paid core coverage, flex health and dental coverage, flex accounts, disability plans and optional insurances).
  • Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation, sick, top up for maternity/parental).
  • Chartered flights within the province.
  • 24/7 access to a fully stocked cafeteria with balanced meals prepared by our culinary team.
  • Access to recreational facilities and social activities (cardio/weight room, gymnasium, music room, movie theatre, etc.).
  • Accommodations are equipped with cable TV, internet, and unlimited long-distance calling.
  • All Personal Protective Equipment is provided upon hire. Employees are given a safety boot allowance and receive a 100% reimbursement for prescription safety glasses.
  • Exposure to advanced mining technology and state of the art mechanized underground equipment.
  • Employee Family Assistance Program.
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion and career growth.
  • Opportunities to grow your career in a large global company, and mining industry leader.
  • Online training and career development opportunities.
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and Vale values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across our operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

Apply

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit their application online at https://vale.eightfold.ai/careers . Innu Nation members and Nunatsiavut beneficiaries can also submit their application to their Vale Aboriginal Employment Coordinator.

Deadline to Apply: Thursday, May 19th, 2022

  • Previous mining or heavy industrial experience is required;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ underground experience an asset;
  • Previous experience with high voltage, underground conveyors, dewatering systems and communication systems would be an asset;
  • Demonstrate an excellent attendance record and proven safety performance;
  • Display strong troubleshooting capabilities;
  • Familiarity with Variable Frequency Drives, high voltage equipment, mobile mining equipment and the ability to read and understand electrical drawings;
  • Knowledge of the repair and maintenance of fixed plant equipment;
  • Innovation and ability to use initiative;
  • Flexibility regarding work activities and type of work requirements;
  • The ability to work in a multi-discipline, multi-tasking, team environment.
What We Offer
  • Competitive Salary and Site Premiums.
  • Opportunity to earn an annual Employee Bonus.
  • Attractive pension and benefits (company paid core coverage, flex health and dental coverage, flex accounts, disability plans and optional insurances).
  • Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation, sick, top up for maternity/parental).
  • Chartered flights within the province.
  • 24/7 access to a fully stocked cafeteria with balanced meals prepared by our culinary team.
  • Access to recreational facilities and social activities (cardio/weight room, gymnasium, music room, movie theatre, etc.).
  • Accommodations are equipped with cable TV, internet, and unlimited long-distance calling.
  • All Personal Protective Equipment is provided upon hire. Employees are given a safety boot allowance and receive a 100% reimbursement for prescription safety glasses.
  • Exposure to advanced mining technology and state of the art mechanized underground equipment.
  • Employee Family Assistance Program.
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion and career growth.
  • Opportunities to grow your career in a large global company, and mining industry leader.
  • Online training and career development opportunities.
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and Vale values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across our operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

Apply

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit their application online at https://vale.eightfold.ai/careers . Innu Nation members and Nunatsiavut beneficiaries can also submit their application to their Vale Aboriginal Employment Coordinator.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Welcome to Vale in Canada. As a leader in the mining industry, our responsibility is to positively impact our people, communities and the environment. We value our workforce and offer continuous training and career development opportunities for our people.

Vale is a global leader in the production of iron ore and one of the largest producers of nickel. Active in Canada for over 100 years, Vale employs nearly 6,000 people across our corporate office in Toronto and sites in Manitoba, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador. Applying the latest technologies to sustainably produce nickel, copper, cobalt, platinum group metals, gold and silver is at the heart of what we do.

With our global headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and approximately 125,000 employees in over 30 countries, Vale is constantly growing and changing. We invite you to be part of our evolution.

Our open-pit mine and concentrator in Voisey’s Bay - Vale’s only fly-in/fly-out operation in Canada - produces nickel-cobalt-copper concentrate and copper concentrate. An underground expansion will see a transition to a leading edge underground mine extending the life of the mine until 2034. Our state-of the-art facility in Long Harbour is the first nickel processing plant in the world to use hydrometallurgy technology to produce Plating RoundsTM from hard rock (sulphide) concentrate, with low carbon footprint compared to traditional smelter technology. Our offices in St. John’s and Goose Bay provide support to the Newfoundland and Labrador Operations.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking a MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN – ELECTRICAN to join our Maintenance Team at our remote mine site in Voisey’s Bay, Labrador, a fly-in fly-out operation.

This permanent position is based at the Voisey’s Bay mine site in Labrador, a fly-in fly-out operation. This position is on a two week on, two week off rotation.

Reporting to the Underground Electrical Supervisor, the Maintenance Technician – Electrician will be responsible for installing, repairing, troubleshooting, adjusting, overhauling, servicing and maintaining equipment within surface and underground electrical installations, power distribution, mobile equipment, preventative maintenance programs and process equipment systems.

In This Position, You Will
  • Participate and advocate in a Zero Harm safety culture and all Health, Safety, Environment and Security programs within Vale;
  • Install, replace and repair electrical control and distribution equipment such as equipment starters, switches, relays, circuit breaker panels, lighting;
  • Perform checks and maintenance according to preventive maintenance plans on equipment including generators, mills, crushers, pumps, conveyors, PLC’s, diesel motors, and other equipment;
  • Complete breakdown, corrective and minor reports;
  • Inspect, examine and test parts to recommend the extent and nature of the work to be done;
  • Test, adjust and calibrate repaired systems for accurate performance and to ensure that work meets manufacturer’s specifications and the functional needs of the operation;
  • Adjust, calibrate, repair or replace defective parts and components of the equipment systems;
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on equipment;
  • Conduct final inspections to ensure that work detailed on work order has been completed to meet safety standards;
  • Provide feedback improvement suggestions to the supervisor and planner and implement those that are within your ability;
  • Improve equipment availability and efficiency through quality maintenance and failure analysis.
About You
  • Industrial and/or Construction Electrician or 3-year engineering technology diploma;
  • Red seal certification in Industrial and/or Construction Electrician required;
  • Preference may be candidates with above qualifications and including an Industrial/Construction electrician red seal certification or registered apprenticeship;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ Journeyperson experience;
  • Previous mining or heavy industrial experience is required;
  • Minimum of 5 years’ underground experience an asset;
  • Previous experience with high voltage, underground conveyors, dewatering systems and communication systems would be an asset;
  • Demonstrate an excellent attendance record and proven safety performance;
  • Display strong troubleshooting capabilities;
  • Familiarity with Variable Frequency Drives, high voltage equipment, mobile mining equipment and the ability to read and understand electrical drawings;
  • Knowledge of the repair and maintenance of fixed plant equipment;
  • Innovation and ability to use initiative;
  • Flexibility regarding work activities and type of work requirements;
  • The ability to work in a multi-discipline, multi-tasking, team environment.
What We Offer
  • Competitive Salary and Site Premiums.
  • Opportunity to earn an annual Employee Bonus.
  • Attractive pension and benefits (company paid core coverage, flex health and dental coverage, flex accounts, disability plans and optional insurances).
  • Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation, sick, top up for maternity/parental).
  • Chartered flights within the province.
  • 24/7 access to a fully stocked cafeteria with balanced meals prepared by our culinary team.
  • Access to recreational facilities and social activities (cardio/weight room, gymnasium, music room, movie theatre, etc.).
  • Accommodations are equipped with cable TV, internet, and unlimited long-distance calling.
  • All Personal Protective Equipment is provided upon hire. Employees are given a safety boot allowance and receive a 100% reimbursement for prescription safety glasses.
  • Exposure to advanced mining technology and state of the art mechanized underground equipment.
  • Employee Family Assistance Program.
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion and career growth.
  • Opportunities to grow your career in a large global company, and mining industry leader.
  • Online training and career development opportunities.
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and Vale values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across our operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

Apply

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit their application online at https://vale.eightfold.ai/careers . Innu Nation members and Nunatsiavut beneficiaries can also submit their application to their Vale Aboriginal Employment Coordinator.

title: Electrical Maintenance Technician
description:
The Opportunity:

Are you seeking an opportunity to demonstrate and develop your Electrical Maintenance Technician skill set? This is an incredible opportunity where you will oversee and execute all electrical equipment work for the Primary Upgrading mechanical maintenance team. You will be responsible for day-to-day maintenance, as well as shutdowns, unplanned outages, trouble shooting, planning and coordination to ensure successful plant operation. Your strong knowledge and experience in electrical systems and field operations will be demonstrated through your support of planning and coordinating maintenance related duties.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Responsible for the day to day electrical maintenance of the PUG mechanical maintenance department, performing both preventative maintenance and corrective maintenance while insuring that all relevant procedures are followed
  • Troubleshoot for electrical equipment up to 5 kV and coordinate with instrumentation and control systems which may include occasional after hours work based on operational requirements
  • Work in cooperation with both the Planning and Operations groups to scope out routine and major jobs and ensure jobs are prioritized and completed accordingly
  • Ensure that work is adequately documented in the CMMS (Maximo)
  • Follow procedures for operating switchgear and understanding PPE requirements
  • Identify recurring problems and document them so that an engineered solution can be provided
Other Details:

  • Job location: Fort McMurray, Alberta - Horizon Oil Sands site
  • Eligible for relocation pursuant to Canadian Natural’s Relocation Regular Policy
  • Company sponsored Fly-In/Fly-Out from Calgary or Edmonton
  • This is a safety sensitive position
  • Shift schedule: 7 Days on, 7 Days off (80 hours). Thursday start
  • Competitive salary, stock options, stock savings plan and benefits
Skills & Qualifications:

  • Minimum 5 years of demonstrated industry experience working with electrical systems in a heavy oil and/or oil sands environment plus Journeyman Electrician Trade Certificate
  • Familiarity with and understanding of Electrical equipment in a process facility environment including low and medium voltage equipment (up to 5kV), small and large motor VFD drives
  • Working knowledge of various PLC (Programmable Logic Controls) and program troubleshooting Device Net communication protocols, plant-wide DCS system (Delta V), Maximo CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System) or equivalent
  • Experience with Steam and Gas Turbine generators and controls considered an asset
Why Canadian Natural?

CANADIAN NATURAL is a senior independent crude oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Our strong, diversified asset base is comprised of a balanced portfolio of light, synthetic, and heavy crude oil and natural gas. Canadian Natural operates in Canada, the United Kingdom and Offshore Africa.

At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." We are committed to a long-term presence in the communities where we operate. Our activities create value by providing employment, business development opportunities, revenues to governments that contribute to spending on goods and services, and essential resources for public services, including health, safety, education and training.

Over the last 30 years, we have grown from a Company with nine employees to over 10,000 employees. We have increased our production from approximately 400 BOE/d in 1989 to more than one million BOE/d today.

Safety is a core value at Canadian Natural. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.

Canadian Natural Resources Limited - Canadian Natural - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.

Application deadline is May 10, 2022. Apply now!

Primary Location

Fort McMurray

Job

Mining & Oil Sands Operations

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
New-Life Mills

Denfield, ON

Join our team that shares your Passion & Heart for Canadian agriculture! Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited (P&H) has an opportunity for a motivated, forward-thinking, and dedicated individual as a Maintenance Technician based in Denfield, Ontario.

Work And Grow With a Family-owned Company.

Join our team with Purpose & History! P&H’s roots go back over 110 years. We have always been a Canadian, family-owned and managed agri-business that understands the qualities and conditions needed for meaningful growth. Our corporate culture values are family values; honesty and integrity with a focus on listening and continuous learning. Like family, we support our staff to always do better.

With over 70 locations spanning from coast to coast, and trade links around the globe, P&H is growth-oriented, diversified and vertically integrated with operations spanning across grain merchandising, flour milling, crop input distribution and animal feed production.

Skills and experience for the next step in your career.

As Maintenance Technician, the successful candidate will be responsible for executing a preventative maintenance program, troubleshooting and identifying problematic equipment and developing solutions to repair plant equipment in a safe and efficient manner. Maintaining the safety and reliability of machinery and equipment is critical in achieving optimal production efficiency and minimizing downtime of the feed mill operations.

Your day to day activities will include:
  • Conduct mechanical and preventative maintenance on plant machinery and equipment
  • Perform troubleshooting, repair and maintenance of machinery and equipment
  • Prepare and update preventative maintenance program
  • Participate in water treatment programs involving high pressure steam equipment
  • Work effectively in a feed manufacturing environment with emphasis and compliance to Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) requirements
  • Optimize safety and reliability of machines and equipment by following and complying with appropriate precautions to prevent risk to employees and to the product
  • Complete and update maintenance reports as per company and regulatory standards
  • Perform maintenance post clean up and maintain high standard of sanitation and housekeeping in the production area and maintenance shop
  • Proactively forecast Parts needs/requirements and order accordingly

The successful candidate should enter the position with the following qualifications:
  • 1+ years of experience in a maintenance position, preferably in a manufacturing or production environment
  • Some experience in electrical and/or pneumatic equipment is required
  • Millwright or Electricians certificate is an asset
  • Knowledge of feed manufacturing and processing equipment is a definite asset
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Effective time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Ability to work 10 hour shifts, which would include every second weekend
  • On call availability for emergency repairs during evenings and weekends

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Learn more about us at

P&H is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that is reflective of Canadian society. As a result, Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited is an equal opportunity employer and is in compliance with the Employment Equity Act. We welcome applications from women, aboriginal people, people with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Accommodations in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Powered by JazzHR
