title: Production Technician
description:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.


 

Position Description:

To produce veterinary biologics according to a defined production schedule following cGMP guidelines and specific outlines of production to meet market demands for Aquaculture products.

Functions, Duties, Task:

  • Adhere to the principles of “Safety first, Quality always”
  • Perform biologics recovery and purifications using process scale TFF unit, columns and chromatography system.
  • Operate and maintain production instruments and equipment, such as  pH Meters, Conductivity meters, spectrophotometer, TFF equipment, Peristaltic pumps , rotary pumps , chromatography systems/
  • Perform column packing using packing skids, integrity testing on various types of filters and process analysis using spectrophotometer
  • Write and review batch records, SOPs, qualification documents for the downstream operations.
  • Purchase raw material/ production items and make required updates in SAP.
  • Comply with safety requirements, cGMP, SOP and manufacturing documentation.
  • Collaborate with other departments involved in GMP manufacturing for planning production, testing and product release in a timely manner resulting in successful completion of projects.
  • Work cross functional with the upstream manufacturing group to provide resources as needed.
  • Perform tasks under minimal supervision, and within tight time lines to meet production schedules.
  • Assist in the maintenance of production equipment in good condition as per manufacturer’s specifications
  • Responsibilities include cleaning and sterilizing items used in  down streaming applications
  • Maintain the cleanliness of the production areas and assist in disinfection procedures as needed

Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications):

  • Bachelor’s  Degree in a life sciences (e.g. Biochemistry, Chemistry)
  • 1-3 years of pharmaceutical/biological manufacturing experience in GMP environment
  • 1-3 years of experience in purification of biologics using large scale TFF and chromatography.
  • Process knowledge of TFF filtration and chromatography
  • Experience with operating Unicorn software is required.  

Additional Preferences:

  • Intermediate/Expert computer software skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point), SAP and control systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, both communications and written. The candidate in this position must be able to communicate effectively with Management and staff.

Other Information:

  • Must be able to work shift work (12 hour daytime shifts, 3-4 days/week including some weekends) and overtime as required
  • Required to assist in disinfection procedures involving hazardous chemicals requiring the use of a respirator.
  • Must be able to lift, move and maneuver small-medium sized equipment – up to 25lbs.
  • Requires ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Requires frequent ladder or stair climbing
  • Must be able to read, write, understand, and comply with appropriate standard operating procedures.

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Wheel Assembly Technician (NTD) - Full time
description:
.

National Tire Distributors is Canada's leading Tire Distribution Company. A key element of our success has always been our people. As part of our team philosophy, we coach, support and help develop all of our employees to become the best they can be! If you're looking for a career that will challenge you, a job that will offer growth, and a progressive employer, then National Tire Distributors Inc. (NTD) is the right place for you!

The Wheel Assembly Technician is responsible for wheel and tire installation for the Assembly Program using tire machine, balancer, and all other shipping and warehouse related equipment. This includes preparation, storage and staging.

   

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Partnering with Wheel Assembly Program Specialist and site leadership
  • Provide quality installation and balancing of wheel and tire assemblies
  • Responsible for wheel assembly area housekeeping
  • Report damaged product to site leadership and the Wheel Assembly Program Specialist
  • Designate and organize the wheel assembly area
  • Follow all safety training and SOP’s relative to wheel assembly program
  • Complete all required Tire Industry Association (TIA) training and all other organization specified training
  • Meet scheduled delivery timelines
  • Prioritize and pick material to fill orders and stage product for loading
  • Provide quality packaging of wheel assembly product to prevent damage in transit of product to our customers
  • Assist site leadership with ordering/maintaining wheel assembly supplies
  • Assist site leadership with equipment maintenance and preventative maintenance
  • Assist site leadership with program reporting requirements
  • Operate powered industrial vehicles (forklifts, pallet jacks, order pickers, etc.) in safe manner and maintain operator certification
  • Operate all wheel assembly equipment in safe manner
  • Other duties as assigned

Experience that Best Prepares You:

  • Wheel or tire assembly experience considered an asset

Key Competencies:

  • Possess excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Ability to start, control and maintain a complete process or procedure, while keeping safety and compliance at the forefront
  • Ability to carry out oral and written instructions
  • Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative relationships with those contacted during the course of work.
  • Maintain order schedule timelines
  • Ability to provide consistent quality product to our customers

We offer:

  • $19/hour
  • Excellent group health benefits, including health, dental, paramedical, vision, etc. with only 30 day waiting period
  • Production bonus
  • RRSP Company Matching
  • Tire Purchase Program for family and friends
  • Workperks - Discounts on over 3000 Vendors
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Paid Vacation
  • Vacation Purchase Program
  • Personal Time Off Days
  • Winning Culture
  • Micro-learning platform
  • and more!


Apply online or in person. Same day, on-site interviews and offers.

We are located at:

14404 – 128 Avenue N.W.
Edmonton, AB T5L 3H6
Canada

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

title: Production Assembler/Technician
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edgetechnology such as the Cocoon® Platform . The responsibilitiesinclude:removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety 

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Operations Technician - Associate
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 

The On-Site Technology Support group in Edmonton, AB is looking for an experienced individual to fulfil a 12 month temporary position. The On-site Technology Support (OSTS) Technician provides high-level technical support in accordance with EY Firm policy. The candidate should have a background performing in-person support in a professional environment and possess very strong customer interfacing skills. 
 

Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

 

  • Technology support for +/- 150 customers.
  • Laptop troubleshooting, maintenance, and administration.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of Win10, Office 365
  • Instant Messaging tools, TEAMs
  • Excellent customer service skills, meeting with users in person to resolve complex technology issues.
  • Ability to perform root cause analysis to quickly recover from service interruptions and to prevent recurring problems.
  • Anticipate and respond to complex technology support issues.
  • Perform software and Firmware upgrades and testing as needed or part of an initiative or project.
  • Provide technical guidance and consult with EY customer stakeholders.
  • Knowledge and understanding of HP print devices.
  • Document and track the status of inquiries, coordinate appropriate responses, and follow-up to ensure customer satisfaction using Service Now.
  • Analyze the impact of decisions, and guide others through the solution process in order to satisfy customer, OSTS and Firm needs and objectives.
  • Provide meaningful contributions to team efforts to enhance overall departmental effectiveness.
  • Leverage multiple resources or coordinating with other teams to meet customer needs.
  • Facilitate the implementation and support of defined EY Technology solutions.
  • Communicate system updates to customers as required.
  • Participate in postmortem analysis of significant projects or events, sharing best practice techniques and solutions.
  • Share solutions throughout Global IT using appropriate channels. Familiar with Yammer, SharePoint and other collaboration tools.

 

To qualify, candidates must have:

 

  • Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline; or equivalent work experience in IT Support
  • Approximately 1-3 plus years of experience in support of IT products 
  • Technical expertise in various facets of PC support, which may include PC applications, hardware, tools, utilities, networking, telecommunications 
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills 
  • Ability to simultaneously work on multiple projects or assignments in a fast-paced and highly challenging environment 
  • Able to work effectively with high level customers and other management personnel
  • Excellent Customer Service skills.

 

What we offer

 

As part of this role, you'll work in a highly integrated, global team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer: 

 

  • Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
  • Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
  • Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
  • Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

 

Please apply to this role only through the ‘Apply’ link (not through the local office). Your application will then be routed to the appropriate recruiting team.    

 

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. 

 

 

EY | Building a better working world 

 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

 

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

 

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: PRODUCTION TECHNICIAN
description:
Job Description

While you might see a lot of job offers for production technicians, being one at EACOM Ear Falls, a subsidiary of INTERFOR, means getting to work right in the heart of nature. You'll be around wood, wood and more wood. Your eagle eyes will help keep the yard and sawmill looking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working at our sawmills with deep roots in the northern regions of Ontario and Quebec. You'll discover that they do more than just transform wood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Come work at EACOM, where we pull out all the stops for your success. Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.
Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.


Additional Information

At EACOM, we're here for you.

EACOM supports employment equity. Diversity is not only welcome, it’s encouraged! We’ll contact you if you are selected for an interview. If you need special accommodations, let us know. Any information you send us will be treated with respect and confidentiality. Gender diversity is also important. Know that women are definitely welcome!

title: Production Technician
description:
Mitrex, an Integrated solar and construction solution provider, is looking for a experienced Production Technician/Stringer to operate highly automated machines in a manufacturing setting to reach the production goal
At Mitrex, we develop and manufacture solar construction materials for buildings and large structures (Mitrex
com)
As the world's first manufacturer to develop customizable solar solutions, we are revolutionizing the construction industry, while helping to move the world toward clean, sustainable energy production
We are an equal opportunity employer with great company culture
The successful candidate will join our production team in Etobicoke, and report to the Production Supervisor
COMPETENCIES Minimum 2 years Technical College Diploma or equivalent training and experience, Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar production role within an automated high-volume manufacturing environment, Able to read and understand production assembly drawings, Must have a good mechanical aptitude and be detail-oriented, Must have experience developing best quality practices, analyzing quality testing/inspection data, and developing test procedures, Proven proficiency with computers and statistical software packages, Able to work efficiently both independently and as a team
RESPONSIBILITIES Read, interpret, and execute production schedules and assembly drawings, Perform work and quality practices as per Standardized Work Instructions, Monitor the creation of scrap/non-conforming material – Trouble-shoot scrap generating issues, perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions, Support training of new staff, audit existing work instructions, and participate in Continuous Improvement initiatives/projects, Facilitate material movement within the plant and adhere to inventory control practices, Perform shipping/receiving functions as directed, Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor/Management WHAT WE OFFER Salary of $25+/hour based on experience, plus an annual bonus based on performance
Extended medical and health coverage (including vision, dental, and life) Wellness program including free healthy foods, medicinal provisions, and discounted gym and fitness class memberships Competitive RRSP Matching for tenured employees Free charging and reserved parking for electric vehicles Collaborative and diverse culture, open concept modern office space Unlimited room for advancement and growth Backed by 20 years of experience through our parent company, GCAT Group Full-time and permanent position AODA Considerations Mitrex Inc
welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process
Process We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all candidates from diverse backgrounds
Candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada (without employer sponsorship) and can commute to the office every day are welcome to apply
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in our company
However, due to the number of applications we receive, only qualified candidates will be contacted
No phone calls (except for accommodation requests) or unsolicited agency calls, please

title: Production Technician
description:
Production Technician
North West Geomatics
Calgary, AB
At Hexagon Geosystems, we know that the success of our business is a direct result of our highly motivated and collaborative staff. And we stand by this fact: We value our people as much as we value our business. We pride ourselves on providing a stimulating work experience and cultivating teams that encourage learning, so that you can hone your expertise and grow in your career.

DO WHAT YOU LOVE: We are not afraid to try new things, take calculated risks, and find new opportunities. We value performance over procedure, setting measurable goals, and working collaboratively to achieve the results we seek.
LOVE WHAT YOU DO: Whether you're fresh out of college or a seasoned professional, we offer an environment where your professional aspirations can become reality. With offices around the world, we celebrate a diverse set of smart and talented people who are passionate about building solutions that solve real world problems

Main Duties include:

  • Quality control of incoming data (raw data)
  • Setting of radiometry (color)
  • Seamline editing
  • Final QC
  • Bridge fixes
  • Assuring quality of ortho-rectified imagery
  • Testing new technology

title: Journalier assembleur
description:
** PRIME D'EMBAUCHE DE 1 500$**

Tu es à la recherche d'un emploi dans le secteur du métal, acier et aluminium et tu aimerais rejoindre une équipe jeune et dynamique avec possibilités d'avancement ?

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un journalier assembleur de jour à St-Bruno de Montavrille sur la Rive-Sud de Montréal.

Le poste de journalier assembleur est un poste permanent avant plusieurs avantages et un salaire compétitif entre 24 et 26$/h !

Appelle-nous sans tarder et envoie-nous ton CV !

marie-christine.beland@randstad.ca
450 463-4114

Avantages
Voici les avanatges concernant le poste de journalier assembleur à St-Bruno :

-- Prime d’embauche de 1500$ !!
- Poste permanent
- Salaire compétitif entre 24 et 26$/heure
- Équipe jeune et dynamique
- Possibilité d'avancement
- Horaire flexible de jour entrée entre 6h30 et 8h00 pm selon ton choix
- Possibilité de temps supplémentaire
- Assurances payées à 50% par l'employeur
- 2 semaines de vacances dès l'embauche

Responsabilités
Voici les tâches pour le postes de journalier asembleur à St-Bruno :

- Placer et ajyuster les matrices sur les outils de formage
- Placer les pièces chauffées ou non, sur la matrice de presse ou autre outil de forage
- Conduire des presses ou autres machines à forger à chaud ou à froid pour façconner le métal
- Vérifier les produits pour s'assurer de leur conformité quant à leur forme, dimensions
- Effectuer des travaux de menuiserie reliés aux caisses de bois, utilisation de la scie, couleuse et traqueuse
- Couper du bois avec la scie circulaire fixe en respectant les dimensions demandées
- Faire le suivi des travaux auprès du superviseur


Qualifications
Voici les qualifications demandées pour le poste de journalier assembleur à St-Bruno :

- DES complété ou l'équivalent
- 1 à 2 ans d'expérience en travail manuel
- Formation en ferblanterie ou tôlerie un atout
- Minutieux souci du détail
- Conduite d'un chariot élévateur un atout



Sommaire
Ce poste t'intéresse? Appelle-nous sans tarder !

Marie-Christine ou Roxanne au 450-463-4114 ou envoi ton CV à marie-christine.beland@randstad.ca.

N'oublie pas de m'ajouter sur Facebook pour rester à l'affût de nos nouvelles offres d'emplois !

https://www.facebook.com/randstadlongueuil5029/

Connaissez-vous des gens à la recherche d’un emploi? Dites-leur de nous appeler!
Pour chaque personne que vous nous référerez et que nous emploierons durant au moins
4 semaines consécutives ou que nous embaucherons pour un poste permanent, nous vous donnerons 100$. Facile, non?
Appelez-nous aujourd’hui pour plus de détails au 450.463.4114
*Assurez-vous que la personne référée mentionne votre nom durant l’appel.

Le marché de l’emploi d'aujourd’hui regorge de défis. Chez Randstad Canada, nous nous engageons à vous aider à relever ces défis et à trouver les perspectives de carrière les plus prometteuses. Nous pouvons vous aider à faire vos recherches, à présenter votre candidature, à vous préparer à l’entrevue et à décrocher l’emploi qui vous convient.

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Assembleur mécanique
description:
Tu aimerais travailler de soir ou sinon de nuit la fin de semaine à Blainville ?
Tu cherches un lieu de travail sans vivre de la pression ?
Tu aimes faire un assemblage de matériel au complet, du début à la fin ?
Tu es capable de lire un plan ?
Tu es habile avec des petits outils ?
Tu aimes travailler seul sur le projet et demander l'aide au besoin ?

Eh bien j'ai le poste de tes rêves, il existe vraiment ! Et pas très loin de chez toi ! C est juste à Blainville

Déjà intéressé ?


Voici comment vous faire connaître :

- Téléphonez directement : 450.437.3038 demandez Patricia, Brigitte ou Sara
- Envoyez votre CV par courriel : patricia.beaudet@randstad.ca ou brigitte.dufeu@randstad.ca ou sara.weber@randstad.ca
- Par texto : 438-341-0708




Avantages
Je te parles des avantages maintenant pour ce poste d'assembleur mécanique à Blainville :

- Salaire 20,80$ plus des primes soir ou nuit selon ce que tu choisis
- Assurance collective complète
- Des congés mobiles ( équivaut à une semaine)
- Augmentation annuelle garantie à chaque année de 1$ sans le demander !
- Aucune pression, juste de la qualité au travail !
- Toujours de nouveaux projets à partir

Responsabilités
Que vas tu faire comme tâches pour le psote d'assembleur mécanique à Blainville ?

- Pouvoir lire des plans et suivre le montage
- Assembler les différentes composantes à l'aide de différents outils qui se trouvent à ton atelier
- Effectuer des tests de qualité une fois le montage terminé


Qualifications
Quelles sont les qualités pour ce poste en assemblage mécanique à Blainville ?

- Avoir des habilités manuelles et une certaine force physique même si vous avez à votre disposition beaucoup d'équipement d'aide à levage
- Avoir des notions mécaniques et ou une logique mécanique
- Aimer travailler sur son propre établi et être autonome.

Sommaire
Un lieu qui fait bon vivre ... C est ici !... Et ça existe pour vrai !

Tu es convaincu que le poste d'assemblage mécanqiue et ce poste semble être est fait pour toi? Ne tardez pas à nous envoyer ta candidature.

Voici comment te faire connaître :

- Téléphone directement : 450.437.3038 demandez Patricia, Brigitte ou Sara
- Envoie ton CV par courriel : patricia.beaudet@randstad.ca ou brigitte.dufeu@randstad.ca ou sara.weber@randstad.ca
- Par texto, envoie ‘assemblage mecanique : 438-341-0708



Ce poste n’est pas ce que tu cherche? Contacte-nous, nous avons assurément un autre poste qui pourrait te convenir.

TU connais quelqu’un qui pourrait être intéressé? Référe-nous des gens pour avoir un boni de 100 $ après 4 semaines à l’emploi !

Randstad, l'humain en tête !


Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
*Please note that this position is based in Québec, Canada, therefore the job posting is written in French.

Tu aimes voir un projet grandir grâce à ton travail et tes efforts? Tu aimes assembler des machines, manipuler des outils et lire des plans? Viens contribuer au succès de notre équipe en tant qu’assembleur mécanique!

Ta future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Lire et interpréter les plans et instructions d’assemblage mécanique
  • Réaliser des assemblages 
  • Effectuer des ajustements mécaniques sur des machines
  • Utiliser les outils usuels d’assemblage et d’ajustements mécaniques
  • Participer aux tâches reliées à l’intégration et au chargement des équipements fabriqués
  • Avoir une vision santé et sécurité et travailler de façon sécuritaire
  • Effectuer diverses tâches connexes – meuler, percer, couper et poinçonner

Compétences requises

  • Bonne capacité en lecture de plans
  • Formation en soudage, en mécanique, en mécanique industrielle, en fabrication métallique et soudage ou toute autre formation connexe – un atout 
  • Esprit d’équipe
  • Bonne capacité à communiquer
  • Débrouillardise

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • À la fine pointe de la technologie, nos usines sont pensées pour faciliter la collaboration et prioriser la santé, ainsi que la sécurité de nos équipiers. Travailler chez Premier Tech, c’est avoir la possibilité de toujours apprendre, d’améliorer ses compétences et de se spécialiser.

Ces mots te parlent?

mécanique, assemblage, travail d’équipe, polyvalence, production, manufacturier

Envie d’en savoir plus? Postule directement en ligne, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Assembly Technician (Richmond)
 
At Dynamix Agitators, we specialize in engineering and manufacturing agitators and mixers for industrial process markets worldwide. Our customers include some of the world's leading energy and natural resource companies, as well as some of the largest chemical manufacturing companies. Due to continual growth, we are in need of a dynamic and outgoing individual to join our Production Team in the role of an Assembly Technician.

About the job:
  • Hands-on assembly of mixers, comprising electric motors, shafts, and other components while using basic tools and machinery.
  • Attention to detail in following Quality Control measures related to the assembly of components is essential.
  • Our facilities are organized and clean, and the staff is supportive.
  • The office hours are 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm Monday - Friday with 1 hour for a lunch break.
 
About you:
  • A good mechanical aptitude.
  • You have strong attention to detail relating to hands-on assembly processes.
  • A good understanding of basic quality control requirements.
  • Able to continually produce a quality assembly.
  • Experience in a fast-paced manufacturing or assembly-related environment.
  • Physically fit and able to handle some minor lifting while assembling components.
  • Committed to working safely at all times.
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Reliable team player with good customer service abilities.
 
Nice To Have:
  • Shipping/Receiving experience.
  • Forklift operator certificate.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office.

We recognize that our employees are the cornerstone of our accomplishments and we pride ourselves on being people of passion and integrity. We've created a collaborative work environment with growth opportunities. While high-quality standards are our priority, we do recognize the importance of a healthy work/life balance. Dynamix Agitators offers attractive compensation and benefits, on-the-job training, and a welcoming work environment. If this sounds like you and you match most of our requirements, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and cover letter explaining why you want to join our team.

Note: Office is not easily accessible by Transit.

To read more about us please visit www.dynamixinc.com.

title: Production Technician (Evening Shift)
description:
About the Company:

Auxly Charlottetown  is a world-class developer of innovative cannabis products for the wellness-focused consumer, wholly owned by  Auxly Cannabis Group Inc.   Proudly processed at our  52,000 sq. ft., state-of-the-art facility  in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Auxly Charlottetown's products are developed and manufactured on-site by a world-class team of scientists and experts, ensuring high-quality, precision and consistency. Auxlyâ€™s  wellness products, available at licensed cannabis retailers across Canada, consist of non-GMO  capsules and oils. Built on the pillars of quality,  safety and efficacy, Auxly  is cannabis â€“ down to a science.  

Overview:

Reporting to the Director of Operations, the Production Technician will work in and maintain the standards of a cGMP packing environment, which may include an ISO-8 clean room.   Ensure orders are done accurately and in a timely manner while maintaining high quality standards. Hours: 4:30pm-1am.  

 

The key candidate will be well organized, have an eye for detail, be a team player, and a good communicator.

What can you expect to do:
  • Preparing equipment and extracted oils for packaging.
  • Operating packaging and labelling equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining packaging equipment and room facilities.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all dry materials, chemicals and equipment used in the clean room facility.
  • Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment, and preparing requisitions as needed.
  • Storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping clean room, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Washing and sterilizing formulation vessels used for packaging.
  • Performing clerical work related to packing activities such as word processing, record keeping, filing.
  • Maintaining material safety data sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Other duties as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
  • Reporting and information management: must have proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with process management, team problem solving, and inventory control.
  • Must remain in compliance with local, state, federal, and internal policies and regulations for working in the cannabis industry.
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment.
  • Good organizational skills, and strong attention to detail.

title: Mechanical Assembler 1
description:
Position Overview:

Reporting to the Production Manager, this position reviews and clarifies Material Information documents in order to mechanically assemble or make standard modifications to doors, sub assemblies, and parts of the Tilt Table apparatus.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

In this function you will:

  • Perform standard modifications to doors by operating equipment/tools needed to modify components, adhering to standard Material Information documents or the direction from more experienced staff
  • Assemble and install doors, vertical bus, ground bus, channel sills, neutral bus and sub assemblies, e.g., uprights, channel braces, cross braces, etc and components by using various hand tools, hardware, and equipment, adhering to requirements in standard Material Information documents or the direction from an MA 2 or MA 3
  • Check the quality of my work and verify the quality of the doors, sub-assemblies and structures on the tilt table by visually checking for flaws etc., completing the appropriate checklists and following standard procedures in work instructions or direction from an MA 2, MA 3 to replace or repair defects
  • Maintain the accuracy of the BOH inventory of stocked materials by cycle counting identified stocked material, matching package labels to the actual material description and quantity, managing material transactions using the hand withdrawal process
  • Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the internal KANBAN system by following set procedures for labelling each bin and bin location, using components allocated or stored specific to each job and triggering KanBan cards as each bin is emptied
  • Partner with Marketing/MI to assist in the development of standard method sheets by providing feedback and input to new/revised test procedures/standard method sheets

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 education.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • familiar with common hand and air tools
  • heat shrink oven
  • corner notcher
  • router
  • grinder
  • fibreglass shear
  • vertical bus cutter
  • copper punch press
  • Effective communication/interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision
  • Demonstrates continuous learning through cross training, learning new skills and refreshing prior skills
  • Knowledge/experience with job drawing packages

Position Criteria:

  • Basic computer skills.
  • Basic understanding of reading layout schematic and manufacturing information
  • Effective interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to work in a team environment with minimal supervision.

Accessibility Statement

“Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities.  If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.   Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html

We make what matters work. Everywhere you look—from the technology and machinery that surrounds us, to the critical services and infrastructure that we depend on every day—you’ll find one thing in common. It all relies on power. That’s why Eaton is dedicated to improving people’s lives and the environment with power management technologies that are more reliable, efficient, safe and sustainable. Because this is what matters.

We are confident we can deliver on this promise because of the attributes that our employees embody. We’re ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and we’re committed to learning. These values enable us to tackle some of the toughest challenges on the planet, never losing sight of what matters.

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Entry Level
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Electrical Assembly & Test Technician
description:
Location: Downtown Toronto

Type: Permanent, Full-Time

Start date: Immediately

Experience: Electronics assemblers, fabricators, inspectors, and testers


Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis.


About Able Innovations

We build dynamic robotic platforms that push the technical envelope to deliver products and services capable of transforming how healthcare is delivered. We are developing smart, robust, and well-integrated systems that are easy to use, practical, and can be delivered at a massive scale.


The needs of our healthcare system and its staff are rising at an unprecedented rate due to the aging demographic and the fallout of COVID-19. The act of transferring individuals and patients (i.e. between beds, stretchers, etc.) places a disproportionate strain on staff and resources causing injuries and inefficiencies. At Able Innovations, we are focused on automating this process of patient transfers and have a vision of one day being able to use the same technology to provide independence to anyone who today depends on assistance to be transferred.


About the position

At Able Innovations Inc. our goal is to innovate and create revolutionary technology with the purpose of providing greater independence and mobility for people with disabilities. As a new start-up, we are quickly growing and looking for new team members who are driven, passionate, and hard-working. The selected candidate will play a crucial role in product development including assembling and testing working physical prototypes. The candidate will be working collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team of engineers at various levels of experience. You'll be exposed to the integration of mechatronic systems through hardware, firmware, and software. To succeed, the candidate must be passionate about their work with a "do whatever-it-takes attitude".

Job Duties:

  • Build prototype PCB boards
  • Conduct troubleshooting and testing on products
  • Track product validation plan and progress
  • Assemble prototype units and provide feedback
  • Operate devices for demonstrations
  • Occasionally fabricate jigs, fixtures, or parts for reworking

Required Skills:

  • Knowledge of safe workplace practices when working with equipment
  • Soldering skills and electrical and electronic wiring skills.
  • Able to read the schematics and have basic PCB knowledge.
  • Knowledge of electrical and electronic components, such as transistors, diodes, relays, circuit breakers, etc.
  • Problem Solving and Troubleshooting skills
  • Experience in assembling electromechanical systems
  • Must enjoy being hands-on
  • Motivated with a strong work ethic
  • Experience with the fabrication of metal components including lathes, drills, etc.
  • Good knowledge of MS office suite as well as Google Docs and Google sheets

Bonus Skills:

  • Individuals with extracurricular experience (not just through coursework) demonstrating interest in engineering design or the med-tech field.
  • Knowledge of C/C++, Python software programming languages.

Please submit your resume and cover letter as a single PDF document with the naming format "JET202204_Firstname_Lastname". Feel free to include any relevant projects/portfolios.

Feel free to include any relevant projects/portfolios.', 'Experience in assembling electromechanical systems', 'Type: Permanent, Full-Time', 'Build prototype PCB boards', 'Individuals with extracurricular experience (not just through coursework) demonstrating interest in engineering design or the med-tech field.', 'Operate devices for demonstrations', 'Must enjoy being hands-on', 'Soldering skills and electrical and electronic wiring skills.', 'Experience: Electronics assemblers, fabricators, inspectors, and testers', 'Occasionally fabricate jigs, fixtures, or parts for reworking', 'Able to read the schematics and have basic PCB knowledge.']

title: SATURDAYS General Line Assembly - Days and Afternoons
description:
GENERAL LABOUR
Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?
Do you consider yourself a team player? Are you double-vaccinated and eligible to work in Canada? If so, we want to hear from you! At MLF Speedvale, we pride ourselves on our commitment to our team members and producing quality products!

Who we are!
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.
The Role:
Maple Leaf Foods at 643 Speedvale Ave. W., in Guelph is accepting applications for General Labourers within our Prepared Meats Plant which specializes in Lunches, Snacking, & Charcuterie products.Duties may include:
  • Putting empty trays into the denester and placing appropriate quantities of components into the trays.
  • Rotating competently within all positions of the work cell
  • Taking an active role in changeover procedures and achieving line speed efficiencies
  • Visual quality checks of product against customer and internal specifications (Including foreign materials, weight checks, gas and program settings)
  • Ability to maintain cleanliness of areas of responsibility
  • Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE and comply with safety requirements including ensuring power is shut down on equipment prior to specified tasks (Lockout / Tagout may be applicable)
  • Frequent reaching and standing are required
  • Other duties as assigned

Hours of Work:
  • Monday to Friday with occasional Saturday overtime.
  • Shift times are:
    • 6:30am – 3:00pm
    • 3:15pm – 11:45pm

What we are looking for:
  • Ability to read, write and communicate in English.
  • Interact and share information with employees at all levels (Team members, Lead Hands, Supervisors, Others). Actively participates in their work group.
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks. Is willing to try new things and assume additional responsibilities (assists with changeovers, keeps up with line speed requirements)
  • Must be able to handle all food/pork products, stand for an extended period of timeand work in a cold environment
  • Employees will receive the necessary training and may be required to complete an evaluation in order to receive the higher wage rate within this categories progression

Why Choose Maple Leaf Foods?
  • Leading Consumer Protein Company
  • Essential business during COVID-19
  • Competitive Wages: Starting rate is $16.91/hour with ability to earn up to $17.66/hour
  • Afternoon shift premium of $0.35/hour
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Extended Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, and Long-Term Disability)
  • Pension Program
  • Referral Bonus Program
  • Gain Sharing Program – Potential to earn up to $0.60/hour extra!
  • Clean and safe environment
  • Personal Protective Equipment provided
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Equal Opportunity Employer
Please apply online or in-person today!

* New Walk-In Fridays! *
Onsite interviews every Friday from 10:00am - 2:00pm
643 Speedvale Ave W

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employeestobe fully vaccinated byMarch 31, 2022and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to their first day of work.. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team ataccommodations@mapleleaf.comor 905-285-5862. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Mechanical Assembly Technician
description:
Job Description

In this role, you will:

  • Assemble Vention’s productized applications (safety enclosures, palletizers, robot cells, machine tending applications)

  • Integrate automation components and program robots to complete the automation sequences

  • Conduct quality control activities prior to shipping customer products

  • Prepare automation cells for shipment according to our shipping standards

  • Autonomously plan your workload based on team production priorities

  • Identify discrepancies or lack of information

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of Vention's integration processes and tools

  • Update internal system with assembly information

Qualifications

  • 1 to 2 years of experience in a fast-paced work environment

  • Technical diploma in mechanical engineering or robotics

  • Proactive problem solver, capable of identifying issues and generating solutions

  • Attention to detail in the context of customer satisfaction

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and teamwork skills



Additional Information

We stand proudly for our people and support their success through career development and advancement. We are recognized and respected for our culture of inclusion and belonging, continuously striving to do what’s good for our people and communities.

title: Mechanical Assembly Technician
description:
Come be a part of a fast paced, exciting environment in the plastics welding and automation industry. SPM has assembled a young, talented team of mechanical and electrical designers, project managers, machine builders, millwrights and electricians to work in a collaborative manner. As we lead the way in new technology development, prototyping, plastics joining, finishing and assembly applications we look to expand our team with like minded, driven individuals looking for a challenge. SPM provides a clean, safe environment to work within. Health benefits are provided upon completion of successful probation period.

 

Join us as we expand our horizons and continue to maintain the highest of standards. All applications will be reviewed and considered. Ask us about our current job incentive program!

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build sub-assemblies & assemblies to specification
  • Modify components as needed (using manual hand tools and/or Bridgeport, lathe, etc.)
  • Read blueprints
  • Prepare components for finishing (paint, nickel plate, etc.)
  • Perform assembly according to build standards
  • Maintain clean work environment
  • Ensure excellent workmanship and professional atmosphere
  • Ensure safety of all personnel and equipment

Expectations:

  • Able to properly plan and work through any assembly issues
  • Responsible for maintaining proper build standards and informing Project Assembly Leader of any assembly problems or drawing changes
  • Determine effective solutions for work at hand
  • Must interact with co-workers, as well as have skills to interact with customers in a service call situation
  • Good communication skills are required to interact with co-workers, suppliers, and customers from time to time
  • Ensure assembly work is planned to minimize waste. Organize work area and work flow to ensure safety and efficiency
  • Responsible for accurate time keeping and signed out equipment
  • Work day shift (8-10 hours and overtime as needed)
  • Reliable transportation to and from work (Must hold valid driverâ€™s licence)
  • Ability to travel and perform customer service calls in the US and Mexico

 

Experience:

At least 3-5 years of experience is required

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
About Vicinity Motor Corp.

Vicinity Motor Corp. (NASDAQ:VEV) (TSXV:VMC) (FRA:6LGA) is a North American supplier of electric vehicles for both public and commercial enterprise use. The Company leverages a dealer network and close relationships with world-class manufacturing partners to supply its flagship electric, CNG and clean-diesel Vicinity buses, the VMC 1200 electric truck and a VMC Optimal-EV shuttle bus. In addition, the Company sells its proprietary electric chassis alongside J.B. Poindexter business unit EAVX, the Companyâ€™s strategic partner, for upfitting into next-generation delivery vehicles. For more information, please visit www.vicinitymotorcorp.com.

Extremely rare opportunity to join a rapidly growing public company (listed on TSXV and Nasdaq) with revenues, historical profits, and a head office in the lower mainland.  The company currently designs, develops, and manufactures buses for public transit and has recently introduced an electric bus, electric shuttle bus, and electric truck which are already selling into the market.  2022 will be a pivotal year of change and growth for the Company.  The company is currently building a new manufacturing facility in Washington state within driving distance of the Canadian head office, and is actively engaged in M&A activity to potentially grow the overall global footprint. 

 

We are currently looking for a Mechanical Assembler

 

Responsibilities:

  • Skills in assembly of equipment including minor fabrication functions. 

  • Any other general shop skills are a plus.  

  • Experience in an automotive or heavy-duty shop environment. 

  • Safely moving parts and materials with the use of overhead cranes and forklift. 

  • Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work environment. 

  • Comply with company safety and work policies. 

  • Collaborate with other team members to solve technical issues and maintain production schedule and quality. 

  • Read, interpret, and follow basic diagrams, engineering drawings, specifications, bills of materials, and other instructions or procedures to accurately fabricate and assemble materials and equipment. 

  • Set up and operate fabricating machines, such as cold cutter, grinding and drill presses, cut, drill, or otherwise form and assemble metal components. 

  • Fabricate, modify and/or install various metallic or non-metallic items and components. 

  • Perform metal corrections and touch-up painting as directed. 

  • Install and/or modify various metallic or non-metallic items and components. 

  • Comply with all safety, quality and work rules, guidelines, and regulations as required 

  • Other jobs as assigned  


Schedule:  Monday to Friday, 8 hours shifts (7:00 AM to 3:30 PM)


This position reports to the Foreman

title: Assembly & General Laborer
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire an Assembly/General Labour ASAP!
Job Description:
  • Assemble parts, general clean up, inventory counts, deliveries and pickups as needed. Immediate start!
  • Hours: 8-4:30 pm Mon-Fri.
  • High-pressure team environment.

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction and gas, and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to customer and industry needs.

Habits:
  • Adherence to Plainsman Mfg quality standards.
  • Thoroughness and pride at ANY task assigned by supervisor.
  • Adhere to the safety program.
  • Keep work area tidy and organized.
  • Initiate and complete small projects/improvements.

Skills or Experience Requirements:
  • *Must have mechanical aptitude.
  • High School Diploma or student.
  • Ability to read and write English.
  • Physically able.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • Must be able to quickly learn and be willing to ask.
  • Follow written and verbal procedures as well as be able to clearly document their own work.
  • Able to prioritize and make decisions using lean, risk, customer needs, and Plainsman core values.
  • Work with a team (conflict resolution, collaboration).
  • Able to assemble multiple Plainsman product categories without supervision.
  • Troubleshoot small issues and make corrections.

title: Assembler / Machine Operator - Days & Evenings
description:
Job Description

We offer:

  • A competitive starting rate
  • Above average shift premium (Evening Shift) 
  • Plant Incentive Program
  • Competitive group benefits for full-time associates
  • An employer matched RRSP plan,
  • And great company discounts and benefits.

POSITIONS ARE AVAILABLE ON DAYS, and EVENING

Day shift: 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM

Evening Shift: 4:00 PM - 12:30 AM

About Us:

MasterBrand Cabinets (known in Winnipeg as Kitchen Craft Cabinetry, and Urban Effects), is a dynamic supplier of high quality kitchen cabinetry and countertops with facilities and sales throughout North America.  As a growing company we have current and future opportunities in our Manufacturing plant (located on Springfield Road in Winnipeg) for Assemblers, and Machine Operators

·       Assemblersare responsible for the assembly of cabinets, ensuring the assembly meets quality standards.  Applicants must have the ability to read and interpret various gauges and measuring devices, pay attention to detail and have previous experience utilizing various hand tools; ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced and physical environment is mandatory.

·       Machine Operators - Previous experience in operating entry level to complex machinery in the woodworking industry is ideal.  Strong working mechanical knowledge of machines and tools including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance is required. Must have the ability to read and understand schematics and work instructions. Ability to troubleshoot machine operations and willingness to work in a fast-paced, and physical environment are necessary. CNC experience is considered an asset.   

 

Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Canada, speak, read, write English, have satisfactory math skills, a strong work ethic, ability to work as a functioning member of a team, work in a safe and responsible manner, and display a commitment to quality and safety.  In addition, all positions require the successful candidate to have the physical ability to lift, bend, push, pull, and move material up to 50 pounds, as well as stand for prolonged period of time. All other duties as may be assigned at management's discretion. Reliable transportation is required (Facility is not on a bus route).

 

Additional Information

MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. offers a wide spectrum of cabinetry products designed to satisfy every budget and lifestyle. With a large North America footprint and diverse team of nearly 13,000 employees, we help people fulfill their dreams of a comfortable, inviting home through innovations in fashion and functionality that bring family and friends together. We invite you to visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more about how we build employee opportunity, purpose, and reward into everything we do.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY 
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to staffing@masterbrand.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

title: Production Assembly Technician
description:
An exciting opportunity for Production Assembly Technician. This is a permanent opportunity with Qvella Corporation located in Richmond Hill, Ontario. 

Nature and Scope of Work:

Responsible for meeting daily assembly production objectives by performing required tasks including parts preparation and inspection, devices assembly and testing in accordance with established procedures. Assist in the prototyping, validation, documentation and scale-up of production processes. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:

  • Meet daily production assembly requirements by following engineering drawings, specifications, bill of materials and other written instructions to accurately assemble/test microfluidic devices.
  • Self-inspect oneâ€™s own work and identify defects to ensure compliance with established quality standard.
  • Maintain the integrity of production facility including organizing/cleaning work stations, maintaining inventory of product in work stations and assisting production cycle count.
  • Coordinate with production planner to ensure the accuracy and delivery of planned production orders.
  • Assist with writing, implementing, and maintaining production processes and quality related documentation as directed by the supervisor/manager.
  • Analyze testing data, interpret results and report findings and conclusions through written and oral presentations.
  • Assist in production process improvement and product validation projects
  • Work with quality team to monitor product quality, improve process yield and reduce waste.
  • Work closely with team members for accuracy and completion of production order in a timely manner.
  • Other duties may also be assigned.

Qualifications and Requirements:

  • 5 years hands-on experience in small-scale device assembly industry with particular interest in experience gained in pharmaceutical, biomedical, IVD or other related industry.
  • High level of proficiency in understanding engineering drawings, handling general lab tools and equipment.
  • Attention to details, highly organized, flexible, persistent and proactive way of working.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proven track record of fast learning and multitasking ability. Work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Good understanding of work safety requirements/regulations and quality GMP/ISO methodology.
  • Work well in a small team and be able to handle the pressure of meeting tight deadlines
  • Good verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Good MS-Office skills

Note: from time to time, the incumbent in this role will be working in a cleanroom, requiring the use of a hairnet and facemask. To protect the integrity of our cleanroom, employees are not permitted to smoke before entering on any given day. If any person is exposed to cigarette smoke (including second hand), it is required to shower, wash hair and wear fresh clothing as a prerequisite to using any workspace in the cleanroom.

 

Education:

  • University or college degree in applied science, mechanical engineering or other related fields. 

In support of our commitment to a healthy and safe workplace, Qvella Corporation has a vaccination requirement as a condition to the offer of employment. Fully vaccinated is defined as having received a completed series of an accepted COVID-19 vaccine, as recommended or approved by Health Canada and having received the final dose at least 14 days before your employment start date.  Ongoing boosters may be required in the future as a continuing condition of employment, as they are announced by Health Canada.  We will provide a full copy of our policy at the time of offer. 

The candidate will be asked to provide Qvella with proof of full vaccination, prior to their employment start date. Acceptable proof is a Ministry of Health Dose Administration Receipt.  This can be obtained through the Provincial portal at https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/.   We will also accept out of province vaccination records, provided they have the same information included in the Ministry of Health Dose Administration Receipt.  This includes the type of vaccine, date of each dose and sufficient identification information to connect the receipt to the candidate. 

The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If the candidate is unable to vaccinate for a reason protected by the Code, a request for accommodation can be made upon written proof, satisfactory to the company.

 

What are you waiting for? Apply Now!

Qvella is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all.  If you are selected to participate in the recruitment process, please inform us of any accommodations you may require. Qvella will work with you in an effort to ensure that you are able to fully participate in the process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work permit or study permit that allows the candidate to fulfill the requirements of the role.

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Production Technician - Electro-mechanical assembly
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Agent(e) de réservation
description:
Dans le cadre de son plan développement en Amérique du Nord, le groupe Huttopia recherche un/une Agent(e) de réservation qui sera basé à Montréal.

Le groupe Huttopia, chef de file dans l’industrie du glamping et de l’écotourisme, conçoit, construit et exploite des sites dans des espaces naturels uniques. Fondé il y a 20 ans en France, Huttopia s’est implanté en Amérique du Nord en 2007. L’entreprise exploite aujourd’hui 80 sites dans 6 pays sur 3 continents. Inscrit dans un marché en pleine croissance, Huttopia a basé son développement sur un fort esprit entrepreneurial, l’innovation et la préservation de la nature.

Tâches et responsabilité:
  • Répondre au téléphone et aux courriels.
  • Assurer la prise des réservations des séjours dans le logiciel de réservation.
  • Conseiller la clientèle sur les différents produits et destinations.
  • Optimiser les ventes.
  • Toutes tâches connexes.

Profil:
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et d'écoute.
  • La connaissance du français et de l'anglais est requise (écrit et oral).

Conditions de travail:
  • Emploi temporaire (jusqu'à octobre 2022).
  • Temps plein, disponibilité la fin de semaine.
  • Date de début: Aussitôt que possible.

Comment nous soumettre votre candidature?
Si cette offre d’emploi vous intéresse, veuillez nous envoyer votre CV via cet offre d’emploi ou directement à recrutementhna@huttopia.com en précisant le poste et le lieu souhaité.
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers notre entreprise. Cependant, prenez note que seuls les candidats retenus pour une entrevue seront contactés.

L’usage du masculin inclut le féminin et est uniquement utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte.

title: Opérateur de production (permanent - quart de nuit)
description:
Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de quelques candidats afin de combler des postes permanents de nuitdans notre usine.

Salaire : 27.02$ / heure

Votre contribution :

  • Démonter, monter et nettoyer les différents équipements;
  • Effectuer les dégagements et les engagements de ligne;
  • Inspection visuelle, prise d’échantillons, et manutention du matériel de fabrication;
  • Maintenir les cadences de production, tout en respectant les bonnes pratiques de fabrication et les règles de Santé et Sécurité.

Votre profil:

  • Disponible pour affectation sur le quart de nuit;
  • Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires;
  • 1 à 3 ans expérience dans une industrie manufacturière;
  • Habileté mécanique pour le montage, démontage et l’opération d’équipements divers;
  • A l’aise dans un environnement informatisé;
  • Maîtrise de la Langue française;
  • A l’aise d’évoluer dans un environnement fortement régi par de bonnes pratiques documentaires;
  • Souci du travail bien fait, précision et rigueur au travail;
  • Travail d’équipe, capacité d’apprentissage, faire preuve d’autonomie et d’initiative;
  • Carte de cariste (atout).

Pourquoi venir travailler avec nous : 

  • Notre mission nous rend fier : nos produits injectables contribuent à sauver ou prolonger la vie de plusieurs millions de patients!
  • Salaire très compétitif : pouvant atteindre près de 30$/hr après seulement environ 1 an;
  • Prime pour quart de soir (+$1.05/hr) et de nuit (+$1,35/hr);
  • Possibilité de temps supplémentaire volontaire;
  • Avantages sociaux complets : (assurances collectives, régime de retraite);
  • Nombre de jours fériés plus élevé que la moyenne;
  • Travail à temps plein, sans saisonnalité, dans un secteur peu sensible aux cycles économiques;
  • Environnement ultra propre, sécuritaire, climatisé et peu bruyant;
  • Programme de formation très rigoureux pour assurer la qualité de nos produits à toutes les étapes;
  • Situé sur la rive-sud de Montréal, tout près des autoroutes principales, stationnement gratuit, bornes électriques en mode dépannageà votre disposition sur le site, réseau d’autobus et pistes cyclables à proximité de l’établissement.
