title: Production Technician -19/hour
description:
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US... 

At Rocky Mountain Soap Co., we are PASSIONATE about everything NATURAL! For over 20 years, we have been crafting natural recipes right here in the Rocky mountains with one goal in mind..to remove toxins from the world.  Itâ€™s our way of feeling great about the products we put out there, supporting our community with career opportunities, sustainable initiatives, and creating natural enthusiasts across Canada! The Rocky team is at the HEART of what we do, and our team is growing.  Not only do we make products that are good for you, we want people that want to make a difference too.  If you love a healthy planet, care about natural ingredients, and want to work in a fun, inclusive, right in the Rockies workshop environment, then the Rocky family might be the right fit for you!

WHAT TO EXPECT AS A PRODUCTION TECHNICHIAN:

  • This position is located in our Canmore Alberta Workshop 
  • Upon start of employment you be trained on our key processes and procedures.
  • Key processes include, but not limited to: The production and assembly/ bottling of various products (sanitizers, lip & body butters, creams, liquid soap products, bar soaps, bath bombs & salts, cleansers, scrubs, etc.)
  • Operate automated, semi-automated or manual work stations for mixing, pouring, filling, labeling, packaging products.
  • Process returned bottles and other packaging through a cleaning and sanitizing procedure as part of Rocky Mountain Soap's Sustainability program.
  • Adhere to all safety guidelines set out by company including COVID-19 Healthy Team Agreement.
  • Ensure that all products are produced according to RMSC guidelines and quality requirements.
  • Ensure cleanliness and tidiness of line, work space, equipment and workshop. 

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

  • You like to be on the move and are capable of handling physical work
  • Must be comfortable lifting/handling weight up to 50lbs 
  • Goal/task-oriented with attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, team-oriented, self-motivated, self-starter
  • Experience in a production environment is an asset (food prep and kitchen work are similar)
  • Good written and spoken English skills
  • Ability to organize and prioritize tasks in a rapidly changing environment
  • Ability to learn and adapt easily to new methods
  • Competent in basic math skills (add/subtract/multiply/divide)
  • Comfortable in the use of measuring equipment (weights and volumes)
  • Ability to work highly scented environment.
  • Can commit to full-time schedule Monday to Friday 8:00am - 4:00, half-hour unpaid lunch break.
  • Looking for candidates with availability as soon as possible. This position status can be discussed upon hire as we are seeking Full Time Permanent employees and/ or Seasonal with the possibility of contract extension as well.

PERKS & BENEFITS

  • Starting wage: $19/hour
  • Free product allowance and product discounts
  • Team events
  • Full Time Team members are enrolled into our group health Benefits plan!
  • Belong to a collaborative team in a happy, healthy work environment

Powered by JazzHR

title: Mechanical / Electrical Assembly Technician
description:
You’ve been searching for an opportunity, where you’re guaranteed a few key things: on-the-job training, room for advancement, and stability.
Look no further, because with Cask Global Canning Solutions, you can have all that and more.

Since 1999, we’ve been providing innovative and affordable canning systems to the world’s small and medium-sized creators of craft beer, cider, wine, cold brewed coffee, kombucha and other life-enhancing beverages. Cask has installed 1,800 canning systems in 70 countries across the world.

Watch the "Meet Production" video to see what joining the team as an Assembly Technician is like at Cask (5min).

Assembly Technician
As our new Assembly Technician, your primary objective is to build high quality canning machines for our Customers.
You’ll be part of a dynamic team assembling our core line of machines from the ground up, following engineering specifications. Working closely with other team members to ensure timely completion of builds and surpassing our Customer’s expectations, your ability to work hard and push the pace will be perfect for our fast-paced environment.

You’ll start your day grabbing the parts you need from our inventory department, you’ll assemble your parts into sub-assemblies, and start building our machines. You’ll end each project with quality testing and process the order for shipping.
You’re a handy person, so you’ll be able to identify different bolts, work with various hand tools and lift heavy materials, working on about 1-3 machines a week.

You understand that wherever there is a problem, there is a solution and you are constantly finding new ways to resolve them. This could mean assisting our service team in trouble shooting, assisting inventory control personnel with stock counts or lending a hand in shipping.
On a practical level you will:

  • Assemble machines to engineering specifications within specified tolerances.
  • Operate basic hand tools including, but not limited to, wrenches, drills and screwdrivers.
  • Basic fabrication including, but not limited to, drilling and tapping holes and modifying stainless steel components.
  • Basic control panel wiring / terminations.
  • Troubleshoot operating issues during setup and testing.
  • Maintain a clean and safe working area.

Working at Cask Global Canning Solutions
This is a full-time, permanent role with a competitive salary of $52,000/year. We also offer a comprehensive group benefits package (health, dental, vision, etc.), and vacation. You’ll work Monday to Friday, 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Pension program (2% match by Cask) and optional RRSP and TFSA (unmatched) options as well.

You‘ll be joining a team that is dedicated to getting the job done well - we believe “good enough,” is not enough. We are a committed group that loves the work we do and the people we work with. We value and invest in your professional development and offer significant opportunities to learn new skills and grow with the company.

Qualifications

  • Experience in a production / mechanical assembly environment.
  • Ability to read and follow engineering assembly drawing combined with basic math skills and ability to correctly read a measuring tape (both metric and imperial scales).
  • Ability to safely lift 50 lbs or more.
  • Mechanical experience, especially with respect to assembly.
  • Electrical background an asset.
  • Forklift experience / license an asset.
  • First Aid training and safety system experience an asset.

What makes you a great fit for the role?

Team culture is paramount for you – Check out Cask Core Values (3min). You’re someone who loves to help create things, solve problems, is energized by interacting with people from all different walks of life and liberally applies a healthy sense of humour to have fun while doing so. You are resourceful and adapt quickly.

If this is a career opportunity that fires you up we want to have a conversation. Apply now and let’s chat.

description:
Job Responsibilities/Requirements:

  • Must have own transportation, no transit service available.

title: Production Assembler - Server Chassis
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 
 

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble frames and servers according to detailed assembly drawings
  • Preparing and installing cabling  
  • Loading and running software using LINUX

Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with electronic components
  • Hand soldering experience would be an asset
  • Basic knowledge of computers
  • Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment that places a high emphasis on team work
  • High school diploma
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Assembleur soir (Hood)
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

Travaille 36h - Payé 40h (4 soirs)

Prime de soir

 

SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

En tant qu’assembleur/assembleuse, vous devrez effectuer le montage, l’ajustement et l’installation des panneaux et de certaines composantes de l’unité de ventilation.

 

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Assembler, ajuster et installer les panneaux extérieurs et le plancher sur la structure;
  • Préparer la structure en fonction du type de panneau à installer;
  • Sceller les panneaux et certaines composantes pour en assurer l'étanchéité;
  • Lire et interpréter les plans;
  • Effectuer des opérations d’assemblage de différents types de charpentes métalliques. 
  • Procéder au nettoyage à la finition des pièces.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Connaissance des unités de mesure (métrique et impérial);
  • Habileté à utiliser différents outils (manuels, pneumatiques et électriques);
  • Bonne condition physique;
  • Dextérité manuelle;

AVANTAGES

  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • Vêtements fournis
  • Congés personnels
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social
  • Environnement de travail ultra propre, vitré et usine climatisée
  • Prime pour référence d’employés
  • Travaille 36h payé 40h
  • Prime de soir

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Electrical Assembler in the Warehousing/Distribution Sector in Airdrie, Alberta.
Reporting to the Production Manager, this position is responsible for mounting and basic wiring of components with standard layouts/options, performs sub-assembly functions, as required, and developing enhanced wiring skills under the direction of a more experienced Electrical Assembler
Responsibilities:
  • Assemble and mount electrical, mechanical and sub-assembly components onto pan, into enclosures, structures etc. by following standard layouts
  • Wire electrical products with basic/standard options as required by following customer drawing packages and schematics
  • Wire electrical products with a non-standard option by following customer drawing packages and schematics under the direction of a more experienced Electrical Assembler
  • Check for functionality by performing continuity check , e.g., buzzing out
  • Complete checklists as required
  • Assemble enclosures/structures where applicable
  • Deliver sub-assemblies to the production areas
  • Support inventory maintenance in sub-assembly area by performing cycle counts, following standard materials procedures, accessing information through CSSM

Successful candidates will have:
  • Must have Grade 12 or equivalent level of education
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills
  • Be a team player
  • Knowledge/experience with basic wiring schematic symbols is an asset

What's in it for you:
  • Pay rate: $18 / hr
  • Morning Shift: 7 am to 3:30 pm
  • Location: Airdrie, AB
  • 6 month - 1 year contract

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email ktejeda@agilus.ca or by text 403.777.9000
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Mechanical / Electrical Assembler
description:
UTV International is a leading manufacturer of off-road utility vehicles

Since 1995 UTV International has been manufacturing Achiever off road tracked vehicles, Hercules digger derricks and Pioneer snow vehicles for the power, utility, telecom, forestry, mining, and ski industries.

Responsibilities/Tasks:

  • Assemble vehicle components, connect hydraulic system, drill, tap and repair heavy equipment
  • Detailed work requiring continuous fine motor skills and repetitive motion
  • Assemble machines according to customers' requests
  • Assist with electrical assembly as required
  • Installing any mechanical components
  • Maintain tools and keep your working environment clean and functional
  • Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations
  • Respect quality standards
  • All other related tasks

Who we’re looking for?

  • DEP in industrial mechanics or any other relevant degree (asset)
  • Minimum1 year experience in machining environment is preferred
  • Electrical experience (asset)
  • Ability to read and interpret mechanicals plans/drawings (asset)
  • Proficient communication skills
  • Be versatile, independent, and resourceful
  • Organized, detail oriented & meticulous when executing tasks
  • Capacity to manage stress and work well under pressure
  • Have interpersonal skills and a positive attitude

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Full benefit package after 3 months
  • Stable, solid company
  • Room to grow

UTV International is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Job Summary

L'opérateur de production participe à la fabrication des composantes des tests de diagnostics, incluant l’étiquetage et la mise en trousse des produits.

Key Duties

  • Opérer les équipements sur la ligne de production;
  • Effectuer l’étiquetage et la mise en trousse des produits;
  • Mettre en forme les matières premières;
  • Participer à l’entretien de certains équipements de production;
  • S’assurer de l’atteinte des standards d’efficacité et de productivité;
  • Documenter les dossiers de production ou tout autre documentation requise;
  • S’assurer du maintien de la qualité du produit;
  • Respecter les procédures en place;
  • Participer aux projets d’amélioration continue.

Qualifications

Connaissances, compétences et aptitudes:

  • Minutie et bonne dextérité manuelle;
  • Travail d’équipe.

Formation et expérience:

  • AEC en production pharmaceutique ou diplôme d’études secondaires complété;
  • 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en production;
  • Expérience dans un environnement réglementé, idéalement biomédical (ISO 13485, ISO 9001).

title: Production Technician
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

La version française de cette offre d'emploi est disponible:  Version française - cliquez ici

 

 

Overview

 

To be a key player within the Cement Production Team. Ensure that the equipment is functioning properly, that it is supplied with raw materials and that the quality of the final product meets standards.

Responsibilities

 

  • Conduct inspection rounds to ensure that the equipment is working properly
  • Conduct the chemical analysis of various products
  • Operate equipment, machinery and accessories through process control systems
  • Learn the clinker burning process in rotary kilns

 

Safety:

  • Serve as a role model in the areas of safety, environmental stewardship, leadership, teamwork, and continuous improvement to ensure alignment with the company’s vision and critical success factors. 
  • Ensure safe and efficient operations in the production department

Qualifications

 

Education (mandatory):

  • College Degree - Analytical Chemistry, Chemistry, Mechanical Technology, etc. 

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience in the control room of a production facility
  • Good troubleshooting skills when mechanical issues arise
  • Good communication skills
  • Skills in building team spirit
  • Experience in the heavy industry
  • Efficient follow-ups
  • Operational experience in the cement industry (an asset)

Dimensions:Plant Annual Capacity: 1M tons of cement

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Opérateurs de production
description:
Vous recherchez un emploi sur une chaîne de production avec des possibilités davancement? Vous aimeriez travailler sur des horaires rotatifs de jour ET de soir?


Nous sommes actuellement en recrutement pour un poste dopérateur de production sur des quarts rotatifs (jour/soir) à notre usine de production située à Papineauville. 

Voici les principales fonctions de ce poste:

  • Régler et ajuster les différents paramètres de l’équipement de production avant le début du quart de travail.
  • Réaliser les tests en cours de production et faire les ajustements adéquats.
  • S’assurer de la qualité du produit.
  • Enregistrer et transmettre au chef d’équipe en fin de quart les contrôles et évènements particuliers du quart sur le rapport quotidien.
  • Intervenir pour lever les blocages au besoin.
  • Respecter et appliquer le programme dentretien préventif.
  • Nettoyer l’équipement en fin de quart et s’assurer de garder son environnement de travail propre.
  • Accompagner l’électromécanicien dans ses interventions (ajustements, réparations, modification) et l’aider si nécessaire


Profil

  • Vous êtes manuel et vous appréciez le travail debout
  • Vous aimez bouger
  • Vous aimez apprendre et développer de nouvelles compétences
  • Vous comprenez bien la mécanique de la chaîne de production 
  • Vous comprenez les logiciels de production
  • Vous êtes autonome


Informations contractuelles

Horaire:
Lhoraire est de jour et soir en alternance aux semaines.
  • De jour: du lundi au vendredi de 6h-15h30
  • De soir: du lundi au jeudi de 15h45-2h15

Salaire:
Le salaire est de 16.63$/h à 18,08$/hre en débutant selon l’expérience, avec progression salariale aux 3 mois pendant 18-24 mois. Salaire pouvant atteindre 22,03$/hre
  • + prime de soir de 2$/hre
  • + Boni de performance jusqu’à 300$/mois
  • + Prime d’engagement de 500$ à 2000$/à chaque année

Avantages sociaux:
  • Assurances collectives (50%-50%), incluant les médicaments, les professionnels, télémédecine et PAE
  • REER collectif
  • Rabais sur planchers et granules
  • Prime de référence
  • Allocation pour chaussures de sécurité (150-300$/an)

title: Production Technician
description:
Job Description

Our client in EAR FALLS, Ontario is seeking Production Technicians to work in their sawmill. You'll be aroundwood,woodand morewood. Your eagle eyes will help keep theyardandsawmilllooking their best. To keep things running smoothly, you’ll make sure that there’s a place for everything and that everything is in its place. You'll make a living working atsawmillswith deep roots in thenorthernregions ofOntarioandQuebec. You'll discover that they do more than just transformwood; they also transform our communities!

Are you hard-working, resourceful and a go-getter? Our team is waiting for you!

What you’ll be doing specifically:

  • Tie up bundles of rough lumber for drying outside.
  • Redo and stack bundles of rough and planed wood in the yard.
  • Perform clean-ups of the yard and sawmill.
  • Perform clean-ups after interior and exterior sawing operations.
  • During work downtime, clean areas that are inaccessible during operations.
  • Do any other related tasks (don’t worry; you'll learn tons of things that will help you in your career!).

What do you need to succeed with us?

  • Be able to work well on a team.
  • Be independent and full of initiative.
  • Show vigilance and a concern for health and safety.

Qualifications

Experience that will help you in this position:

  • DCS, DEC, or equivalent.
  • Prior experience at a sawmill is an asset.
  • Be available to work day and/or night shifts.

title: Production Technician/Assembler - Medical Simulators
description:
As a division of Smile Train, Simulare is dedicated to enhancing surgical skills of surgeons through the development of simulators and training programs which will result in significantly superior patient safety and outcomes. 
 

We develop creative, cutting-edge simulation solutions which enable surgeons around the globe to practice complex surgical procedures on cleft patients. Our goal is to build a team of highly motivated, self-starters who are interested in making a difference in the lives of others.

 

Our Production Technicians are responsible for creating Simulare’s advanced physical simulators. For a candidate with the motivation and artistic skills, the role will allow us to refine our production techniques and develop new products to drive our growth.

 

We are looking for a Production Technician/Assembler to join our team.

 

This is a permanent position conveniently located at 174 Spadina Ave, Toronto, Ontario and will be primariy on site work.  Please note that suitable candidates will be invited to participate in an hour long in-person interview / production scenario-based testing.

 

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Assembly and production of products to meet quality and delivery objectives
  • Participate in the development of complex physical simulators
  • Contribute to other duties as requested and participate in creating a rewarding work environment
 

Requirements

  • Ability to follow instructions in a manual while assembling detailed components
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to accept feedback is a must
  • Past experience in jewelry making or watch repair is an asset
  • Past experience in small model building, sculpture, miniatures or fly tying is an asset
  • Past experience in hand soldering would be an asset
  • Good dexterity and eyesight to work with small tools and components
  • Reasonable Microsoft Office skills

 

Core Competencies

  • Quality Orientation
  • Effective time management capabilities
  • Organized with excellent self-managing skills
  • Artistically inclined
  • Able to work independently while working well within a team.
  • Accountable and dependable
  • Minimum high school diploma

 

We will only be able to respond to suitable candidates. Thanks for applying!

title: OUVRIER(ÈRE) DE PRODUCTION
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Chantier Davie Canada inc. est le plus important chantier de construction et réparation navale au Canada. Axé sur des valeurs tel que ; Le succès, le dynamisme, la responsabilité et les relations.

Vous avez le goût de l'aventure, vous désirez entreprendre une carrière exceptionnelle dans un environnement ou vous aurez l'occasion de grandir. 

Venez supporter la nation avec nous. Nous fabriquons et réparons les navires canadiens du ministère de la Défense nationale, de Transports Canada et de la Garde côtière canadienne.

 

Description du poste

À titre d'ouvrier(ère) de production, vous devrez notamment supporter les salariés des différents métiers dans l’exécution de leurs fonctions. Plus spécifiquement, vous aurez à : 

  • Assister et supporter les salariés des différents métiers pour des tâches tels qu’appliquer de peinture, poser des matériaux d’isolation, conduire les camions, pré-couper le câblage, etc.
  • Meuler les surplus de soudure à l’aide des outils appropriés. Au besoin, fabriquer, nettoyer et polir des chanfreins sur des plaques de métal ou des pièces de métal.
  • Balayer et nettoyer les réservoirs, l’intérieur des navires, des roulottes, des ateliers, des aires de repos et entretenir les salles de toilettes des ateliers de production.
  • Démanteler, rassembler, classer et ramasse les produits considérés comme rebuts ou les retailles.
  • Déplacer, remuer, ramasser avec différents outils du ciment, du sable, de la neige, du gazon, de l’eau etc.
  • Aptitude à travailler dans les endroits restreints en hauteur ou dans les espaces clos.
  • Respecter, selon les normes de qualité de la Compagnie, les exigences prescrites aux procédures d’exécution de son travail et signale à son contremaître tout ce qui n’est pas conforme aux normes.
  • Effectuer  et démontrer les aptitudes pour toute autre tâche connexe à la demande de son supérieur.
Qualifications

  • Détenir l’un des diplômes suivants un diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent ou l’ASP Journalier/journalière
  • Expérience en milieu industriel (atout)
  • Être disponible pour travailler le jour, soir, nuit et fin de semaine.


Informations complémentaires

Pour être retenu, vous devrez vous soumettre au processus d’enquête et d’obtention de l’attestation de sécurité exigée dans le cadre du Programme de sécurité des contrats du gouvernement fédéral.

Nous fabriquons et réparons les navires canadiens du ministère de la Défense nationale, de Transports Canada et de la Garde côtière canadienne.', 'Assister et supporter les salariés des différents métiers pour des tâches tels qu’appliquer de peinture, poser des matériaux d’isolation, conduire les camions, pré-couper le câblage, etc.', "Vous\xa0avez\xa0le goût de l'aventure, vous\xa0désirez\xa0entreprendre une carrière exceptionnelle dans un environnement ou vous\xa0aurez\xa0l'occasion de grandir."]

title: Assembler
description:
Grow with us as a General Assembler within our Production Department at Stage Windows & Doors! 

Company Overview:

Stage Windows & Doors is a manufacturer of custom products tailored to meet client needs. With a facility located in Vaughan, we offer a variety of options and features that are designed to make our windows and doors ideal for residential replacement and custom home markets. Our focus is on providing our customer's value through on-time delivery, quality, and superior service.  We strive to build a work environment where safety, respect, commitment, success, and fun are driving principles. 

Position Summary:

The General Assembler will play a vital role by providing parts assembly support by performing hands-on duties to ensure workflow and daily production goals.  The qualified candidate will work under the direction of department leadership to assemble components onto PVC using hand tools and manual dexterity adhering to assembly protocols, company rules, quality standards, and health and safety laws. 

This is a full-time position that requires the ability to perform repetitive tasks and stand for extended periods of time. The successful candidate will be disciplined, punctual, reliable, and a strong team player. 

Key Responsibilities: 
  • Perform general assembly of parts and components to form final products 
  • Ensure high quality work is completed with each step in accordance with company quality standards 
  • Inspect manufactured items for defects and conformance to specifications 
  • Utilize hand tools to assemble final products ensuring safe and proper usage 
  • Clean final products of any debris 
  • Load products onto skids according to customer orders 
  • Adhere to health and safety standards 
  • Contribute to general housekeeping duties to ensure the cleanliness of the department 
  • Other tasks as required  

Skills: 
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills 
  • Understanding of metric and imperial measurements 
  • Ability to perform physically demanding and repetitive tasks 
  • Ability to follow direction 
  • Attention to detail and hand-eye coordination 
  • Strong team player 
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs  

Education & Experience: 
  • Previous experience within a manufacturing environment, windows and doors experience is considered an asset   

We thank all interested candidates for applying. Successful candidates will be contacted to participate in the interview process.  

Stage Windows & Doors is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Structural Assembler
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Scope of Position

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Structural Assembler is responsible for installing, and assembling components on an aircraft structure.

Position Summary
  • Proficient in Blueprint Reading and Hole Layout, Countersinking and Deburring.
  • Fitting and installation of conventional rivets and Hi-Lite fasteners
  • Assemble and fit pre-fabricated parts to form subassemblies, working at benches or directly on an aircraft structure.
  • Application of manual solvent, conductive chemical conversion treatment and paint touch-up
  • Working with a variety of power and hand tools, jigs, fixtures and other equipment
  • Meeting schedule and production requirements
Education:
  • Completion of recognized Sheet Metal Fabrication course preferred.
  • Completion of a college or other program in aviation or aeronautical technology, with emphasis in aircraft manufacturing.
Experience:
  • Use of Hand Tool for drilling, countersinking, torquing, installing (fasteners, hi-lites).
  • Ability to read blueprints and interpret technical drawings (2D and 3D).
  • Sub-assemblies, sheet metal assembly, mechanical assembly, etc.
  • 1-10 yrs. experience in structural assembly (salary will be subject to years of experience and competency testing).
  • Previous experience in the aerospace industry or manufacturing environment considered an asset.
  • Prior exposure to quality systems and safety fundamentals.
Must Haves
  • Must be a strong team player, who is flexible and willing to learn new tasks.
  • Must have flexibility to work rotating shifts to accommodate production schedule, including days, afternoons, nights and overtime as required.
  • Must be mechanically inclined and know how to use Pneumatic, or power hand tools.
  • You must wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) at all times on the plant floor (i.e. safety glasses, safety shoes and ear plugs) and follow all Health & Safety procedures at all times.
  • Must be able to pass a Pulmonary Fit Test (PFT) for proper fitting of respirators as needed to perform the job safely, especially in work areas that may have exposure to chemicals or odors from paints, solvents etc. To ensure proper fitting of respirators all employees using respirators must be clean shaven at all times as per the Canadian Standard Association (CSA) requirements.
  • Must be physically fit, energetic, agile, willing and able to:
  • work in restricted spaces (tanks)
  • work at heights (3rd floor of jigs)
  • work rotating shifts when and as required
  • bend, twist, walk on uneven surfaces and climb stairs repeatedly during shift
  • perform heavy lifting (< 40 lbs) as needed to perform the job
  • stand for 7 hours of an 8 hour shift
Salary Range: $20-$30/hr

***We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.Thank you and Good Luck.

title: Mechanical Assembler (FT)
description:
General Description:
The mechanical assembler works with our technical team to provide support for the following product lines: TSLOTS, Troax, Rollon and Jokab, and other mechanical products.  The mechanical assembler should assemble mechanical parts, pieces, and products using a variety of tools and equipment according to required specifications and drawings. Must be able to obtain parts and build assemblies utilizing specified work instructions, process Bill of Materials (BOMs) drawings, and production orders, thereby ensuring quality is maintained on a wide variety of components. 
 
Responsibilities:
  • Must read and interpret production work instructions, production orders, Bills of Materials (BOMs), and quality plans to accurately assemble aluminum extrusion frames, valve manifolds, and other industrial automation products.
  • Analyze assembly blueprint and specifications and plan assembly operations.
  • Ability to assemble Manifolds.
  • Need to understand the Quality Policy and Quality Objectives and how they are related to this position.
  • Locate, identify, and retrieve components for production.
  • Operate various types of pneumatic/power tools, handheld tools, and torque wrenches.
  • Must possess keen attention to detail and able to multi-task.
  • Must have the aptitude to inspect all parts during assembly and follow procedures for non-conforming material.
  • Must be able to read and comprehend Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) and follow instructions set forth in MSDS.
  • Rework and/or repair assembled equipment and products according to engineering specification changes.
  • Ability to organize, prioritize and schedule assignments.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.
  • Operate and test assembled products and tool assemblies.
  • Perform quality work checks to ensure the product meets quality standards.
  • Tests and checks manifold for quality before being released to the customer.
  • Provide backup help to shipping & receiving.
  • Participate in regular Inventory count and manage the inventory.
  • Maintain a clean and safe work area.
  • Should have reliable transportation.
 
Work Experience Requirements:
  • Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly within a team or independently.
  • Regularly possess manual dexterity to put parts or pieces together quickly and accurately.
  • Minimum 2 years mechanical assembly experience required.
  • Millwright experience required.
 
Education Requirements:
  • High School Graduate or Equivalent.
  • Basic reading skills; must be able to follow directions.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite software.
  • Lift Truck Certification and Safety Training would be an asset.

title: Production Technician
description:
Production TechnicianTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

Based in Quebec City and reporting to the production supervisor, the production technician supports the business unit in achieving the production objectives set by adhering to systems and processes. The business unit produces chemical product analyzers that target different markets.ABB Measurement and Analytics (PAMA) develops, produces, sells, delivers and services products and solutions to enable industrial and energy customers to operate more efficiently and profitably. We are dedicated to serving our customers with the best digitally enabled solutions to meet their needs quickly and reliably, while providing the support of a global service network.
Your responsibilities

  • Perform the optical, mechanical and electronic assembly of our analyzers.
  • Perform quality control of these same analyzers.
  • Conduct the final tests making sure to meet the quality standard.
  • Comply with the processes in place.
  • Troubleshoot problems encountered during assembly and testing.
  • Be consistent with ABB's core values of safety and integrity, that is, take responsibility for your own actions while taking care of your colleagues and the company.

Your background
  • College diploma (DEC) in physics, electronics or an appropriate field
  • High school diploma coupled with relevant experience will also be considered
  • Bilingual (French and English)
  • Strong learning and analytical skills
  • High level of autonomy, responsibility and versatility
  • Strong concern for high quality and efficiency

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Assembler II
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities:

Under general supervision, perform mechanical assembly of moderate complexity in accordance with established procedures.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)

  • Know and understand Weatherford's Enterprise Excellence Process and the Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Assemble and test completions equipment per engineered drawings or as instructed by others.  
  • Uses hand tools, power tools, and measuring devices such as tapes, gauges, calipers, micrometer  
  • Inspect completed components for accuracy and functionality.  
  • Perform hydrostatic test on components as necessary.
  • Material handling  
  • Properly maintain company supplied tooling and maintain an orderly work area  
  • Aid in developing of new procedures and improving existing procedures.
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Qualifications:
  • Factory or oil & gas experience an asset
  • Good verbal communication skills.  
  • Basic computer skills  
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos in English.  
  • Ability to read assembly layouts and manufacturing prints.  
  • Ability to read a measuring tape, micrometer and calipers.  
  • Ability to safely operate material handling devices (overhead cranes, forklifts).  
  • Ability to perform all job duties of an Assembler  
  • General knowledge of assembly procedures.  
  • Ability to be an effective team member
  • Quick learner/self motiviated

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
Heavy Equipment Mechanic - Technical Assembler

 

We are seeking Mechanically inclined people to join a busy shop in Woodstock ON. Licensed and non-licensed Mechanics are welcome to apply. This position requires a Technically minded individual to assemble unique equipment for construction, mining, oil & gas, and marine applications. Think on your feet, figure out problems, build equipment youve never seen before. These are day to day norms. 

 

We need you to be able to read schematics, build winching systems, install wiring and harnesses, build hydraulic systems, and then test your equipment. Build it, make it work, and test it for field capabilities. Possessing diagnostic/troubleshooting skills will be a strong asset for this position. 

 


Compensation

$30.00 $32.00/hour based on experience. 

  • Afternoon Shift premium
  • Company Pension Plan 
  • Full suite of benefits available
  • Clothing & Safety Shoe allowance
  • Stat Holidays, Vacation, 5 paid holidays 


Schedule

2 week rotation, Days (5x8s) and Afternoons (4x10s)
  • Days; Monday to Friday (7:00am to 3:30pm)
  • Afternoons; Monday to Thursday (3:30pm to 2:00am)

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
WHO WE ARE:

As the leading distributor of public works equipment, Joe Johnson Equipment (JJE) provides mobile infrastructure-maintenance equipment to municipalities and contractors across Canada and the US.  Through our branch network, we sell, rent, lease, service and support vacuum trucks, refuse & recycling collection vehicles, street sweepers, sewer cleaners, and inspection cameras.

JJE is a leading manufacturer of code vacuum equipment under the Westech Vac Systems brand. JJE and Westech also share a sense of pride in our work, our employees’ development and success, and building exceptional lifetime relationships with our customers.

JJE is a dynamic and growing organization, focused on maintaining an “employer of choice” culture. We have a stable, team-based, and collaborative work environment that drives our organization to be best-in-class within our industry. We offer opportunities across Canada and the U.S. and are committed to providing challenging and rewarding career paths for our employees. JJE provides very competitive compensation packages, robust group benefits and an opportunity to grow professionally.

JJE is a proud subsidiary of Federal Signal Corporation.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Mechanical Assembler

LOCATION:                Nisku, AB

TYPE:                          Full-Time

SUMMARY:

This role possesses the knowledge of the structure and function of production equipment and is able to identify problems and malfunctions with the machinery and equipment. 

POSITION REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Certification and licensing to operate forklift is strongly preferred
  • Previous experience in factory or warehouse setting is recommended
  • Demonstrates ability to interpret equipment gauges and monitors on factory equipment
  • Possesses knowledge of the structure and function of production equipment
  • Is able to identify problems or malfunctions with machinery and equipment
  • Demonstrates analytical thinking and problem-solving skills necessary to troubleshoot production issues
  • Exhibits ability to work cautiously but efficiently in potentially hazardous conditions
  • Is familiar with all factory safety procedures and guidelines
  • Demonstrates ability to use power tools safely and effectively
  • Works efficiently and manages time effectively

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Starts assembly and production machinery at beginning of shift
  • Monitors & maintains equipment to ensure there in proper working order
  • Makes sure that workstation is clean and free of hazardous materials
  • Cleans equipment
  • Assembles product parts by hand, power tools
  • Use of power tools such as a band saw, drill press, iron worker
  • Inspects assembled products to ensure they are up to quality standards
  • Keeps factory floor clean
  • Light manufacturing assembly
  • Adheres to all safety guidelines dictation the production and handling of materials in the factory
  • Ensures that all production deadlines are met
  • Reports issues or problems with production to immediate supervisor

SAFETY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Employees must:

  • work in compliance with the appropriate safety legislation/regulations/safety policies
  • report any known workplace hazard or safety violations
  • cooperate with their workplace’s Safety Committee or health and safety representative
  • use any safety equipment, protective devices or clothing required
  • not remove or make ineffective any protective device required by the Company or by the regulations

OTHER DETAILS

  • Possesses physical strength and stamina required to stand, walk, and lift for long periods of time
  • Possesses physical dexterity necessary to assemble small and delicate product

WHY WORK AT JJE?

  • Talented, dedicated and passionate team to work with
  • Exceptional best-in-class products and service offerings for our customers
  • Market-competitive compensation package with annual increase opportunities
  • Robust Group Benefits that are 100% paid for by the Company – inclusive of Health, Dental, Life, Disability and Travel coverage
  • Paid Personal Days
  • Charitable Giving Program
  • Educational Scholarship Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Employer Matching Retirement Savings Plan
  • Federally recognized as a certified Employment Equity organization
  • Member of multiple provincial safety programs and COR certified
  • Our Core People Values: Leadership, Customer Excellence, Integrity, Inspiration, Teamwork, Innovation and Ambition

____________________________________________________________________________________

If you are looking for a new opportunity, then we at Joe Johnson Equipment welcome your application. We encourage applications from all qualified persons, however only those who are being considered for the position will be contacted.

If you are contacted for an interview and require any accommodation, please notify HR in advance and we will provide applicable accommodation.

Joe Johnson Equipment is an Essential Business due to the products and services we provide to our customers. We continue to fully operate during these challenging times while remaining steadfastly committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of our employees.

______________________________________________________________________________

title: Production Technician
description:
A production technician may be responsible to fill a position to complete a variety of tasks throughout the manufacturing facility. These may include forklift operation (certification provided), machine operation, formation works, assembly and final inspection. Equipment operation and safety training is provided for applicable roles.

Duties specific to this role include:

  • verifying condition and weights of materials and products
  • cleaning work areas and equipment as well as performing other labouring and elemental activities

Preferred ticket /experience

  • Forklift experience an asset
  • WHIMIS or First Aid tickets, (asset, however training will be provided)

title: Production Technician
description:
• Perform mechanical assembly and machine set-up in accordance with the customer and the engineering department’s standards and specifications;
  • Install control panels and cables and perform tests to ensure all is working properly;
  • Inspect equipment and perform functionality, performance and quality tests;
  • Solve application issues;
  • Install and start-up equipment at customer site, when required;

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • College or professional diploma in electro-mechanics of automated systems or any related diploma;
  • Ability to interpret mechanical and electrical drawings;
  • 3 to 5 years of experience in assembly of automated machinery;
  • Experience in the pharmaceutical packaging industry is an asset.
  • Bilingual preferred, French and English
  • Attention to detail
  • Team worker
  • Good manual skills
  • Available for overtime especially in the period of Pre-FAT & FAT

BENEFITS:

As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program.

Education

title: Assembleur mécanique soudure
description:
Description des taches:  
Le titulaire du poste est responsable d’assembler toutes les composantes qui constituent le plancher d’une unité de ventilation.
Responsabilités :
  • Assemble les pièces nécessaires à la construction des unités de ventilation à l’aide des plans mécaniques ou d’instructions verbales;
  • Ajuste les pièces si nécessaire;
  • Monte les plaques de plancher;
  • Scelle les planchers à l’aide d’un fusil à isoler;
  • Sable les coins de périmètres et les peintures;
  • Utilise un pont roulant;
  • Installe les chariots triangulaires sous le périmètre;
  • Vérifie la séquence de production;
  • Enlève les ancrages;
  • Installe les bassins et les souffles;
  • Isole le plancher;
  • Coupe les tuyaux en acier inoxydable servant au montage du brûleur;
  • Utilise divers petits outils à main ainsi que des outils mécaniques courants;
  • N’hésite en aucun cas à demander de l’aide pour toute tâche qui le requiert;
  • Travaille en collaboration avec les employés de son secteur;
  • Analyse et effectue des suivis de dossiers de production;
  • Garde ses outils et son environnement de travail propres et fonctionnels (respect du 5S);
  • Respecte les normes et les règlements de sécurité;
  • Respecte les normes de qualité;
  • Informe son supérieur immédiat de tout problème survenant dans le cadre de son travail.

Profil

Exigences et qualifications :
  • Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaire (DES) ou son équivalent ;
  • Détenir de lexpérience en manipulation de pont roulant ainsi que d’outils mécaniques courants ;
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque lemploi requiert un travail physique en position debout ;
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales.
Qualifications privilégiées :
  • Détenir de lexpérience en lecture de plans et de documents sera considéré un atout ;
  • Avoir une connaissance du métal en feuille sera considéré un atout.

Informations contractuelles

Conditions de travail :
  • Poste permanent syndiqué ;
  • Travail de jour de lundi au vendredi, 40 heures par semaine (heures travaillées 39h et payées 40h);
  • Assurance collective, REER et autres avantages sociaux ;
  • Salaire commence à 19.83$/h;
  • Possibilité davancement.



Qualifications et exigences: Rapidité d'exécution; Dextérité manuelle; Sens de l'observation; Endurance physique (travail debout et penché); Années d'expérience reliées à l'emploi : un atout.

title: ELECTROMECANICO ENSAMBLE
description:
Descripción del grupo

Cosma ofrece una extensa gama de soluciones de carrocería, chasis e ingeniería a los clientes en todo el mundo.A través de nuestra solida ingeniería de productos,excepcionales capacidades de herramientas y variada experiencia en procesos, continuamos aportando al mercado productos ligeros e innovadores

 

Resumen de la función

El objetivo del puesto se enfoca a Instalar de manera adecuada cualquier componente mecanico, electrico, neumático, hidraulico que forme parte de un proyecto, dar soporte a las areas de manufactura, ingenieria y automatizacion, siguiendo los estandares internos

Responsabilidades clave

  • Realizar su actividad encomendada ya sea en el área de instalación en base a la Hoja de trabajo estándar correspondiente respetando lineamientos de seguridad y con la calidad requerida
  • Colaborar de manera directa en actividades del área de ensamble o del área de instalación en caso de requerirse por necesidades de la empresa
  • Hacer uso correcto y cuidar las herramientas y equipos de mano que se le asignen, participar de manera activa en el inventario de su comodato y reportar de inmediato a su supervisor en caso de algún faltante
  • Preservar los dispositivos de protección de seguridad, no quitarlos ni alterarlos

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

  • Conocimientos de LayOut y conocimientos en Interpretación de planos e interpretación de diagramas eléctricos.
  • Interpretación de diseños eléctricos .
  • Manejo de herramientas manuales de integración.
  • Conocimientos en mecánica, hidráulica, neumática y conocimientos en equipos de medición
  • Experiencia en instalación de líneas de producción y ensamble de estaciones

Información adicional

  • Carrera Técnica-Electrónico-Electromecanico-Mecatronico
  • Experiencia mínima de 3 años en puesto similar

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Production Assembler
description:
Production Assembler
About Us:

Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG), Inc. established in 2004, is a leading manufacturer of customer-specific components and assemblies for transportation and general industrial applications. In 2017, First Light Safety Products was created as a division of SMG. On a mission to prevent stop arm violations, school bus related accidents and fatalities, First Light Safety Products design and manufactures innovative patent-pending illumination technology for the school bus industry. Both organizations share a 30,000 sq ft, state of the art manufacturing facility.

Summary:
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Production Assembler will be responsible for producing and assembling products on the production line that aid in the safety of children. The successful candidate will have strong attention to detail, has a “can-do” attitude and works well in a team environment.

Detailed Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Mechanical assembly of sub-assemblies and final products
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
  • Ability to work unsupervised in a fast-paced environment
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Electronics assembly background is an asset
  • Work well under pressure and under tight timelines
  • Experience with fabrication using basic hand tools, power tools, and machinery
  • Knowledge of production documentation and mechanical and electrical assemblies
  • An energetic, diligent work ethic and able to work with little supervision

Share with us your talent, drive, and entrepreneurial spirit and we will provide a creative and supportive environment, where valuable contributions are rewarded and celebrated with professional growth, job satisfaction, and an attractive total compensation program. We offer a benefits package to our employees including:
  • Group Insurance Plan
  • Paid Vacations

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK ALL APPLICANTS WHO APPLY, HOWEVER, ONLY THOSE SELECTED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED.

title: Technicien de production
description:
Tu es passionné par le domaine médical? Tu aimerais travailler pour une entreprise en pleine expansion dans la ville de Québec? Tu aimerais contribuer à la croissance d’une entreprise qui fait une différence dans le domaine de la santé au Québec?

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de technicien de production à Québec. Nous rechercherons la perle rare pour occuper ce contrat en serre d'un durée de 9 mois.

Nous avons hâte de te rencontrer!





Avantages
Pour ce poste de technicien de production dans la ville de Québec, voici quelques qualificatifs à considérer :

Horaire de jour (6h-15h)
Poste en semaine, du lundi au vendredi
Salaire entre 24$ et 26$ selon expérience
Poste contractuel, d’une durée de 9 mois
Travailler sur plusieurs sites différents
Faire partie d’une superbe équipe de travail
Collaborer avec une entreprise de grande envergure à Québec

Responsabilités
Tous les jours, vous serez appelé à faire les tâches suivantes pour occuper ce poste de technicien de production à Québec :

Préparation de diverses solutions et des infiltrations
Récolte et arrosage des cultures
Nettoyage et décontamination des équipements de production
Documentation des opérations selon les procédures établies
Contrôle qualité du travail de ses collègues
Travail d’équipe

Qualifications
Pour occuper ce poste de technicien de production dans la ville de Québec, nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne polyvalente, qui présente une très grande capacité de minutie. Nous cherchons une personne qui souhaite faire des tâches répétitives.
Tu as :
Un D.E.C. ou études professionnelles en bioécologie, agronomie, horticulture ou autres?
Entre 1 et 2 ans d’expérience?
Une bonne capacité pour le travail physique?
Tu es une personne autonome, capable de travailler toute seule?
Si tu corresponds à tous ces critères, nous voulons te parler rapidement!

Sommaire
N’attends plus,
Ce poste vous intéresse? Avez-vous déjà un dossier chez Randstad?
Appelez-nous sans plus tarder au 418.525.6766 et demandez Cindy
Envoyez votre CV par courriel : cindy.darackian@radnstad.ca

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

title: $20-22/HR!!! HIRING MECHANICAL ASSEMBLER!!!
description:
Working with an extensive client base, Aerotek is searching for Assemblers for a large Drilling company in Edmonton!


Qualifications:


+ _High attention to detail_

+ _Communication skills both verbal and written._

+ _Mechanically inclined (6 months experience with drills)_

+ _Extremely punctual_


Description:


_Candidates will be working to disassemble downhole tools after they come back from rental. They will be using overhead and jib cranes to move parts, hand and power tools to disassemble moving pieces. They will also be cleaning and washing tools of all remaining oil before quality testing can be done. These candidates work alone to disassemble/reassemble 3-4 tools per day. It can be dirty work but candidates will be trained on all types of equipment with room to advance in the shop and company. Technicians rotate duties and will do 1 of several things each day. Rotation looks like one day they would be on “tear down” or disassembly of the tools, next day on Assembly, next day on Breakout operation (torquing tools) and testing them, next day on completing tools, paint and or other operations that support our shop flow._


A person willing to do OT is required. Shift time is Mon - Fri 6am – 2:30pm. Overtime will be added on to the afternoon and potential Saturday shifts. When doing OT weeks would generally look like 6am-3:30pm and Sat 6am – 2:30pm.


Permanent Opportunity


Pay Rate: $20-22/hr


_Why work with Aerotek?_


_Quality Jobs_


Your success starts with the right job opportunity. If your resume and


application is a good match for a client’s needs, a recruiter will reach out to


learn more about you to ensure the opportunity fits your goals, skills and


interests. While the majority of our positions are contract opportunities, we


also offer contract-to-hire and direct placements. From there, we prepare you


for every step of the hiring process, from interview to placement.


_Quality Relationship_


But we don’t stop there. We support you on your first day and continue to help


you throughout your assignment. We maintain open communication, resolve issues


and provide performance feedback throughout your contract.


Our benefits include contributory medical, dental and vision insurance.


Specific assignments may include paid time off, and all Aerotek contractors


employees can enjoy an array of employee discounts from our many retail


partners.


_Career Partnership_


We are your committed career partner — connecting you to future opportunities


that reflect your career goals.


À propos d'Aerotek:


Notre monde nous tient à cœur. Reconnu Best of Staffing MD par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aerotek MD Inc. se distingue comme chef de file du recrutement et en de la dotation de personnel grâce à sa grande compréhension des liens entre le talent et les affaires. Étant donné qu'Aerotek est un partenaire stratégique de plus de 18 000 clients et 300 000 employés contractuels chaque année, son approche axée sur les gens lui permet d'offrir un avantage concurrentiel à ses clients et des emplois gratifiants à ses employés contractuels. Aerotek, dont le siège social est à Hanover, au Maryland, exploite un réseau de plus de 250 bureaux non franchisés, comptant plus de 8 000 employés internes dévoués à servir nos clients. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Pour en savoir davantage, consultez le site aerotek.com/fr-ca.


About Aerotek:


We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Hiring For An Assembler!! $19.10-$22.00/hr!!
description:
Working with an extensive client base, Aerotek is searching for a Assembler with a LARGE company supporting oil and gas in south Edmonton!


Are you looking to further your skills in assembly and machine operating with a great company offering _daily overtime?_ Apply now!


Description:


Will be operating assembly machines which involves lifting up 25lb downhole tool components and loading it in the these machines. Basic process is to pick products out of a crate, scan and load them onto a table where they will clean and grease the o-rings with a q-tip and load components into the machine. Need to be able to read assembly machine commands that appear on the computer screen dashboard. Will need to use basic hand tools such as wrenches from time to time and also need to be able to help out other departments when needed and take on shop cleaning tasks. Will be working with an experienced tech on this machine (or assembly cell as it is known).


Qualifications:


+ Knowledge of basic hand and power tools (Allen wrench, drills and wrenches)*

+ Basic computer skills (can open and enter values in Excel, type emails in Outlook)

+ Willing to submit to prescreening ( D&A testing)*

+ Vehicle Required to get to work due to overtime

+ Willing to work overtime daily*

+ Ability to work Saturdays


Experience that would be helpful:


+ Overhead crane experience

+ Production machine operation

+ Forklift experience

+ Further educational experience (technical training)

+ Oil and gas shop experience


_*$19.10 - $22.00/hr_


_*Overtime Daily*_


_* Day Shift*_


_*Mon-Fri 6:00AM-4:30PM*_


_*APPLY NOW with resume & reference*_


À propos d'Aerotek:


Notre monde nous tient à cœur. Reconnu Best of Staffing MD par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aerotek MD Inc. se distingue comme chef de file du recrutement et en de la dotation de personnel grâce à sa grande compréhension des liens entre le talent et les affaires. Étant donné qu'Aerotek est un partenaire stratégique de plus de 18 000 clients et 300 000 employés contractuels chaque année, son approche axée sur les gens lui permet d'offrir un avantage concurrentiel à ses clients et des emplois gratifiants à ses employés contractuels. Aerotek, dont le siège social est à Hanover, au Maryland, exploite un réseau de plus de 250 bureaux non franchisés, comptant plus de 8 000 employés internes dévoués à servir nos clients. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Pour en savoir davantage, consultez le site aerotek.com/fr-ca.


About Aerotek:


We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Assembler / General Labour
description:
We are a mature, North American systems integrator serving the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions. From day one, we have pursued leadership positioning in every market we serve including process automation, control system integration, information and MES, automation and robotics systems, automated guided vehicles, material handling, and networking and security applications.  At JMP Solutions, our team helps people, plants, facilities, and equipment run safer, with better efficiency, improved quality and at a lower cost. Our purpose is to help our customers realize their full potential by continually redefining what is possible.


What Would a Typical Day Look Like?

  • You will review drawings and gather all required raw material to assemble the product as per the specified drawing.
  • Ensuring we produce high quality products is of the utmost importance to us. In this role you will help us achieve this goal by performing quality checks on the raw material gathered before use.
  • Learning from our experienced assemblers, you will assemble product according to drawing specifications. Once assembled, you will learn how to tag the product as per the drawing specifications.
  • You will have the chance to participate in the testing of the assembled product to ensure it matches drawing specifications before it is delivered to the customer.
  • You will help us get the product safely to the customer by assisting with packaging and shipping the final product.
  • You will complete administrative duties related to quality information and the recording and tracking of the time spent for each job.


What Qualifies You for this Opportunity?

  • High School Diploma required.
  • Experience assembling mechanical products required. Millwright experience would be a definite asset.
  • Ability to read AutoCAD/blueprint drawings and understand fraction and decimal measurements is required.
  • Must be able to work well under pressure and be able to meet tight deadlines
  • Must supply own CSA approved safety boots and provide own basic tools - wrench/socket set, hammer, screwdrivers, square and hex keys
  • Given the client-focused nature of the work, employees may be required to work over weekends or outside of standard business hours as needed and travel throughout Canada.
  • Forklift and First Aid Certifications are considered an asset
  • Welding experience is considered an asset.

  

What does success look like at JMP?

At JMP, our employees bring more to the table than simply their technical skills. Essential to success at JMP, employees are constantly flexing the following soft skill behaviors to compliment the technical aspects of their roles.

  • Personal Effectiveness: strong communication, adaptability, self-awareness, negotiation, problem-solving
  • Tenacity: purpose, determination, drive, perseverance
  • Sense of urgency: responsiveness, energy, engagement, loyalty
  • Smarts: comprehension, learning aptitude, skillfulness, brain power
  • Accountable: takes ownership, responsible, go-to person, decisiveness

 

 Who is JMP?

A mature, North American company founded in 1987 with 16 business units across the US and Canada, JMP serves the Fortune 1000 space providing engineering services and turnkey solutions in seven core areas: process automation, control system integration, information and MES, automation and robotics systems, automated guided vehicles, material handling, and networking and security applications.  

 

One of the fastest growing Systems Integrators in the world, and the only company in the world who is a Rockwell Automation Solution Partner, CSIA and RIA Certified. We have been certified as a “Great Place to Work” 2013 through 2020 and a “Best Workplaces Canada” award recipient from 2013 through 2020, including Best Workplaces for Inclusion and for Women 2020.

 

What does JMP value?

Our values are our foundational concepts on which we build JMP; we adhere to these no matter what mountain we climb.

  • Integrity: We do what we say we will do, every time, all the time.
  • Relationships: We identify professional working relationships and create opportunities to develop those relationships
  • Collaboration: We team together to achieve far more than we could on our own
  • Leadership: We value people who lead by example, take pride in what they do and inspire others
  • Respect: We promotes a caring environment of mutual respect for employees, customers, partners, and communities
  • Excellence: We set high standards of performance for ourselves and our team

 

Why join the JMP team?

As a growing company in the industrial technology industry and rooted with strong corporate values, JMP Solutions can offer a unique value proposition to employees. Our employee promise is a rewarding employee experience delivered through a focus on three key areas:

  • Development and Career Growth
  • Impact and Recognition
  • Flexibility and Collaboration

 

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

 

JMP Solutions has an accommodation program in place that provides reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please contact Human Resources.

title: Cylinder Assembler (FT)
description:
We have a permanent position available in Assembly. Practical knowledge of mechanical and hydraulic system is an asset. We will provide training on our hydraulics, mechanical and test systems. The position is full time 7:00am – 3:30pm.   
 
Main Responsibilities: 
  • Assembly and Testing of the Vertical and Elvoron Hydraulic Cylinders
  • Co-ordinate with Machine Shop and Paint Shop to ensures timely production of required cylinders
  • Build and test cylinders according to drawing and order specifications
  • Ensures high levels of quality – cylinders must be free defects that may affect the ride quality of the lifts
  • Record assembly and test data in Pivot88 as required.
Skills and Qualifications: 
  • Mechanical and Hydraulic knowledge and experience
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken) 
  • High attention to detail
  • Able to lift 50+ lbs repeatedly throughout the day
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision. 
  • Crane operator certification (can train)
Benefits
  • Employer Paid Benefits Program
  • Extended Health
  • Extended Dental
  • RRSP Program




    About Garaventa Lift Canada:

    At Garaventa Lift, we believe and work to guarantee accessibility and mobility to everyone. Since our start, we have been obsessively passionate about it and our mission is to help people achieve it.The roots of the company go back to 1928 in the beautiful Swiss Alps where Karl Garaventa built his very first of many cable cars.Since then, Garaventa Lift has grown into a global leader with a strong presence worldwide.The Garaventa Lift Group is now a prominent reality in America, Asia, Europe and Oceania standing for reliability, security and innovation of accessibility products to create an accessible world.We work to deliver custom lift solutions for commercial and residential applications and bring our engineering expertise and high-quality standards to remove architectural barriers for millions of people worldwide.
