title: Assembler
description:
Welcome to Mir, firm specializing in the recruitment of technical, administrative and executives, for companies in the grandeur of Quebec.

We are currently looking for assemblers for our industrial partner, a family business Québécoise based in Laval, manufactures high quality vans, designed to carry all types of goods.

Main tasks:

  • Assemble the different van components;
  • use with care the tools needed for the manufacture of vans (drill, riveter, floor nailer, measuring tape, etc.);
  • Respect the rules and Health and safety procedures;
  • perform any other related tasks as needed.

Requirements:

  • own 6 months to 1 year of production in manufacturing production or other relevant experience (asset);
  • have a very good dexterity and be meticulous;
  • Experience in manipulation of various and specialized tools (drill, riveter, pneumatic shock, grinder, etc.);
  • reading plans;
  • have good physical capacity (capacity to lift loads of less than 50 pounds).

working conditions:

  • Permanent posts- 40h / week, day and evening;
  • day schedule: from 6:15 to 14:45, 6:30 to 15:00 or 7:00 to 15:30, Monday to Friday,
  • evening schedule: from 16h00 to 2h30 , from Monday to Thursday,
  • salary: $ 18.00 / h at hiring, $ 18.90 / h after 3 months of probation and $ 19.85 / h after 1 year;
  • evening premium offered $ 2.15 / h.

Advantages:

  • competitive program d 'collective assurances (medical and paramedical expense insurance, dental insurance, short and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, travel assistance);
  • RRSP (registered retirement savings plan) and RPDB (Deferred Participation Plan for Bene in contribution from the employer;
  • employment stability year round (40 hours a week) and possibility to make extra time (more bonus);
  • easily accessible by public transport / on-site parking;
  • Competitive remuneration and first salary overhaul after 3 months;
  • $ 2.15 / hour evening bonus;
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program;
  • Full Integration Plan;
  • Specific Training Programs by Post;
  • Numerous possibilities of Internal career path;
  • Employer-funded cafeteria service;
  • allowance for the purchase of clothing and safety boots;
  • Reference program with $ 1,000 bonus;
  • activities of the social club and more !!

Please note that only the successful candidate (e) s will be contacted.
Communicate with us:
Phone: 514 494-4414 / Fax: 514 494-5374

title: Assembler - Truck Equipment
description:
Vehicle Accessories Assembler

If you love mechanical assembly and enjoy fresh challenges each day this job is for you! Due to continued business growth, we are looking for a full-time accessories assembler, to join our champion production team. We are an innovative, fast paced vehicle equipment installer with a clean, positive culture & safe work environment.

Sterling Fleet Outfitters exists to improve the lives of mobile technicians! Providing them with outfitting solutions that minimize their downtime and maximize their effectiveness, giving them the best opportunity to be great on the job.

WHO ARE YOU?

  • Have a good attitude & morals
  • Honest
  • Upbeat & Positive
  • A team player
  • Action-oriented
  • Self-Motivated

Experience

  • Previous vehicle accessories assembly is preferred, but willing to train the right candidate
  • Have proven mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
  • Operating Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Physically fit and be able to lift, bend and stand for a complete shift
  • Class 5 driver's license
  • Able to drive a fork lift
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

Not required but a definite asset:

Experience with installing 12v electrical lighting/ inverters/ backup alarms and 12v electrical problem solving

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • As a Van & Truck Equipment Accessories Assembler you will assemble partitions, shelving, ladder racks, custom cabinets/ draw systems, mount components for commercial vehicles
  • Potential for career progression in to vehicle installations
  • Interpret and follow detailed assembly instructions
  • Customize various panels to fit design specifications
  • Operate: Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

YOUR WAGE & HOURS

  • Hours of work: 7:00 am — 3:30 pm Monday – Friday
  • Wage: Dependent upon experience with a 3-month review. $20 - $27

Check out our website and gallery to learn more about what we do. https://sterlingfleetoutfitter...

Work remotely

  • No

title: Assembler - Trainee
description:
Looking to start a career as an Agricultural Equipment Assembler or Heavy Equipment Assembler but don’t have the certifications? Brandt is offering an exclusive in-house assembly training program!

Equipment Assembly Experience Not Required!

Brandt will provide the necessary training and invest in you to help you start or continue your career. It’s a great time to join the team!

We are offering this program to current and external applicants. This assembly training program will allow you to advance your career by challenging yourself, adding new skills to your arsenal, and opening new opportunities for promotion.

Why continue your education with this Brandt University Training Program?

  • Learn how to use tools and equipment.
  • Learn how to assemble and manufacture quality products in an efficient manner
  • The simple, streamlined course delivers the exact training you need to get started as an equipment assembler, without spending money and time on training you won’t use at Brandt.
  • Earn regular pay while you are training!
  • Tuition and training material costs are covered for candidates who are hired into the training program.
  • This is an excellent opportunity to learn skills, start a career, and enhance your long-term advancement potential.

DETAILS

  • Courses are taking place on an ongoing basis.
  • 7:00am – 3:30pm Monday through Friday.

title: Assembler
description:
If you’re looking for a special place to build or grow your career, you’ve found it. Whether you’re an experienced professional, a recent college graduate or somewhere in between, IDEX is a place where you can apply your existing skills and learn new ones in an environment where you can make an impact. With interesting opportunities in engineering, marketing, sales, supply chain, operations, HR, finance, and more across more than 40 diverse businesses (https://www.idexcorp.com/our-businesses/business-segments/) around the globe, chances are, we have something special for you.

Position Summary:

This role is responsible for assembly, testing and documenting operating conditions of the product line.

Hours of Work:

Mon to Thurs (7am to 4pm) and Friday (7am to 3pm)

Reports To:

Production Leader

Essential Functions:

+ Position and install parts, subassemblies and accessories. + Test electrical drive motors for proper performance using testing devices. + Inspect equipment/parts after assembly. + Mark, record and report defects. + Pick and expedite parts from work orders, as required. + Work in compliance with the company’s health and safety and policies and procedures as well as ISO standards and procedures. + Other duties, as assigned

Qualifications:

+ Grade 12 or equivalent + 3-5 years of experience in machine building, machining and/or assembly. + Good written and verbal communications required. + Competent using Microsoft applications + Used an Inventory or Planning Software. + Ability to reach schematics, blueprints and other technical diagrams. + Ability to multi-task within a fast-paced environment + Good interpersonal skills + Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills + A strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality and safety

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: + Stand, Walk and/or Sit 50% of the time + Use hands to handle, reach and feel : 90% of the time + Talk and hear 100% of the time + Regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds

About us:

IDEX Corporation ( www.idexcorp.com ) is a

leading manufacturer of highly engineered diversified products

in industries ranging across health, science, safety, fire and fluidics. Operating in 24 countries, IDEX is an innovative and rapidly growing company, focused on delivering excellence through diverse, winning teams. IDEX lives the values of Trust, Team and Excellence. The

Waterloo Material Processing Technologies (MPT) group

within IDEX Corporation is comprised of the following business units: + Quadro Engineering Corp. (www.quadro-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.quadro-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_Nz9UjzLI$) ) + The Fitzpatrick Company (www.fitzpatrick-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.fitzpatrick-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NTuOmvYM$) ) + Microfluidics International Corporation (www.microfluidics-mpt.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.microfluidics-mpt.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NgnF4Ht8$) ) + Steridose (www.steridose.com (https://urldefense.com/v3/\_\_http:/www.steridose.com\_\_;!!NlLrMPuo!8rF7FUeZX0u1cGOGsj1WWL8nOiPLFunO7VWgBPfxwQnWVYWVoQ6KnX\_NK0AjZ9A$) ) These companies are leading brands within

Pharmaceutical, Food, Cosmetic, Personal Care and Chemical markets

where they engineer and manufacture technologically superior equipment for material processing (solid, semi-solid and liquid). Significant investments in capital, new positions and development of existing people are being made at the Waterloo, Ontario site which houses the headquarters (all functions) for Quadro Engineering, Fitzpatrick and operations for Microfluidics and Steridose. _Quadro Engineering Corp. is committed to providing a barrier-free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process, it will be available upon request. This job posting is available in an accessible format upon request._ Are you ready to join a different kind of company where our people, our culture, and our commitments are centered around providing trusted solutions that improve lives around the world? IDEX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. IDEX gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration or protected category made unlawful by federal, state or local laws (Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled).

Business Unit:

Quadro

Job Segment:

HST Health & Science Technologies

title: Mechanical/Electrical Assembler - Pumps
description:
This position is for an Assembler with production experience in fit-up and fine adjustments, enjoys working with their hands, self-motivated, attentive to detail, and takes pride in achieving performance excellence.

Responsibilities and Duties:
• Demonstrates excellence in performing complex mechanical and electrical assemblies.
• Ability to multitask
• Knowledge of impellers, shafts, gearboxes, and bushings installation and fine adjustments.
• Completes fit-up, welding, grinding, deburring, and polishing operations
• Interpret assembly drawings, work order instructions, procedure manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions.
• Complete standardized written documentation and forms.
• Uses appropriate inspection gauges.
• Report deviations from specifications and tolerances to supervisor.
• Maintain inspection records and complete inspection reports.
• Reports any malfunctions or equipment problems to management.
• The job requires the use of hand/powered tools, wires, fixtures, parts, sub-assemblies, and operation of overhead crane and pallet jack.
• Adheres to all company policies and procedures paying special attention to health and safety procedures.
• Maintains clean, orderly, and safe work areas.
• Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:
• Physical: o Sitting, Standing, and Walking. o Carrying, Stooping, Lifting and Reaching. o Lifting Up to 50 pounds.
• Mental o Math. o The use of the English language, both Oral and Written. o Requires daily communication with multiple departments to insure maximum efficiency

Education & Training:
• OSSD High School Diploma or GED required
• Technical School Diploma, Trade Certificate or Equivalent Certificate of Qualifications
• CWB Welding certificate is an asset
• TSSA Certified Carbon and Stainless is an asset
• Previous Certification Forklift and Overhead Crane
• Advanced Math, including geometry and trigonometry

title: Manufacturing Intern
description:
Alexandria Moulding is currently seeking Summer Students to join our team.
We have positions available in our manufacturing and distribution centers.

Qualifications:
  • Successful candidates will be assigned to one of these area’s based on available opportunities at the time of hire.
  • Candidates must be full-time students and enrolled in high-school (grade 11 or 12) or a Post-Secondary Institution for 2022.
Job Details:
  • All assignments require adherence to specific procedures and work practices related to manufacturing.
  • Work is scheduled on 8- or 12-hour shift (day, afternoon, night, weekend shifts) to provide relief to the regular employees during summer vacation period.
General Responsibilities Include:
  • Ensure safety standards are met by following Alexandria Moulding safe work and lockout procedures.
  • Maintain high standards of cleanliness in your work area and throughout the facility.
  • Train and develop skills in various areas of the facility.
  • Willing to work in an environment with varying temperatures and conditions.
  • Develop strong working relationships with your peers and manufacturing and distribution teams.
  • Work assigned requires problem solving skills and capability to perform the physical aspects of the role (lifting, bending, standing, pushing/pulling etc.)
  • Housekeeping.
The Candidate:
  • Ability to work in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Available to work various shifts.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot.
  • Positive attitude and a self-starter.
  • Able to work in an environment that may include exposure to weather, dust, moving mechanical parts, and noise.

title: Production Associate
description:
Summary

We are looking for a part time Production Associate to assist our Operations team.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Assembling and testing satellite products
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications

  • High School diploma
  • Prior experience assembling and testing satellite products
  • Detail oriented
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines

 

About Us

 

Comtech is a leading provider of innovative and optimized satellite communications solutions. Our efficient and reliable ground equipment portfolio meets the unique demands of our mobile backhaul, government, mobility and enterprise customers on every continent, in 160+ countries and across every ocean. For more information, visit www.comtechefdata.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

Résumé

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un associé de production à temps partiel pour aider notre équipe des opérations.

 

Fonctions et responsabilités essentielles

  • Assemblage et essais de produits satellites
  • Autres tâches assignées

 

Qualifications

  • Diplôme d'études secondaires
  • Expérience préalable dans l'assemblage et l'essai de produits satellites
  • Orienté détail
  • Capacité à travailler dans un environnement rapide et à respecter les délais

 

À propos de nous

 

Comtech est l'un des principaux fournisseurs de solutions de communications par satellite innovantes et optimisées. Notre portefeuille d'équipements au sol efficaces et fiables répond aux exigences uniques de nos clients mobiles, gouvernementaux, mobiles et d'entreprise sur tous les continents, dans plus de 160 pays et à travers tous les océans. Pour plus d'informations, visitez www.comtechefdata.com. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront considérés pour un emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, l'origine nationale, le handicap ou le statut d'ancien combattant protégé. Des mesures d'adaptation raisonnables peuvent être prises pour permettre aux personnes handicapées d'exercer les fonctions essentielles.

title: Production Assembler I
description:
WORK LOCATION: 7371 Vantage Way Delta BC, V4G 1C9

WORKING HOURS: 6:30AM to 3:00PM Monday thru Thursday and 6:30AM to 2:10PM
QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic: Grade 12 diploma preferred. Courses in mechanical/electrical technology an asset.

Work Experience: Minimum three years mechanical/electrical assembly and/or metal fabrication experience or equivalent required. Experience in use of pneumatic tools an asset. Forklift certification is required.

Skills/Other: Ability to read blueprints, competence in mathematics, ability to lift 25 lbs, strong time management skills and ability to change priorities as required. Must have own tools.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Grinding, cleaning, pressure washing parts.
  • Parts assembly (mechanical, hydraulic, electrical) under supervision.
  • Pallet/ crate building.
  • Crating and packaging for shipping.
  • Keep an accurate record of time charged to each job.
  • General shop maintenance and participation in weekly shop cleanup.
  • Full comprehension of safety requirements.
  • Participates in quality assurance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Poste : opérateur de production
Lieu de travail : Saint-Jérôme

À la recherche d’un emploi stable au sein d’une entreprise qui a à cœur le bien-être de ses employés? Alors, lisez attentivement ce qui suit. Vous pourriez rapidement décrocher un nouvel emploi.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche de plusieurs opérateurs de production pour une entreprise située à Saint-Jérôme dans le domaine de la transformation du bois.

Nous recherchons des employés assez flexibles au niveau de l’horaire, capables de travailler de jour, de soir et de nuit afin de pouvoir respecter la convention collective en vigueur.

Ce que nous offrons :

- Emploi permanent à long terme
- Assurances complètes (dentaire, médicale, vie, invalidité, etc.)
- Montant forfaitaire pour activités sportives
- Cotisation dans un fonds de pension à prestation déterminée
- Équipements de protection et vêtements fournis
- Ambiance de travail dynamique et de type familiale
- Emploi syndiqué
- Remplacement de départ à la retraite

Ce qu'il faut pour postuler :

- DES ou équivalent complété
- Au moins 1 an d'expérience dans une usine manufacturière ou entrepôt
- Disponibilité pour travailler de jour, de soir ou de nuit

Vos tâches :

- Assurer le contrôle de qualité des produits finis
- Faire fonctionner la machinerie industrielle
- Respecter les mesures et les normes demandées par les clients
- Respecter les directives et procédures de travail
- Suivre les consignes de santé-sécurité et relever tout risque
- Accomplir toutes autres tâches connexes

Cet emploi d’opérateur de production à Saint-Jérôme vous intéresse? Veuillez envoyer rapidement votre CV en format Word à Philip Agbi à />
RECOMMANDEZ UNE PERSONNE EMBAUCHÉE POUR UN POSTE PERMANENT ET GAGNEZ JUSQU’À 1 000 $ ! Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici.


NOS PORTES VIRTUELLES SONT OUVERTES! En plus, vous passerez les entrevues à domicile grâce à différentes applications Web! Alors, contactez-nous dès aujourd’hui pour relever votre prochain défi professionnel.

title: Manufacturing Jobs- Guelph
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have over 5,000 associates in 11 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year. And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies? Our team members can take home free snacks!

Now offering NEW PAY RATES AND contract seasonal opportunities from April through early September for Packer and Machine Operators!

We are hiring for the following Job Opportunities at our  Bakery Manufacturing Plant in Guelph:

  • Machine Operator (oven room)  Starting Pay 20.48  & $21.48 after 1040 hours

    • shift premium $0.30 for afternoon shift 3:00 pm -11:00 pm Monday to Friday

    • shift premium $0.45 for night shift Sunday 9:00 pm - 7:00 am and Monday to Thursday 11:00 pm -7:00 am

       

  • Packer Team Member - Starting Pay $19.19  & 20.19 after 1040 hours
    • shift premium $0.30 for the afternoon shift - 3:00 pm -11:00 pm Monday to Friday
    • shift premium $0.45 for the night shift - 11:00 pm to 7:00 am Sunday - Thursday

 

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility: Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

We Offer a Feast of Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short Term Disability, Employee Assistance Plan and a great group of people to work with every day!

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace:
Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

This is your invitation to apply now!

title: Assembler
description:
Notre département des opérations est à la recherche de plusieurs assembleurs pour fabriquer nos scanneurs 3D, un travail manuel et minutieux qui s’effectue de jour, du lundi au vendredi, dans un bel environnement de travail, enrichissant, gratifiant et humain!

Tes projets t’amèneront à:

  • Fabriquer des scanneurs de A à Z, des petits bijoux technologiques qui contribuent, dans les entreprises, à développer des voitures, des prothèses et bien plus…
  • Voir le résultat final de tes efforts!
  • Apprendre tout au long de la journée. On s’occupe de te montrer comment ça marche!
  • T’assurer que tout ce qui sort de l’assemblage correspond aux critères de Creaform et des tiens. Tu seras impliqué dans le processus;
  • Avoir du plaisir en travaillant – oui c’est possible!

Tu as le profil recherché si tu:

  • Détiens une expérience enrichissante sur le marché du travail! Tu travailles dans une usine, dans un restaurant ou dans un hôtel? Ça nous intéresse!
  • As un talent inné pour l’assemblage et que tu aimes comprendre le fonctionnement des choses;
  • Es un bon joueur d’équipe et que tu as envie de te sentir comme un membre à part entière d’un groupe. On t’offre ça sans hésitation;
  • Es minutieux et que rien ne t’échappe;
  • As envie de faire la différence et te sentir fier de ton travail.

En échange, nous t'offrons :

  • La chance de travailler dans une ambiance de travail stimulante au sein d'une équipe humaine et passionnée;
  • Un lieu de travail sécuritaire, silencieux, neuf et propre;
  • L'opportunité de développer tes compétences et expertises;
  • Des horaires flexibles sur un quart de jour;
  • Un salaire et potentiel de croissance à la hauteur de tes attentes;
  • Un large éventail d'activités sociales, et bien plus encore.

En tant que filiale d'AMETEK Inc., un acteur mondial de premier plan dans la fabrication d’instruments électroniques et d'appareils électromécaniques, Creaform est reconnue à l’international pour ses technologies de pointe et son excellence en R&D. Bien que nous développions notre marché à l’échelle mondiale, notre environnement de travail préserve l'esprit entrepreneurial et le dynamisme d'une entreprise en démarrage.

Le poste vous intéresse, mais vous n'avez pas toutes les compétences demandées ? Transmettez-nous quand même votre candidature. Nous croyons que l'expérience et le contexte personnel, combinés à une bonne dose de passion, peuvent faire toute la différence.

title: ASSEMBLEUR-MONTEUR
description:
Poste d'électromécanicien - permanent - jour - Montréal

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'un électromécanicien de jour pour venir rejoindre une compagnie en pleine expansion.

A titre d'électromécanicien, vous aurez à effectuer le montage des modules mécaniques. Vous aurez aussi à faire la réparation, l'entretien électrique, pneumatique et hydraulique.



Avantages
- Horaire de jour (lundi au jeudi de 8h à 17h et vendredi de 8h à 14h30)
- Salaire entre 24$ et 28$ selon l'expérience
- Avantages sociaux payés à 50% par l'employeur

Responsabilités
Montage de panneaux ou colonnes, structure, boulonnage des modules des équipements et carrosserie et de mécanique.
Assister les électromécaniciens à faire la réparation et l’entretien électrique, pneumatique et hydraulique de l’équipement de garagiste chez les clients sur l’île de Montréal et les environs.
Travail sur la route; camion fourni.

Qualifications
- DEP en assemblage métallique, mécanique industrielle ou électromécanique
- Lecture de plan


Sommaire
Votre prochain emploi n’est peut-être qu’à un clic… Postulez et appelez Jean-Daniel pour discuter des détails de l’offre ou des différentes opportunités d’emploi disponibles.

Contactez-nous au 514-206-3577. Vous pouvez aussi nous envoyer directement votre CV à jean-daniel.paquet@randstad.ca

Si vous connaissez des gens qui pourraient être intéressés par cette opportunité, référez-les nous! Vous pourriez obtenir une prime de référencement de 200$. Ils n’ont qu’à mentionner votre nom.

Vous êtes déjà à l’emploi et cherchez à améliorer vos conditions de travail? Postulez sans crainte! Nos politiques en matière de confidentialité sont très claires : nous ne communiquerons pas avec votre employeur actuel sans votre accord.

Randstad, l'humain en tête

Jean-Daniel, spécialistes des métiers spécialisés


téléphone:
514.206.3577

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Mold Assembler - Repairs
description:
If you’re looking to build a career with a successful, growing organization where you’ll be invested in; a leader in the injection mold industry that creates products you touch on a daily basis; a team of passionate people, some with 20, 30 and 40 years of service, who want to see you succeed…then look at StackTeck Systems Ltd. 

The position of Mold Assembler is responsible for the assembly/disassembly of injection molds and components within the molds, to repair and test based on customer requirements.  This position will report into the Supervisor, Repair Department at the Teck Center.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Disassemble and clean molds to evaluate repairs necessary
  • Troubleshoot components and document needed repairs
  • Utilize a variety of measuring instruments such as micrometers, calipers, etc.
  • Works to close tolerances on all assigned work projects
  • Use various hand/power tools to complete assembly/disassembly functions
  • Read, interpret and follow basic diagrams, or engineering drawings, and other written instructions or procedures to accurately assemble component
  • Performs general housekeeping duties of work area and shop floor.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education in a Mechanical discipline, but not necessary
  • 2-3 years of mechanical assembly experience is required
  • Ability to use measuring instruments
  • Knowledge of Plastic Injection Molds preferred

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Decision Making: Utilizing effective process to make decisions on own.
  • Teamwork: Working effectively with others
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem solving aptitude
  • Attention to detail: Making sure things are done right the first time
  • Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to people.
  • Self Motivated: Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and/or direction

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

We thank all who apply and will respond to those who most closely match the requirements.

title: Assembler
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Assembler at our 352 Arvin Ave. location.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Assembler is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to: assembly, training, inspecting, problem solving, machine operator as well as communicating manpower and scheduling issues with supervision. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the IATF Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer supplied automotive parts to meet specified quality standards.
  • Record daily production ensuring accuracy and submit to Supervisor.
  • Handle product properly at all times, and assemble according to specifications.
  • Ensure that materials or equipment required be kept in a clean manner before and after shifts and report any maintenance issues to Supervisor.
  • Conduct a final inspection before customer product is packed and/or labeled.
  • Handle product properly at all times and package according to specifications.
  • Ensure that work area is clean and orderly throughout and after the shift.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and potential hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined.
  • Perform duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal, and written
  • Interpret technical drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work rotating shifts, 1 week day shift (6:00am-3:00pm) and 1 week afternoon shift (3:30pm-12:15PM)

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources athr@tiercon.com.

title: Assemblers (Afternoon Shift)
description:
Assemblers

Curtiss-Wright are looking for three Assembler for our afternoon shift (3.30pm -- 2am) to join our Indal team at our Mississauga position. These new roles are to support our growing business in implementing an afternoon shift to support our increased workload.

If you are passionate about your work and interested in progressing your career with a global company, we want to hear from you! Immediate interviews and start dates available.

Location: Mississauga, ON

Your Challenge:


* Preparing material for welding using various processes, including chemical etching
* Performing drill press operations (drill, tap and read to drawing specification, counterbore and countersink, sharpen drill bits)
* Installing bushings and bearings, helicoils and rivets
* Setting up and test assembled products as required by test procedures
* Operating brake press, punch press, drills (radial and spindle), shear, saw(s)

Your Expertise:


* Must have a minimum of 5 years industrial fabricating/fitting experience, or assembly experience and must be able to assembly complex, high precision machined components to drawing requirements in an accurate and cost-effective manner
* Must have the potential to fabricate and/or assemble complete tube assemblies and hydraulic assemblies to drawings and hydraulic schematics
* Experience setting up and running both conventional and programmable brake presses an asset
* Must be to read and work from work orders and engineering drawings
* Ability to operate forklifts, overhead cranes, plate clamps, slings and chains
* Experience working with height gauges, dial indicators, steel square, tape rules, angle plates, layout table, micrometers and verniers, radius gauges, thread gauges, protractors and combination squares, gauge blocks and parallels
* Proficient in the use of electric and pneumatic tools, riveting tools, helicoil insert tools, tapping machines, bench grinders, circular saws, jig saws, portable nibbler, band saws and cut off saws

This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

+ Experience working with height gauges, dial indicators, steel square, tape rules, angle plates, layout table, micrometers and verniers, radius gauges, thread gauges, protractors and combination squares, gauge blocks and parallels

+ Proficient in the use of electric and pneumatic tools, riveting tools, helicoil insert tools, tapping machines, bench grinders, circular saws, jig saws, portable nibbler, band saws and cut off saws


This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

title: Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Montage
description:
Jobnummer:29491 
Gruppe: Cosma International 
Division: Magna BDW Technologies Soest GmbH 
Art der Beschäftigung: Festanstellung 
Standort: SOEST

 

Gruppenbeschreibung

 

Cosma bietet eine umfangreiche Auswahl an Karosserie-, Fahrwerk- und Engineering-Lösungen für Kunden in aller Welt. Durch unser verlässliches Produkt-Engineering, unsere herausragenden Werkzeugkompetenzen und unser vielfältiges Prozess-Know-how bringen wir stetig leichte und innovative Produkte auf den Markt.

Am Standort Soest fertigen wir mit rund 600 Mitarbeitern Aluminiumteile für die Automobilbranche an. Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir für unseren Standort in Soest zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) Montage.

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Sie

  • Selbstständige Bedienung der vollautomatisierten Nietanlagen  
  • Selbständiges Arbeiten an Prüflehren je nach Arbeitsauslastung an den Nietanlagen
  • Durchführung von Qualitätsprüfungen nach Vorgabe
  • Maschinen rüsten, Umbauarbeiten durchführen
  • Lesen und Auswerten von Messberichten
  • Störungssuche & Ausführen von kleineren Reparaturen an den Anlagen
  • Reinigung und Wartung von Anlagen & Arbeitsplätzen nach Vorgabe

Das sollten Sie mitbringen

  • Ausbildung im Metallbereich oder einem technischen Beruf
  • Erfahrung im Bedienen von Produktionsanlagen mit ABB Robotern wünschenswert
  • Erfahrung an Handmontageplätzen sowie handwerkliches Geschicke wünschenswert
  • Teamfähigkeit & hohes Qualitätsverständnis
  • Bereitschaft zur Drei-Schicht und Wochenendarbeit

Das bieten wir Ihnen

  • Kantine und kostenloses Wasser aus Spendern
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit persönlicher Beratung
  • Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld
  • Umfangreiche Schulungs- und Trainingsmaßnahmen
  • Kollegiales Arbeitsklima
  • Bike-Leasing

Kontakt

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Onlinebewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen über den Bewerbungsassistenten oder über: www.magna.com/company/careers

 

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Brampton, ON, Canada Req #4253

Wednesday, February 23, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, group pension, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints
Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly

title: Mechanical Assembler (FT)
description:
Garaventa Lift, a leading accessibility manufacturer has positions available for Mechanical Assemblers to become an integral part of our team. This is a full-time day shift position, Mon-Fri with some overtime available Saturdays.

Responsibilities:
  • Work with a team to assemble mechanical products or components.
  • Rotate through tasks-specific production processes.
  • Conduct quality inspections on products and parts.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Qualifications:
  • Ability to read and interpret assembly drawings.
  • Previous experience in manufacturing, assembly, or other related fields is an asset.
  • Familiarity with assembly tools and equipment.
  • Ability to handle physical workload.
  • Ability to work well in teams and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Benefits
  • Employer Paid Benefits Program
  • Extended Health
  • Extended Dental
  • RRSP Program




    About Garaventa Lift Canada:

    At Garaventa Lift, we believe and work to guarantee accessibility and mobility to everyone. Since our start, we have been obsessively passionate about it and our mission is to help people achieve it.The roots of the company go back to 1928 in the beautiful Swiss Alps where Karl Garaventa built his very first of many cable cars.Since then, Garaventa Lift has grown into a global leader with a strong presence worldwide.The Garaventa Lift Group is now a prominent reality in America, Asia, Europe and Oceania standing for reliability, security and innovation of accessibility products to create an accessible world.We work to deliver custom lift solutions for commercial and residential applications and bring our engineering expertise and high-quality standards to remove architectural barriers for millions of people worldwide.

title: Electromécanicien pour le Québec- Canada
description:
Electromécanicien H/F

Secteur: Agro-alimentaire
Lieu du poste: Ste Hyacinthe
Situer Ste Hyacinthe

Mission:

Rattaché(e) au Responsable Maintenance, vousavez en charge d’assurer la maintenance préventive, curative et améliorative de l’équipement de production, dans le respect des règles et procédures d’hygiène, de sécurité, et d’environnement, ainsi que des règles et procédures relatives à a sécurité produit:

Dépanner, ajuster et réparer les éléments électroniques, électriques, mécaniques, hydrauliques et pneumatiques sur les machines et façon à ce qu’elles fonctionnent le mieux possible.
Lire, comprendre, mettre à jour les plans d’électricité et de contrôle.
Exécuter un entretien préventif et correctif selon les calendriers et procédés établis.
Dépanner les systèmes électroniques, électromécaniques asservis et électriques, en utilisant divers instruments et techniques de mise à l’essai, afin d’isoler et corriger les problèmes et rendre la machine conforme aux normes de précision requises.
Dépanner et corriger les systèmes mécaniques, hydrauliques dans les machines en changeant les composantes défectueuses en faisant les mises au point et ajustements nécessaires des pièces pour rendre la machine conforme aux normes de précision.
Ajouter et modifier les éléments électroniques, hydrauliques, pneumatiques et mécaniques des machines à servo-moteur, pneumatiques ou à contrôle électronique.
Se tenir informé des techniques reliées au fonctionnement et à l’entretien des différent types de machines ainsi que des systèmes électriques, hydrauliques, mécaniques, pneumatiques et asservis connexes.
Accomplir toutes autres tâches connexes.
Nettoyer après les réparations ou les installations pour mise en production.
Effectuer tout programme de nettoyage et de mise en ordre dans l’atelier.
Responsable de ses instruments de travail.
Compléter les rapports requis.
Participer l’entraînement des nouveaux employés (transfert de connaissances) sur les équipements sous sa responsabilité.
Le tout en respectant les règlements de la compagnie.


Profil:

Vous êtes titulaire d’un CAP/BEP (Mécanique / Electrotechnique) avec 3/4 ans minimum d’expérience ou d'un Bac Professionnel en maintenance (Mécanique, électrotechnique) avec 4/5 ans d’expérience minimum, acquise dans le secteur de la production agro alimentaire industrielle.
Vous êtes en mesure d’intervenir de manière autonome en électricité et mécanique.
Vous disposez d’un excellent esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes familier(ère) de l’utilisation des outils bureautiques classiques.

Horaires: de travail:

De semaine:lundi au jeudi ou mardi au vendredi36 hrs travaillées, 38 hrs payées
Quart A (jour):7 à 16h
Quart B (soir):13h30 à 22h30
Quart C (nuit):22h15 à 7h15

De fin de semaine : vendredi au dimanche,37.5hrs travaillées, 39.5hrs payées
Quart D (FDS jour):7 à 19h30
Quart E (FDSnuit):19 à 7h30

title: Opérateur de production (CNP 9614) (15643)
description:
Produits forestiers Résolu est une entreprise axée sur la gérance environnementale et le succès financier qui offre des emplois valorisants et prometteurs, donnant ainsi aux gens motivés toutes les chances de faire progresser leur carrière. Si vous êtes une personne enthousiaste et prête à agir utilement, Résolu est le gage de votre réussite professionnelle.

Notre établissement de Maniwaki (Québec, Canada) est actuellement à la recherche de candidats compétents en vue de pourvoir le poste de Opérateur de production (CNP 9614). Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein.

 

Principales fonctions:

Relevant du superviseur de production, vos principales responsabilités seront :

  • Opérer et suveiller divers équipements de production dans nos départements;
  • Nettoyer certains secteurs de l'usine et maintenir votre environnement propre et sécuritaire;
  • Assurer la qualité des produits selon nos standards et les exigences des clients;
  • Appliquer les procédures requises en santé et sécurité, en environnement et selon la norme ISO.

 

Exigences et conditions de travail :

  • Être reconnu comme une personne sécuritaire ne faisant aucun compromis pour la sécurité;
  • Posséder une bonne débrouillardise, être respectueux des règlements et procédures; 
  • Posséder un diplôme d’études secondaires ou l’équivalent. Une personne possédant un TDG ou un secondaire 3 terminé ET 3 ans d'expérience sur le marché du travail sera considérée;
  • Salaire compétitif (À partir de 22.38 $/heure); 
  • Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux.
  • Langue: Français et/ou anglais

 

Nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus. Produits forestiers Résolu souscrit aux principes d'équité en matière d'emploi.

L’usage du masculin dans ce document a pour unique but d’alléger le texte.

 

Les produits forestiers sont essentiels, tout comme chacun de nos employés et de nos entrepreneurs. Nous prenons les mesures nécessaires pour protéger la santé et le bien-être de nos employés et préserver l’intégrité de toutes les installations de Résolu.

 

Nous sommes tous solidaires dans cette crise. Nous formons une grande communauté. Nous sommes #FIÈREMENTRÉSOLU

 


Des emplois pour grandir
Chef de file mondial de l’industrie des produits forestiers, Résolu vous propose un milieu de travail dynamique et sécuritaire, riche en occasions et en défis qui vous permettront de développer vos compétences. Notre main-d’œuvre diversifiée compte plus de 8000 employés.

Nous commercialisons un large éventail de produits de pâte, de papier, de papier tissu et de produits du bois dans plus de 70 pays, et possédons ou exploitons quelque 40 installations ainsi que des actifs de production d'électricité au Canada et aux États-Unis.

Notre entreprise est en train d’écrire une nouvelle page de son histoire dans un secteur en évolution rapide. Nous avons réalisé d’importants progrès pour assurer notre rentabilité à long terme et pour devenir un fournisseur de choix, respectueux de l’environnement. Pour demeurer chef de file de notre secteur, nous sommes à la recherche de personnes motivées et désireuses d’apprendre. Venez participer à notre histoire et faire partie du changement!

Pour savoir comment nous bâtissons le Résolu de demain, consultez notre rapport annuel sur pfresolu.com/publications.

Joignez-vous à la conversation!
Lisez Le blogue Résolu à blogue.pfresolu.com et suivez-nous sur LinkedIn, Twitter et YouTube.

15643​ 
 
Général

title: Production Assembler
description:
Job Description:

The Production Assembler is responsible for performing operations in the final meter assembly work cells. This includes assembling, testing, and boxing various products while following work instructions. New Hires will undergo training followed by certification while learning Lean Manufacturing concepts.   Assemblers must be able to work in an energetic environment and have passion in achieving daily productivity targets while respecting our Safety, Quality, Environmental and Covid-19 policies.

 

What will you do?

  • Prepare, process, clean, install, assemble, rework, verify, test, solder, and/or inspect electrical and mechanical components, hardware, sub assemblies, and assemblies on single or multiple product lines
  • Operate shop equipment and tools where applicable
  • Adhere to environmental and safety procedures associated with production processes and procedures
  • Use work instructions, drawings, methods, diagrams, workmanship standards or other specifications in accordance with established assembly procedures
  • Monitor and record related documentation to meet quality requirements
  • Follow production build rates, schedules and meet time standards

 

What qualifications will make you successful?  

  • A high school diploma
  • Good written, verbal, reading and math skills
  • Strong manual dexterity and hand/eye coordination
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to use manual tools and light power tools
  • Ability to work and contribute in a team environment
  • Familiarity with 5S and Lean Manufacturing concepts
  • Ability to Stand for extended periods of time
  • Flexibility to perform other duties based upon business needs
  • Previous Manufacturing or Electronics knowledge is an asset
  • Must be flexible working either morning shift or afternoon shift (Afternoon shift is eligible for shift premium)

 

Benefits Highlights    

  • Competitive wages
  • Annual bonus based on company performance
  • Annual discounted stock purchase offer
  • Company matched retirement savings program
  • Extended health and dental benefits. Basic and optional life insurance. Disability insurance
  • Paid Time Off: 19-29 days based on length of service. 12 paid stat holidays annually
  • Paid Time Off purchase program
  • Paid Family leave (12 weeks for primary parent, 2 weeks for secondary parent)
  • Employee and Family assistance program
  • Well-being program (training and coaching for healthy habits, and rewards for achievements)
  • Internal mobility
(External) English Qualifications:

 

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

 

(External) English Company Boiler Plate:

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

 

â‚¬25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

 

 

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

 

It is the policy of Schneider Electric  to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

  • Must follow instructions by supervisor.
  • Must be able to use hand tools , power tools, air tools.
  • Must have own PPE, steel toe boots, gloves, safety glasses and mask.

If you are interested in this position please contact us ( 905) 206-9442 or 1058-br@labourready.com for more information and registration.

title: Assembly Operator - Evening Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift and evening shift teams.

Shift : Evening - Monday to Friday - 3pm to 11pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Evening shift premium : 0.45$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements :

  • High school diploma
  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work standing for extended periods
  • Languages: French or English

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Assembler
description:
Assembler

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

This position is responsible for performing any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed
  • Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device
  • Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment
  • Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on printed circuit boards or chassis panel.
  • Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, marettes, or related bonding procedures and equipment.
  • Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets.
  • Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, locks, screws, wires and switches, to assemblies.
  • Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as conformal coating, silk screening, masking, cutting traces, labeling assemblies.
  • Tends machines that press, shape, or engrave component parts
  • Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics.
  • Performs on-line go-not-go testing and  inspection, using magnifying devices and Automatic Optical Inspection(AOI), measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards.
  • May perform assembly, soldering or inspections under microscope or other magnifying device.
  • Perform loading of PCB’s in trolley, packing of panels and enclosures, stocking on skids/troleys and delivering to Raw Material or Finish Goods stock.

Requirements and Skills: 

  • Must be detail oriented, precise and fast learner
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/drawing.

Education:

  1. Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  2. Electronic devices assemblers that solder might require accreditation or certification

Knowledge:

  1. Three years’ experience of electronic assembly an asset
  2. Knowledge of electronic components and electronic assembly an asset
  3. Familiar with touch screen data entering and scanning.
  4. Familiar with ISO and IPC standards an asset

Skills & Abilities:

  1. Ability to work cohesively with employees and managers as part of a team
  2. Good interpersonal and communication (verbal & written English) skills
  3. Ability to focus attention on details and a high level of accuracy skills
  4. Reliable
  5. Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  6. Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
  7. Ability/willingness to learn on the job new skills through training

Physical Effort:

Lifting

  • 50lbs plus – occasional (up to 30%), where over 50lbs lifting must be done by two people.
  • 20 to 50lbs – frequently (10% to 100%)
  • 1 to 20lbs – most frequently (50% to 100%)

Walking

  • 100% of the job requires walking.

Standing

  • Up to 100%

Bending/Crouching

  • Up to 50%

Reaching

  • Above shoulder height – up to 50%
  • At shoulder height – up to 100%
  • Below shoulder height – up to 100%

Climbing

  • 20% - there is a second floor mezzanine that requires stair climbing to reach.  Ladders/rolling stairs are also located around the plant and are used to reach overstock locations.

Sitting

  • Up to 80%

Working Conditions:

  • Exposed to heat and cold in the warehouse
  • Exposed to fumes and other odors from operations

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process. 

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Machine Assembler (Custom)
description:
Machine Assembler (Custom)
Location: Mississauga, ON

Our client is looking for skilled Custom Machine Assemblers for brand new machinery, who have experience in customized machine assembly. 
Our client operates a safe, clean facility and considers security and safety their top priority.

The Assembler would be working on various machines designed for the plastic industry. Some travel will be required once the Assembler is quite familiar and comfortable in the role.

Skills: 
 
  • Extensive knowledge of custom equipment and machinery.
  • Some pneumatics experience and plastics industry knowledge is an asset
  • Efficient time-management skills
  • High school diploma/GED required

Responsibilities:
  • Read and interpret blueprints, schematics and detailed drawings for custom designed equipment and machinery. Plastics industry knowledge is an asset. 
  • Assembling parts and fitting sections of production machinery.
  • Align and calibrate machinery and equipment parts as required for efficient and safe operation
  • Dismantle equipment when required for repair or transportation and reassemble it at the appropriate time.
  • Set up of equipment at designated location

Compensation and benefits
  • 100% company paid benefits (after probationary period)
  • 3 paid sick days per calendar year, vacation (2 weeks/3 weeks after 5 years/ 4 weeks after 10 years)
  • RRSP with company match at 2%

Day Shift only:
Monday to Thursday - 6:50am to 3:50pm
Friday - 6:50am to 12:50pm

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: Brampton, Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Toronto, Etobicoke, Vaughan, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Électromécanicien de Production
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

 

À la recherche d'un emploi d’usine stimulant?

Tu souhaites avoir un impact positif sur l'environnement?

Tu désires travailler dans la plus belle usine moderne du Centre-Du-Québec?

Arrête de chercher, vient-en chez nous!

 

Fondée en 1998 à Drummondville, Annexair est un fabricant d’équipements de CVCA (HVAC) qui offre des solutions sur mesure et sert les marchés commerciaux, institutionnels et industriels. L’efficacité énergétique étant au coeur de notre conception, nos systèmes de ventilation grand format comptent de nombreuses technologies de récupération d’énergie. Nous investissons massivement en recherche et développement ce qui nous permet d'avoir les systèmes de ventilation parmi les plus avancés en Amérique du Nord.

 

Avantages d’être dans notre équipe

  • Pas besoin d’un lunch! Cafétéria subventionnée avec option végé
  • Environnement de travail ultra confortable, propre, vitré et usine climatisée
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • 2 semaines de fermeture durant l’été + congés payés à Noël!
  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Prime pour référence d’employés de 500$
  • Congés personnels
  • Vêtements (casquette, chandails et pantalons) sont fournis
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social actif

PRINCIPALES FONCTIONS ET RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Déterminer l’emplacement, fixer et identifier les composantes de contrôle sur le panneau électrique et des pièces électriques;
  • Filer et brancher les composantes à l’intérieur du panneau;
  • Procéder aux vérifications du filage, en effectuant des tests de continuité;
  • Effectuer l’installation mécanique des composantes électriques selon les normes;
  • Effectuer le filage des unités et des sous-assemblages et effectuer les vérifications requises;
  • Effectuer les branchements électriques, puissance et contrôles;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche connexe à la demande du superviseur.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Diplôme d’études professionnelles en électromécanique (DEP) ou autre DEP connexe;
  • Aisance à travailler en hauteur (maximum de 12 pieds);
  • Bonne dextérité manuelle;
  • Capacité à lire et interpréter des plans.

title: Operator/Sub-Assembler
description:
Are you able to work in a fast-paced environment? Would you like to learn how to operate a variety of machines and be cross-trained in different tasks? Do you want to have a career in Manufacturing? Do you have attention to detail, multitasking and the ability to be cross-trained and work with a variety of jobs?

If your response is yes, please keep reading!

About Metalumen

Metalumen is a family-owned company located in Guelph that has been designing, engineering, and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Our products are customized and up to 97% system recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence, on-time delivery, and customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our family. We are constantly improving our processes to provide the best for our employees. We understand that our customers’ satisfaction is the reflection of our employees’ happiness.

About the Position

The Operator/Assembler will report to the Team Lead and is responsible for operating machines- and assembling parts, according to production needs.

Main Duties

  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Read, understand and interpret drawings and blueprints and work according to the prints
  • Follow all routing on job travellers
  • Set up and operate robots, machines, jig
  • Participate in first offs, supporting the Lead Hand and Team Lead to properly establish processes and ensuring time studying is done.
  • Measure and suggest new processes to Sub-Assembly and Painting Department
  • Fasten parts according to the Bill of Material and drawings. Follow the Team Lead’s orientations
  • Load and Unload and operate paint line
  • Maintain the workplace clean and organized
  • Ensure the projects are being delivered on time and with the expected quality
  • Other duties as per Team Lead and Production Manager requirements

Requirements

  • 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Secondary school
  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Understand Diagrams and the use of different hand and measure tools
  • Ability to lift up to 30 pounds
  • Willing to train other employees
  • Willing to work in a team
  • Sense of urgency and ability to work with limited supervision
  • Attention to detail, excellent attendance, multitask, organization, ability to deal with conflict, and math skills

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.

title: Production Specialist
description:
Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visitwww.bimbocanada.com.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Lead weekly inventory counts of raw and packaging material for two facilities.
  • Procurement of indirect supplies for two facilities.
  • Provide vacation support for material supply coordinator.
  • Provide support and coverage for the production analyst.
  • Assisting with weekly payroll admin – Ex: approving OT in Kronos system for two facilities.
  • Support onboarding and associate training on production floor. Be a liaison for new associates within their first few weeks of hire.
  • Support labour and production scheduling – may include calling associates in for OT, responding to associates regarding schedule changes.
  • Assisting Production Supervisors with support administrative tasks and other tasks.
  • Other duties as assigned.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
  • The successful candidate will possess a relevant post-secondary education
  • Ability to communicate and work with all stakeholders and resources in a frequently changing and challenging production environment.
  • Strong analytical skills with a particular focus on attention to detail
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Ability to work effectively with limited supervision in a fast-paced team environment.
  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment is a definite asset
  • Takes initiative, exercises good judgment in day-to-day business decisions.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft applications
  • Some supervisory experience, in an industrial/manufacturing environment
  • Post -secondary education ( college or university) required
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize workloads to meet all deadlines

Bimbo Canada is Canada’s largest bakery, operating for more than 100 years. It is a leading producer and distributor of fresh packaged breads and snacks with more than 1,000 products across 18 brands Canadians know and love, like Dempster’s®, Stonemill®, Villaggio®, Vachon® cakes and Takis®. Bimbo Canada is proud to feed Canadian families with safe, high-quality products they can trust made by Canadians, for Canadians at 16 bakeries, 14 distribution centres and 191 depots across the country. Bimbo Canada is a wholly owned subsidiary of Grupo Bimbo, the world’s largest baking company. Together, they are nourishing a better world with delicious baked goods and snacks by building a sustainable, highly-productive and deeply-humane company. We are dedicated to building a diverse workplace that promotes equity and belonging, where all associates can develop and contribute to the transformation of our company, the baking industry and our communities. For more, visitwww.bimbocanada.com.

Please note that all applicants that will be considered for this role must be double vaccinated for COVID-19. Successful candidates will also be required to provide proof of their vaccination status during the recruitment process.

title: Assembly line worker
description:
Les Laboratoires Vaporus sont présentement à la recherche d’employé(e)s pour leur établissement situé à Ville Saint-Laurent.

Dans un environnement de travail sécuritaire, l’employé(e) effectuera de l’assemblage manuel et de l’emballage léger avec l’équipe de production déjà en place dans notre laboratoire ISO 7. Nous offrons des heures de travail stables, un horaire régulier et de l’autonomie à tous nos employé(e)s.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vaporus Laboratories are currently looking to hire employees for their Ville Saint-Laurent location.

In a safe work environment, the employee will do light assembly and packaging work with an already existing production team in our ISO 7 laboratory. We offer stable work hours, a steady schedule and autonomy to all our employees.

Nous offrons des heures de travail stables, un horaire régulier et de l’autonomie à tous nos employé(e)s.']

title: Manufacturing Assembler
description:
Spirit Edmonton is looking for multiple Temporary Assembly Technicians. This position will assist in the manufacturing of Cathodic Protection Rectifiers and related products.

Responsibilities

  • Assembly of electrical wiring of all rectifier units used for cathodic protection systems and related products

  • Assembly of components on the electrical panels

  • Assembly of all Junction Box Panels

  • Operate fork lift
  • Organization and cleanliness of the shop floor to ensure that a safe working environment is maintained

  • Manufacturing and assembly of various Corrosion Protection products

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing magnesium and zinc anodes. Mixing backfill for anodes in proper proportions. 

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing calcined coke breeze to the desired level

  • Timely assembly of shrink sleeves and related products

  • General warehouse duties including maintaining the condition of the warehouse

  • Picking, shipping & receiving duties as required

  • Proactively follow all Health and Safety rules and legislation while performing job functions

  • Perform general maintenance, repairs and inspections of specific tools and equipment to ensure efficient and safe operation

  • Load & unload trucks

Qualifications

  • High school Diploma or equivalent education

  • 1 yearsâ€™ experience in a manufacturing or warehouse environment

  • Experience operating hand and power tools such as drills, saws and specialized equipment

  • Fork Lift Operator certificate and experience an asset

  • Able to wear a respirator as required

  • Able to lift over 50 lb.

  • Mechanically inclined

Additional Requirements:

  • Able to listen, learn and complete duties efficiently and effectively
  • Able to read, write and communicate effectively in English
  • Able to interact and work effectively as a team
  • Possess a high level of attention to detail
  • Able to regularly stand, bend, lift and move intermittently during shifts

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Essential Functions

  • Efficiently utilize all wiring equipment/tools
  • Trouble shoot electrical problems on machines
  • Electrical/electronic wiring pertaining to the Belcor product line
  • Know the wiring procedures pertaining to the Belcor product line
  • Working knowledge of programmable logic controllers
  • Initiate engineering changes

Additional Responsibilities

  • Other temporary duties which fall within the employee’s capabilities

Principal Accountabilities

  • Plant Safety
  • Quality and Quantity of work
  • Communication both written or verbal
  • Attendance
  • Attitude in working well with co-workers

Required Qualifications

  • Secondary High School diploma
  • 5 years experience as an Electrical Assembler
  • Electrical/electronics course pertaining to PLC’s or panel building.
  • Advanced knowledge/ability to read and interpret wiring schematics
  • Advanced knowledge/ability to read and interpret blueprints/CAD drawings

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Requires regular lifting and moving if items weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • May occasionally require lifting in excess of 50 lbs.
  • Routinely performs repetitive motions
  • Requires sitting for extended periods of time

Experience

Required
  • 5 year(s): Wiring and Diagrams
  • 5 year(s): PLC Assembly
  • 5 year(s): Electrical Assembly

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better

Skills

Required
  • Blueprint Reading
  • Panel Wiring
Preferred
  • Technically Inclined

Behaviors

Required
  • Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
Preferred
  • Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Motivations

Preferred
  • Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
