title: Production Assembly Operator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

We are currently looking to fill Production Assembly Operator positions for our DAY and Afternoon shfit.  

Day Shift 6:00 am - 2:30 pm

Afternoon Shift 3:30 pm - 2:00 am (3:30 pm - Midnight, Fridays)

 

 

Responsibilities:

â€¢ All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, local, provincial and/or federal rules and regulations;
â€¢ Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed;
â€¢ Produces components by following work instructions to assemble parts;
â€¢ Inspects parts visually for obvious defects and component verification;
â€¢ Install lights, harnesses, and/or other components to molded/painted parts as required;
â€¢ Packs finished products in racks, bags, cardboard boxes, dunnage and totes;
â€¢ Label parts ensuring label accuracy;
â€¢ Maintains work area, cleans and replenishes parts as required;
â€¢ Ensures all parts are labeled properly following plant wide colour coding system.

â€¢ Personnel performing work affecting product quality shall be competent on the basis of on-going training, appropriate education, skills and experience;
â€¢ Performs other duties as required by managers to keep pace with changes in scope of work.

Qualifications:

â€¢ Grade 12 education or equivalent experience in a manufacturing environment

â€¢ Good communication (Read and comprehend instructions)
â€¢ Organizational and dexterity skills
â€¢ Attention to detail
â€¢ Knowledge of components and materials used in the production process
â€¢ Ability to read colour
â€¢ Basic Computer skills
â€¢ Working positions change from standing to bending and lifting up to 30lbs.  
â€¢ Exposure to health hazards: dust, forklift noise with racks
â€¢ Exposure to heat in the summer months

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Opérateur de production
description:
Salaire :18,73 $

18,73$ de l’heure + prime de 0,80$ pour les heures effectuées entre 17h00 et 7h00.

Vous aurez également accès à des avantages sociaux concurrentiels !

Horaire :
Les candidats sélectionnés devront être disponible pour travailler à temps plein de JOUR OU de SOIR du lundi au jeudi pour travailler à l’usine de Québec.
Être disponible de jour pour la formation.

Profil recherché :
- Avoir de l’Intérêt pour l’industrie alimentaire;
- Aimer le travail manuel et avoir une bonne forme physique;
- Capacité à travailler en équipe;
- Être minutieux ;
- Désir de vouloir prendre des responsabilités (un atout).

À la production :
· Effectuer plusieurs tâches liées à la confection de produits de boulangerie sur une chaîne de production en continuer.
· Participer au maintien et à l'amélioration constante de la qualité d'un produit.
· Participer à l’entretien des équipements de production ainsi que des bâtiments de l’usine.

Fière d’être membre de Grupo Bimbo depuis mai 2014, Bimbo Canada est un chef de file de la fabrication et de la distribution de collations et de produits de boulangerie délicieux et nutritifs, offrant des marques comme Villaggio ®, POM ®, Bon Matin ®, Vachon ®, Sara Lee ®, Sanissimo ® et Takis ®. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche de manœuvres à la boulangerie pour se joindre à notre équipe de l’usine de Québec.



Pour envoyer votre candidature:
  • Par courriel : cbemploi.quebec@grupobimbo.com
  • En personne : directement à l’usine
Lieu du travail:
Usine de Québec
1185 rue Vincent-Massey
Québec, Québec, G1N 1N2

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Complete electrical assembly as per engineering’s specifications and standards;
  • Proceed with the installation of the manufactured equipment’s control and distribution panels electrical components;
  • Proceed with interconnections between motor sensors and control panels;
  • Detect and communicate corrections to the engineering team;
  • Weld electrical components when required;
  • Actively participate to the equipment star-up and calibration using measuring tools;
  • Participate to weekly production meetings.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  •  College or professional diploma in automated systems electro-mechanic or college certification in troubleshooting and maintenance of industrial systems;
  • 2-3 years’ experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring;
  • Mastering measuring tools such as a multimeter;
  • Able to read and interpret electrical plans;
  • Knowledge of industrial programmable controllers such as Bradley and Siemens;
  • Experience in welding electrical components, an asset
  • French as a working language, English an asset.
  • High quality standards;

    NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

    BENEFITS:

    As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program. 

    Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

    ABOUT PMIC

    Pro Mach Innovation Center, located near Montreal, Quebec, Canada offers a full range of automation services, including industrial robotics, custom line optimization integration equipment, installation, and project management. PMIC is a division of Pro Mach, a leader in providing integrated packaging and processing products and solutions to more than 20,000 customers worldwide. Through a variety of brands, Pro Mach provides packaging equipment and product processing, certified training, installation, parts and service for primary and secondary packaging, flexible packaging, l end-of-line packaging as well as identification and follow-up. For more information on Pro Mach brands, visit http://www.promachbuilt.com/

    Experience

    Preferred
    • 2 - 3 years: experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring

    Skills

    Preferred
    • Blueprint Reading
    See job description

title: Assembly Test Operator
description:
Assembly Test Operator
2102103

Description

 

Job description

Entry-Level Semiconductor Test / Assembly Operator

About us

ON Semiconductor (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power management, analog, sensors, logic, timing, connectivity, discrete, SoC and custom devices. The company's products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical, aerospace and defense applications. ON Semiconductor operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, a robust compliance and ethics program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.

What We Do

  • Provide a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient solutions
  • Help customers solve their unique design challenges
  • Empower design engineers to reduce global energy use
  • Operate a responsive, reliable world-class supply chain and quality program
  • Maintain global environmental sustainability and social responsibility programs

Check out our Youtube Channel to learn more!

https://youtu.be/JvPR57mU7Io

About the Job

ON Semiconductor's Assembly Test Operations site in Burlington, ON, Canada is growing, and we are currently hiring full-time day- and afternoon-shift Operators to join our talented Test Assembly Team. No experience is necessary, we will provide the training on the job.

As an Assembly Test Operator, you will be a necessary member of a team that works on the exciting process that converts batches of blank silicon wafers (called wafer lots) into carriers for completed integrated circuits. At our Burlington site, our Operators work with the completed carriers to test and assemble them in order to get them out and into the world as soon as possible!

We offer flexible shifts, and excellent training. No experience required to be a part of the global effort at ON Semiconductor to create high-tech products that enhance people's lives!

Your day to day as an Operator will consist of the following:

  • Performing specific back-end semiconductor manufacturing functions that are integral to the production of semiconductor devices.
  • Operating various equipment in order to perform the following functions:  material preparation, process set-up, solder printing, component attach, wirebond, encapsulation, dicing, electrical test operation, documentation completion, data entry, process monitoring, and inspections.
  • Performing and supporting device assembly and test operations as assigned
  • Working a shift schedule (8 hour shifts, either during the day or the afternoon), and having the flexibility to change shift assignments from time to time as needed 
  • Executing tasks and assignments in a timely and effective matter
  • Performing in-process inspections, SPC data entry and MES transactions
 

Qualifications

 

You are a great fit if you…

  • Are interested in learning what it's like to work in a highly-controlled, laboratory-like environment, called a clean room.
  • Have no problems wearing a hairnet, safety glasses, facemask (covering nose and mouth), lab coat, and ESD shoes throughout your 8-hour shift.These dressing requirements help protect the highly-sensitive tech products you will be working with!
  • Enjoy doing detailed work in a clean and structured environment, and following established safety and quality procedures.
  • Have a desire to learn and grow in the manufacturing or semiconductor industries!
  • Have the drive and capability to be cross trained (learn more than one job or operation).

The Must Haves:

  • Minimum age of 18
  • Basic math skills
  • Basic computer proficiency, to include data-entry and communication systems that work very similarly to Excel.
  • Ability to demonstrate computer proficiency and receive a passing score on a job-specific computer assessment
  • Dexterity, and the ability to handle and manipulate small parts that are as small as ¼ of a centimeter
  • Ability to follow instructions and complete things correctly the first time
  • Ability to work 8 hour shifts on a rotating schedule (as needed, with notice—see below)
  • Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing
  • Ability to stand for at least 85% of the time during any particular shift.
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 15 lbs.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to work effectively in both a team and independent environment.
  • Organizational skills and the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively to push tasks through to completion.
  • Reliable transportation in order to get to work everyday

 

What Will Put You Ahead:

  • Stable work history
  • Past experience in a similar manufacturing environment
  • Past experience using a microscope in a laboratory-like environment

 

Work Schedule:

  • Our Burlington facility is open Monday-Friday, and requires operators to to be flexible and available to work one of two shifts throughout the week:
    • Day Shift: 7:00am-3:30pm
    • Afternoon Shift: 3:15pm-11:45pm
    • Flexibility to be able to work these hours and change your schedule around per the needs of the site (with notice) is required.

ON Semiconductor offers accommodations during the recruitment process for applicants with disabilities. Should you require accommodation through this process please advise Human Resources. Information received relating to the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

 

Primary Location

: CA-Ontario-Burlington

Work Locations

: 
CAON02 SDT LTD 
970 Fraser Dr 
 Burlington L7L 5P5

Job Posting

: Mar 28, 2022, 11:01:19 PM

title: Custom Machine Builder
description:
Custom Machine Builder
Location: Mississauga, ON


Do you have a background in custom large machine building and are a Certified Engineering Technician/Technologist  OR a Licensed Industrial Mechanic Millwright /Assembler in Ontario OR a Certified Tool and Die Maker?  If you answered yes to one of these, our client wants to talk to you! Come join their ever growing team!

About this Position:
  • Assemble, debug, modify and install custom designed machinery according to the schedule, the company quality standards and to meet or exceed customer expectations
  • Responsible for the integration of purchased mechanical and pneumatic components, manufactured details and sub-assemblies to construct automated machinery for custom applications
  • Perform critical precision alignments and set-ups of mechanical components and systems and take measures to ensure integrity of set-up
  • Responsible for installing pneumatic components and sub-systems as per supplied schematics and specifications, plumbing.
  • Perform machining tasks when required (grinding, milling, lathe etc.)
  • Responsible for testing, pre-commissioning and optimizing system performance and equipment durability concerns, adhering to all applicable codes and standards.
  • Participate in equipment tear down, packaging, rigging and transporting and installation as required
  • Must identify all tools, fasteners, miscellaneous items and equipment required to complete tasks efficiently and work with plant manager to secure all required material in a timely manner.
  • Perform plant related maintenance and maintenance on plant equipment as required.
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Experience:
  • 10+ years experience in custom machine building field (preferably wire & cable industry), experience in high speed lean manufacturing environment is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in building equipment utilizing the following technologies: robotic systems, high speed index transfer (dial, indexing chain, walking beam etc..), pneumatic actuators, servo motors and actuators
  • Familiarity with modern electrical controls technologies as they apply to automated equipment (e.g. PLC’s, HMI’s, safety devices, and instrumentation)

Desired Skills:
  • Read and interpret AutoCAD (2D) and SolidWorks (3D) drawings and understand tolerances & critical dimensions.
  • Perform dimensional & quality inspections using measuring devices (micrometers, Vernier’s, measuring tapes, etc.).

Ability to use the following machine shop equipment safely and efficiently to complete tasks;
      •  
  • milling machine, lathe, surface grinder etc. (CNC milling, sink or wire EDM experience would be an asset)
  • Ability to weld common metals (MIG/TIG) encountered in machine building is an asset
  • Understanding of basic machinery rigging principles and the ability to operate rigging equipment including, cranes and forklifts etc.   AND
      •  
  • Good working knowledge of pneumatic/hydraulic control circuits
  • Good working knowledge of bearing installation and press fits.


Must Haves:
Ability to work overtime as required and travel worldwide on short notice (valid and current Canadian passport is required) is a must
Experience with machine start-up and commissioning activities.
Valid Ontario Driver’s License and access to insured vehicle for travel within the G.T.A. and surrounding areas is a must

Excellent compensation and benefits will be offered and will be based on experience

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: hydraulics, assemblies, industrial automation, electromechanical engineering, Brampton, Toronto, North York, Vaughan, Woodbridge, Etobicoke, Halton, Caledon, Bolton, ON, Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder

title: Assembly Technician / Assembler
description:
Description:
Full-time role with one of the biggest manufacturing company in the world. Apply now with Agilus Work Solutions!
Agilus is recruiting for multiple Assembly Technician/Assemblers in the Manufacturing Sector in Mississauga, Ontario.
This is a Full-time permanent role in a ever growing manufacturing company. The assemblers/technicians will be working on the production line to craft, finish and inspect the product.
A day in the life:
  • Prepare, block, edge and assemble product according to job specifications
  • Assist in the basic operation, cleaning and ongoing maintenance of laboratory tools and equipment by in accordance with to established maintenance procedures and calendars

You bring:
  • Minimum 1-year experience of mechanical, electrical or computer/cellphone assembly experience in the industrial or manufacturing sector
  • Ability to read and understand machine schematics is a bonus
  • Experience working in a production/assembly line is highly preferred

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive salary with $18/hour rate
  • Bus accessible location and free parking provided

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email jvirtucio@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Production Technician
description:
PRODUCTION TECHNICIAN – MAPLE LEAF FOODS

Maple Leaf Foods at 100 McLeod Avenue, in Saskatoon, is a boutique sausage facility. As a team we create great tasting quality products and are looking for more great people like YOU!

We are currently accepting applications for our Production Technician position that offers a variety of flexible shifts:

Start dates: ASAP
Shift times: 5:30AM – 2:00PM
6:00AM – 2:30PM
2:00PM-10:30PM
2:30PM-11:00PM
5:15PM-1:45AM
*Shift start times may vary based on production needs*
How to apply: Email resumes to McLeodApplications@mapleleaf.com


Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.

Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Main Duties
Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE (steel toe-rubber boots, hard hats, hair nets, gloves, safety glasses, face coverings etc.)and comply with safety requirements
  • Pushing, pulling and overhead reaching, bending andprolonged standing
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
  • Check and weigh materials and products
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products
  • Assist machine operators, assemblers and other workers
  • Clean work areas and equipment
  • Perform other general labour tasks

What We Offer
  • Development, growth, and career opportunities available
  • Earn up to $16.15/hour as a Production Technician
  • Earn up to $20.60/hour as you grow with us
  • $1.00/hour shift premium for time worked between 6 pm – 6 am
  • Competitive benefits offered
  • Company pension plan
  • Bi-weekly pay
  • Regular wage increases as per CBA
  • Opportunity for over-time
  • Employee Staff Sales Program
  • Employee Referral Program

RequiredSkills and Abilities
  • Understand, read and write numbers and text
  • Oral/verbal communication
  • Working with others
  • Manual dexterity
  • Attention to detail
  • Perform repetitive tasks
  • Hand-eye co-ordination
  • Standing for extended periods
  • Lifting heavy materials
    • Up to 23 kg (50 lbs)

Work Setting
  • High volume packaging company
  • Fast-paced environment
  • Loud machine noises (PPE provided for hearing protection)
  • Cool environment, refrigeration-level temperature (1-5 Degrees Celsius)

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: Monteur - Assembleur
description:
Poste permanent

Horaire de jour
Lundi au jeudi 7h30 à 17h00 et vendredi 7h30 à 11h30

Salaire de 21,11$/h après 2 ans 24.00$/h

Assurance collective après 3 mois

Vous aimez le travail manuel ? Vous voulez travailler dans une nouvelle entreprise de Drummondville, avec une superbe ambiance de travail ? Ce travail est pour vous alors !

Advantages
Voici les avantages pour le poste de monteur - assembleur à Drummondville;
Horaire de jour;
Salaire compétitif;
Belle ambiance de travail;
Assurance après 3 mois;
Entré en poste rapide.

Responsibilities
Voici les tâches pour le poste de monteur-assembleur:
Effectuer l’assemblage des structures d’aluminium;

Installer les moulures, les joints d’étanchéités et la quincaillerie;
Procéder à des inspections et des contrôles qualités;
Compléter les produits selon les spécifications demandées;
Effectuer la coupe de moulures, de cornières et de renforts;

Summary
Voici les façons pour communiquer avec nous :
Eric et Lydia
Téléphone au 819-473-7484

Facebook à Randstad Drummondville- Secteur industriel

Nos services sont gratuits et nous avons plusieurs opportunités d’emploi à Drummondville et dans la région. Donc, si vous êtes à la recherche d’un nouvel emploi envoyez-nous votre candidature ou contactez-nous. Il nous fera plaisir de discuter avec vous des diverses opportunités que nous avons à vous offrir.

De plus, si vous connaissez des gens qui sont à la recherche d’emploi, nous offrons une prime de référencement de 250$, et ce, à partir du moment où la personne a travaillé plus de 3 semaines consécutives suite à son embauche par Randstad. Il faut simplement mentionner le nom de la personne référant lors de l’appel ou de l’entrevue.

title: Mechanical Assembler (6 Month Contract) AFTERNOON SHIFT
description:
Company Description

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

Our drive and control technologies ensure efficient, powerful and safe movement in machines and systems of any size. We inspire our customers with intelligent components, tailored system solutions, and services – from fully connected applications to the factory of the future. Bosch Rexroth Canada is dedicated to making the world a better place through innovation and technology. We are looking for associates who will take on our customers’ challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found and who will thrive in a face-paced, collaborative and exciting environment.

Why work with Bosch Rexroth Canada?

  • Challenging Projects: We are driven by innovation and being at the cutting edge of everything that we do. At Bosch Rexroth every day is different and your time will be filled with interesting and exciting projects.
  • Amazing Colleagues: Our people make us who we are, and we are very proud of our diverse and skilled global team. Having a supportive and encouraging team around you can make all the difference.
  • Learning and Development: We want you to reach your fullest potential, for both yourself and for Bosch Rexroth. That’s why we actively promote growth and development.
  • Change the World: We want to give you the opportunity to not only drive your career forward but also to change the world. The work we do at Bosch Rexroth can make a big difference to the world around you.
  • Social & Value-Driven: We have a tradition of assuming social responsibility in all that we do. Our success, and our roadmap for the  future, is based on our lived values. This covers everything, from community to the environment, to being a social employer.
  • Flexibility & Freedom: We strive to give you a balance between your work and home life, as well as the freedom to drive your career forward.
  • International Opportunities: We are a truly global, fully networked company, with locations in more than 80 countries all over the world.

Join us and help set the world in motion!

Job Description

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

As the Mechanical Assembler/Tester, you will be responsible for:

  • Assembling and Test Of Compu-Spread product line.
    • Assembly Drawing(s)
    • Hydraulic Schematic
    • Bills of Material
    • Production Quality Instructions (PQI)
  • Testing Compu-Spread products to ensure proper function, pressure regulation, and absence of exterior leakage.
  • Recognizing and addressing any incorrect function of the Compu-Spread Units or its components.
  • Maintaining tools and equipment through preventative maintenance activities.
  • Recommending and implementing value added changes to processes.
  • Cross-training on other functions within the team.
  • Maintaining a clean and safe work environment with daily cleaning (5S) activities.
  • Overtime in this position will be required, sometimes with little advanced notice.
  • Performing other essential and related peripheral duties as assigned by Team Leader and Group Leader.
Qualifications

  • High school graduate or equivalent is required
  • 2 years of experience in assembly in a related production field.
  • General knowledge of hydraulic components, including mounting and operation.
  • High mechanical aptitude to use and operate hand and air tools, overhead crane.
  • Ability to read and interpret assembly drawings and schematics.
  • Demonstrated good organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Good communication skills with regards to verbal, written and basic personal computer skills.
  • Able to lift and move 50 lbs. on a regular basis.
  • Education in Fluid Power Technician/Vocational School, and/or Hydraulic Specialist/Technologist considered an asset.


Additional Information

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce and are an equal opportunity employer. Bosch Rexroth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
*Please note that this position is based in St-Hubert, Montréal (Québec, Canada), therefore the job posting is written in French.

Tu aimes voir un projet grandir grâce à ton travail et à tes efforts? Tu es passé maître dans l’assemblage de machines, la manipulation d’outils et la lecture de plans? Voici l’offre que tu attendais!

Ta future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Interpréter différents plans et instructions d’assemblage mécanique
  • Réaliser des assemblages et ajustements mécaniques sur des machines
  • Utiliser les outils usuels d’assemblage et d’ajustement mécanique
  • Exécuter des tâches reliées à l’intégration et au chargement des équipements fabriqués
  • Travailler de façon sécuritaire
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes – meuler, percer, couper et poinçonner

Compétences requises

  • Maîtrise en lecture de plan
  • Formation en montage-soudage ou en mécanique – ou toute autre formation reliée à l’assemblage mécanique
  • Esprit d’équipe
  • Débrouillardise
  • Bonnes habiletés communicationnelles

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • À la fine pointe de la technologie, nos usines sont pensées pour faciliter la collaboration et prioriser la santé, ainsi que la sécurité de nos équipiers. Travailler chez Premier Tech, c’est avoir la possibilité de toujours apprendre, d’améliorer ses compétences et de se spécialiser.
  • Tu évolueras dans un milieu multiculturel qui favorise pleinement le partage d’expériences et de connaissances.

Informations supplémentaires 

  • Rémunération globale avantageuse
  • Prime de soir et de nuit
  • Usines à la fine pointe de la technologie
  • Assurances collectives et REER disponibles
  • Horaires de jour, de soir et de nuit

Ces mots te parlent?

mécanique, assemblage, travail d’équipe, polyvalence, production, manufacturier

Envie d’en savoir plus? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Production Technician
description:
About the Company:

Auxly Ottawa aims to connect with those actively in the cannabis category that have an appreciation for the positive impact that art, culture, and design have on humanity. Kolab Project cannabis products, available at licensed cannabis retailers across Canada, include premium pre-rolls, vapes, soft chews and chocolate. Learn more at kolabproject.com and stay up-to-date at Twitter: @kolabproject; Instagram: @kolabproject; Facebook: @kolabproject.

Overview:

Reporting to the Production Team Lead, the Production Technician will be responsible for assisting in all post-production activities, including milling, sifting, pre-roll production, packaging, labelling, sampling, order fulfillment and facility sanitation.

What can you expect to do:
  • Strictly adhere to the companyâ€™s Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s).
  • Perform all pre-roll manufacturing processes.
  • Perform packaging runs.
  • Participate in order fulfillment activities.
  • Perform batch sampling for external testing.
  • Assist the cultivation team in ensuring the Companyâ€™s facility remains organized and kept in a sanitary condition.
  • Participate in harvest activities.
  • Complete all documentation related to production and sanitation activities.
  • Other related duties as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Post-Secondary education an asset.
  • Capable of multi-tasking with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • 1 year experience in a manufacturing enviornment or similar, an asset
What will set you apart:
  • Familiarity with the Cannabis Act and Cannabis Regulations.
  • Horticulture experience is an asset.
  • Experience in a regulated and highly compliant environment is desired (ie. food industry, pharmaceutical).

What's in it for you

  • Amazing and valuable experience in a brand new industry and company!
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Guaranteed full time hours, permanent position, stability
  • Excellent opportunities for growth and career development

title: Mechanical Assembler - Day Shift
description:
Eaton is currently seeking a Mechanical Assembler - Day Shift to join our team. This position is based at our Milton, Ontario location.

Position Overview:

Eaton’s Milton Plant has an immediate opening for a Mechanical Assembler on our day shift. Reporting to the Production Supervisor, this position interprets the manufacturing information documents in order to mechanically assemble, fit and install prefabricated parts or modify basic components, sub-assemblies and structures using hand and power tools for the site's product lines.

In this function you will:

  • Assemble components ensuring proper torque of bus and phase connectors.
  • Read and interpret drawings while ensuring assembly bill of material accuracy.
  • Check parts picked/delivered to parts required. Resolve discrepancies, if any, with supervisor.
  • Escalate drawing concerns via appropriate channel.
  • Repair and modify any errors detected by test/inspection.
  • Work to CSA and UL code.
  • Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the internal KANBAN process.
  • Apply consistency in assembly method for units on the same order.
  • Responsible for visual inspections of material before and after assembly by conducting inspection for conformance to drawings and specifications, functional operation and appearance and making mechanical adjustments as needed.
  • Clean unit and prepare for testing process.
  • Check performance of completed components to ensure compliance to quality standards and make necessary adjustments when required in order to meet quality goals.
  • Perform pack and ship duties.
  • Use various fixtures, gauges and assembly tools to assemble, adjust or repair product.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment or six months of assembly experience.
  • Completed High School Diploma or equivalency.
  • No relocation is offered for this position. All candidates must currently reside within 80 KM of Milton, ON to be considered.
  • Must be legally eligible to work in Canada without company sponsorship now and in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in assembly or repair of products.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings and schematics.
  • Knowledge of Lean manufacturing processes and Six Sigma Tools.

Position Criteria:

  • Working knowledge of mechanical, electrical and safety procedures of a manufacturing facility.
  • Demonstrated experience of utilizing mechanical tools and measuring equipment required for assembly.
  • Good communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Proficiency in problem-solving, mathematical skills, computer and troubleshooting ability.

Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.

Accessibility information may be found at:

http://www.eatoncanada.ca/EatonCA/OurCompany/Accessibility/index.htm/

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Agent(e) de réservation
description:
Dans le cadre de son plan développement en Amérique du Nord, le groupe Huttopia recherche un/une Agent(e) de réservation qui sera basé à Montréal.

Le groupe Huttopia, chef de file dans l’industrie du glamping et de l’écotourisme, conçoit, construit et exploite des sites dans des espaces naturels uniques. Fondé il y a 20 ans en France, Huttopia s’est implanté en Amérique du Nord en 2007. L’entreprise exploite aujourd’hui 80 sites dans 6 pays sur 3 continents. Inscrit dans un marché en pleine croissance, Huttopia a basé son développement sur un fort esprit entrepreneurial, l’innovation et la préservation de la nature.

Tâches et responsabilité:
  •  Répondre au téléphone et aux courriels.
  • Assurer la prise des réservations des séjours dans le logiciel de réservation.
  • Conseiller la clientèle sur les différents produits et destinations.
  • Optimiser les ventes.
  • Toutes tâches connexes.

Profil:
  • Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et d'écoute.
  • La connaissance du français et de l'anglais est requise (écrit et oral).

Conditions de travail:
  • Emploi temporaire (jusqu'à octobre 2022).
  • Temps plein, disponibilité la fin de semaine.
  • Date de début: Aussitôt que possible.

Comment nous soumettre votre candidature? 
Si cette offre d’emploi vous intéresse, veuillez nous envoyer votre CV via cet offre d’emploi ou directement à recrutementhna@huttopia.com en précisant le poste et le lieu souhaité. 
 
Nous vous remercions pour votre intérêt envers notre entreprise. Cependant, prenez note que seuls les candidats retenus pour une entrevue seront contactés. 

L’usage du masculin inclut le féminin et est uniquement utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte.

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Assembly Technician (Richmond)
At Dynamix Agitators, we specialize in engineering and manufacturing agitators and mixers for industrial process markets worldwide. Our customers include some of the world's leading energy and natural resource companies, as well as some of the largest chemical manufacturing companies. Due to continual growth, we are in need of a dynamic and outgoing individual to join our Production Team in the role of an Assembly Technician.

About the job:
  • Hands-on assembly of mixers, comprising electric motors, shafts, and other components while using basic tools and machinery.
  • Attention to detail in following Quality Control measures related to the assembly of components is essential.
  • Our facilities are organized and clean, and the staff is supportive.
  • The office hours are 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm Monday - Friday with 1 hour for a lunch break.
About you:
  • A good mechanical aptitude.
  • You have strong attention to detail relating to hands-on assembly processes.
  • A good understanding of basic quality control requirements.
  • Able to continually produce a quality assembly.
  • Experience in a fast-paced manufacturing or assembly-related environment.
  • Physically fit and able to handle some minor lifting while assembling components.
  • Committed to working safely at all times.
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Reliable team player with good customer service abilities.
Nice To Have:
  • Shipping/Receiving experience.
  • Forklift operator certificate.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office.

We recognize that our employees are the cornerstone of our accomplishments and we pride ourselves on being people of passion and integrity. We've created a collaborative work environment with growth opportunities. While high-quality standards are our priority, we do recognize the importance of a healthy work/life balance. Dynamix Agitators offers attractive compensation and benefits, on-the-job training, and a welcoming work environment. If this sounds like you and you match most of our requirements, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and cover letter explaining why you want to join our team.

Note: Office is not easily accessible by Transit.

To read more about us please visitwww.dynamixinc.com.

title: Production Assembler/Technician (Full time)
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

**Competitive Hourly Pay** Full time and contingent positions available

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Mechanical / Electrical Assembly Technician
description:
You've been searching for an opportunity, where you're guaranteed a few key things: on-the-job training, room for advancement, and stability.
Look no further, because with Cask Global Canning Solutions, you can have all that and more.

Since 1999, we've been providing innovative and affordable canning systems to the world's small and medium-sized creators of craft beer, cider, wine, cold brewed coffee, kombucha and other life-enhancing beverages. Cask has installed 1,800 canning systems in 70 countries across the world. 

Watch the "Meet Production" video to see what joining the team as an Assembly Technician is like at Cask (5min).

Assembly Technician
As our new Assembly Technician, your primary objective is to build high quality canning machines for our Customers.  
You'll be part of a dynamic team assembling our core line of machines from the ground up, following engineering specifications. Working closely with other team members to ensure timely completion of builds and surpassing our Customer's expectations, your ability to work hard and push the pace will be perfect for our fast-paced environment.

You'll start your day grabbing the parts you need from our inventory department, you'll assemble your parts into sub-assemblies, and start building our machines. You'll end each project with quality testing and process the order for shipping.
You're a handy person, so you'll be able to identify different bolts, work with various hand tools and lift heavy materials, working on about 1-3 machines a week.

You understand that wherever there is a problem, there is a solution and you are constantly finding new ways to resolve them. This could mean assisting our service team in trouble shooting, assisting inventory control personnel with stock counts or lending a hand in shipping.
On a practical level you will:

  • Assemble machines to engineering specifications within specified tolerances.
  • Operate basic hand tools including, but not limited to, wrenches, drills and screwdrivers.
  • Basic fabrication including, but not limited to, drilling and tapping holes and modifying stainless steel components.
  • Basic control panel wiring / terminations.
  • Troubleshoot operating issues during setup and testing.
  • Maintain a clean and safe working area.

Working at Cask Global Canning Solutions 
This is a full-time, permanent role with a competitive salary of $52,000/year. We also offer a comprehensive group benefits package (health, dental, vision, etc.), and vacation. You'll work Monday to Friday, 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. Pension program (2% match by Cask) and optional RRSP and TFSA (unmatched) options as well.

You‘ll be joining a team that is dedicated to getting the job done well - we believe “good enough,” is not enough. We are a committed group that loves the work we do and the people we work with. We value and invest in your professional development and offer significant opportunities to learn new skills and grow with the company.

Qualifications

  • Experience in a production / mechanical assembly environment.
  • Ability to read and follow engineering assembly drawing combined with basic math skills and ability to correctly read a measuring tape (both metric and imperial scales).
  • Ability to safely lift 50 lbs or more.
  • Mechanical experience, especially with respect to assembly.
  • Electrical background an asset.
  • Forklift experience / license an asset.
  • First Aid training and safety system experience an asset.

What makes you a great fit for the role?

Team culture is paramount for you – Check out Cask Core Values (3min). You're someone who loves to help create things, solve problems, is energized by interacting with people from all different walks of life and liberally applies a healthy sense of humour to have fun while doing so. You are resourceful and adapt quickly.

If this is a career opportunity that fires you up we want to have a conversation. Apply now and let's chat.

title: TECHNICIEN DE PRODUCTION
description:
Description de l'entreprise

EACOM EN BREF

Chez EACOM, nous transformons bien plus que du bois. Notre équipe talentueuse compte plus de 1 100 employés déterminés à travailler, construire et grandir ensemble. Enracinées dans les collectivités du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec, nos scieries ont une longue et riche histoire. Nous gérons et transformons les ressources forestières de manière responsable pour obtenir des produits de bois de grande qualité. Des forêts canadiennes jusqu’au marché de la construction nord-américain, nous visons le développement durable, la collaboration, la sécurité et l’amélioration continue. 

Description du poste

Tu dois en voir plusieurs des postes de technicien de production, mais l’être chez EACOM Ear Falls, une filiale d'INTERFOR, c’est avoir les deux mains dans le plus grand que nature. Tu vas manipuler du bois, pis encore du bois. Tes yeux à l’affût de tout ce qui se passe vont permettre de garder la cour et l’usine propres et à l’ordre. On se fie sur toi pour que tout soit à sa place et que ça roule à planche. Tu vas vivre d’un travail de chez nous, dans nos scieries enracinées dans les régions du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec. Tu vas découvrir qu’elles transforment bien plus que du bois, elles améliorent nos communautés !

Tu es travaillant, tu es dégourdi et tu passes à l’action de façon efficace ? Viens voir chez EACOM, on va se fendre en quatre pour que ça marche.  L’équipe t’attend.

Ce que tu vas faire concrètement :

  • Attacher les paquets de bois brut pour le séchage à l’extérieur;
  • Refaire et empiler les paquets de bois brut et de bois plané, dans la cour;
  • Effectuer le nettoyage de la cour et de l’usine;
  • Effectuer le ménage au sciage intérieur et extérieur;
  • Nettoyer pendant les arrêts de travail les endroits inaccessibles en cours d’opération;
  • Compléter d’autres tâches connexes (ça, ça fait souvent peur, mais tu vas apprendre plein de nouvelles choses qui te serviront).

Qu’as-tu besoin pour bien réussir chez nous ?

  • Bien vivre le travail d’équipe;
  • Être autonome et plein d’initiatives;
  • Faire preuve de vigilance et de souci pour la santé/sécurité.
Qualifications

Ton passé te donnera un coup de main :

  • D.E.S., D.E.P. ou équivalent;
  • Avoir travailler en usine est un atout;
  • Être disponible pour travailler sur des quarts de travail de jour et/ou de nuit.


Informations complémentaires

Chez EACOM, on est là pour toi.

EACOM supporte l’équité en matière d’emploi, la diversité est la bienvenue chez nous, en fait, on l’encourage !  Nous te contacterons si tu es sélectionné pour une entrevue et si tu as besoin d’accommodations particulières, laisse-le nous savoir. Toute information que tu nous envoies sera traitée avec respect et en toute confidentialité. Nos postes sont écrits au masculin pour répondre aux algorithmes de référencement, mais sache que tu es aussi LA BIENVENUE !

title: Part Assembler
description:
Job Responsibilities/Requirements:
  • Part assembly, using hand, air, and power tools, and assembly fixtures. 
  • Attention to details, measuring, fast-paced environment, and striving for quality. 
  • Must have own transportation, no transit service available. 
  • The ability to work on components for OEM's around the world with Agricultural, motorcycles, snowmobiles, rail trains transit buses and medical equipment.
  • Working with a team with opportunity to advance within the company.

Benefits:
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Dental care.
  • RRSP Plan

Job Type: Full-time.
Work Remotely: No. 




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Production Technician - 3 month contract
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: MONTEUR / ASSEMBLEUR
description:
Fondée en 1986 et située à Sainte-Agathe-des-Monts, l'entreprise Les Bâtiments BUT Ltée est spécialisée dans la conception et la fabrication de Bâtiments Usinés Transportables et matériaux composites. Elle se démarque en étant la seule entreprise au Québec à produire des bâtiments en fibre de verre. Ses clients sont principalement des entreprises privées de renom et gouvernemental en communication, surveillance aérienne et météo. 

MONTEUR / ASSEMBLEUR 

Le monteur/assembleur effectue les travaux de montage et d’assemblage des différentes composantes dont est composé un abri préfabriqué.  

Tâches et responsabilités :

  • S’assure de procédé à la fabrication en fonction les plans et devis 
  • Tient compte des spécifications et des pratiques établies
  • Effectue le montage des structures et des revêtements
  • Prépare les bâtiments à recevoir l’isolation (Uréthane giclé) 
  • Procède à l’assemblage des différent composent de l’abri 
  • Effectue les travaux de finition intérieur (murs, plafond, plancher) 
  • Travaille avec un minimum de supervision 

Qualifications requises : 

  • Bonne condition physique (capacité à travailler debout pendant plusieurs heures, monter dans des échelles, soulever des charges, etc.)
  • Habileté à travailler dans un environnement manufacturier
  • Communiquer efficacement en français

Atouts 

  • DEP en installation de structure de bâtiments 
  • Expérience en construction et rénovation général (hors décret) 
  • Expérience avec la fabrication de bâtiments préfabriqué 

Profil recherché

  • Minutie
  • Assiduité/ponctualité
  • Capacité à travailler seul et/ou en équipe

Conditions de travail offertes

  • 40 heures/semaine, du lundi au vendredi de 7h à 15h30
  • Salaire à partir de 19$/h, à discuter selon expérience. Révision après période de probation (3 mois). 
  • Vacances : 2 semaines durant la saison estivale (selon le décret de la construction) 

Et 2 jours de maladie par année

  • Assurances (maladie, longue durée, vie)
  • REER : l’employeur égalise la contribution de l’employé à 20,00$/semaine

Jusqu’à concurrence de 1, 040,00$ par année  

  • Matériel fourni (outils, gants, lunette de protection, etc.)

title: Assembler II
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

Under general supervision, perform mechanical assembly of moderate complexity in accordance with established procedures.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)

  • Know and understand Weatherford's Enterprise Excellence Process and the Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Assemble and test completions equipment per engineered drawings or as instructed by others.  
  • Uses hand tools, power tools, and measuring devices such as tapes, gauges, calipers, micrometer  
  • Inspect completed components for accuracy and functionality.  
  • Perform hydrostatic test on components as necessary.
  • Material handling  
  • Properly maintain company supplied tooling and maintain an orderly work area  
  • Aid in developing of new procedures and improving existing procedures.
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.
Experience:
  • Factory or oil & gas experience an asset
  • Good verbal communication skills.  
  • Basic computer skills  
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos in English.  
  • Ability to read assembly layouts and manufacturing prints.  
  • Ability to read a measuring tape, micrometer and calipers.  
  • Ability to safely operate material handling devices (overhead cranes, forklifts).  
  • Ability to perform all job duties of an Assembler  
  • General knowledge of assembly procedures.  
  • Ability to be an effective team member
  • Quick learner/self motiviated

title: Production Technician
description:
Production TechnicianTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.Based in Quebec City and reporting to the production supervisor, the production technician supports the business unit in achieving the production objectives set by adhering to systems and processes. The business unit produces chemical product analyzers that target different markets.
Your responsibilities

  • Perform the optical, mechanical and electronic assembly of our analyzers.
  • Perform quality control of these same analyzers.
  • Conduct the final tests making sure to meet the quality standard.
  • Comply with the processes in place.
  • Troubleshoot problems encountered during assembly and testing.
  • Be consistent with ABB's core values of safety and integrity, that is, take responsibility for your own actions while taking care of your colleagues and the company.

Your background
  • College diploma (DEC) in physics, electronics or an appropriate field
  • High school diploma coupled with relevant experience will also be considered
  • Strong learning and analytical skills
  • High level of autonomy, responsibility and versatility
  • Strong concern for high quality and efficiency

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Assembleur mécanique
description:
Le titulaire du poste est responsable d’assembler toutes les composantes qui constituent l’unité de ventilation.

Responsabilités :
  • Assemble les pièces nécessaires à la construction des unités de ventilation à l’aide des plans mécaniques ou d’instructions verbales;
  • Installe toutes les composantes montées en sous-assemblage qui proviennent de d’autres secteurs et fait les ajustements si nécessaire;
  • Démonte, modifie, répare et remonte les panneaux lorsque nécessaire;
  • Analyse et assure un suivi de dossiers de production;
  • Garde ses outils et son environnement de travail propres et fonctionnels (respect du 5S) ;
  • Respecte les normes et les règles de sécurité ainsi que les normes de qualité ;
  • Contribue à l’amélioration des processus et procédures de travail.


Profil

Exigences :
  • Détenir un diplôme d’études secondaires (DES) ou l’équivalent;
  • Détenir de lexpérience en manipulation de petits outils ainsi que d’outils mécaniques courants;
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes physiques puisque lemploi requiert un travail physique en position debout;
  • Avoir une connaissance du système de mesures impériales.

Qualifications privilégiées :
  • Détenir de lexpérience en lecture de plans et de documents sera considéré un atout ;
  • Avoir une connaissance du métal en feuille sera considéré un atout.


Informations contractuelles

Conditions de travail :
  • Poste permanent syndiqué ;
  • Travail de jour de lundi au vendredi, 40 heures par semaine (heures travaillées 39h et payées 40h);
  • Assurance collective, REER et autres avantages sociaux ;
  • Salaire commence à 23.27$/h;
  • Possibilité davancement.



Qualifications et exigences: Rapidité d'exécution; Dextérité manuelle; Sens de l'observation; Endurance physique (travail debout et penché); Années d'expérience reliées à l'emploi : un atout.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Production Assembler
About Us:

Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG), Inc. established in 2004, is a leading manufacturer of customer-specific components and assemblies for transportation and general industrial applications. In 2017, First Light Safety Products was created as a division of SMG. On a mission to prevent stop arm violations, school bus related accidents and fatalities, First Light Safety Products design and manufactures innovative patent-pending illumination technology for the school bus industry. Both organizations share a 30,000 sq ft, state of the art manufacturing facility.

Summary:
Reporting to the Production Manager, the Production Assembler will be responsible for producing and assembling products on the production line that aid in the safety of children. The successful candidate will have strong attention to detail, has a “can-do” attitude and works well in a team environment.

Detailed Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Mechanical assembly of sub-assemblies and final products
  • Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and specifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:
  • Ability to work unsupervised in a fast-paced environment
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Electronics assembly background is an asset
  • Work well under pressure and under tight timelines
  • Experience with fabrication using basic hand tools, power tools, and machinery
  • Knowledge of production documentation and mechanical and electrical assemblies
  • An energetic, diligent work ethic and able to work with little supervision

Share with us your talent, drive, and entrepreneurial spirit and we will provide a creative and supportive environment, where valuable contributions are rewarded and celebrated with professional growth, job satisfaction, and an attractive total compensation program. We offer a benefits package to our employees including:
  • Group Insurance Plan
  • Paid Vacations

WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK ALL APPLICANTS WHO APPLY, HOWEVER, ONLY THOSE SELECTED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED.




    About Smartrend Manufacturing Group:

    Established in 2004, Smartrend Manufacturing Group (SMG) is a supply chain company specializing in customer- specific engineered components and assemblies for OEMs and industrial producers. We bring value to our customers with efficiently designed and manufactured parts, made to their specifications, and delivered on their schedule. We focus on collaborative efforts with our customers to provide the lowest total cost of acquisition. We operate in three countries with 30 direct team members.

title: Manufacturing Intern
description:
Alexandria Moulding is currently seeking Summer Students to join our team.
We have positions available in our manufacturing and distribution centers.

Qualifications:
  • Successful candidates will be assigned to one of these area’s based on available opportunities at the time of hire.
  • Candidates must be full-time students and enrolled in high-school (grade 11 or 12) or a Post-Secondary Institution for 2022.
Job Details:
  • All assignments require adherence to specific procedures and work practices related to manufacturing.
  • Work is scheduled on 8- or 12-hour shift (day, afternoon, night, weekend shifts) to provide relief to the regular employees during summer vacation period.
 General Responsibilities Include:
  • Ensure safety standards are met by following Alexandria Moulding safe work and lockout procedures.
  • Maintain high standards of cleanliness in your work area and throughout the facility.
  • Train and develop skills in various areas of the facility.
  • Willing to work in an environment with varying temperatures and conditions.
  • Develop strong working relationships with your peers and manufacturing and distribution teams.
  • Work assigned requires problem solving skills and capability to perform the physical aspects of the role (lifting, bending, standing, pushing/pulling etc.)
  • Housekeeping.
The Candidate:
  • Ability to work in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Available to work various shifts.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze and troubleshoot.
  • Positive attitude and a self-starter.
  • Able to work in an environment that may include exposure to weather, dust, moving mechanical parts, and noise.

title: Mold Assembler - Repairs
description:
If youâ€™re looking to build a career with a successful, growing organization where youâ€™ll be invested in; a leader in the injection mold industry that creates products you touch on a daily basis; a team of passionate people, some with 20, 30 and 40 years of service, who want to see you succeedâ€¦then look at StackTeck Systems Ltd. 

The position of Mold Assembler is responsible for the assembly/disassembly of injection molds and components within the molds, to repair and test based on customer requirements.  This position will report into the Supervisor, Repair Department at the Teck Center.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Disassemble and clean molds to evaluate repairs necessary
  • Troubleshoot components and document needed repairs
  • Utilize a variety of measuring instruments such as micrometers, calipers, etc.
  • Works to close tolerances on all assigned work projects
  • Use various hand/power tools to complete assembly/disassembly functions
  • Read, interpret and follow basic diagrams, or engineering drawings, and other written instructions or procedures to accurately assemble component
  • Performs general housekeeping duties of work area and shop floor.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL SKILLS / EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education in a Mechanical discipline, but not necessary
  • 2-3 years of mechanical assembly experience is required
  • Ability to use measuring instruments
  • Knowledge of Plastic Injection Molds preferred

CORE COMPETENCIES

  • Decision Making: Utilizing effective process to make decisions on own.
  • Teamwork: Working effectively with others
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem solving aptitude
  • Attention to detail: Making sure things are done right the first time
  • Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to people.
  • Self Motivated: Ability to work alone with minimal supervision and/or direction

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

We thank all who apply and will respond to those who most closely match the requirements.

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #4252

Wednesday, February 23, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, group pension, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints
Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly
