title: Assembly Leadhand
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth, we are currently seeking an Assembly Leadhand for our Regina location.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Help with the set up and improvements of the work cells to help with work flow
  • Organize and prepare work to meet the demands of the schedule
  • Assembling when needed
  • Ensure that all work cells are clean and free from debris and clutter so that the shop is tour ready at all times
  • Train and assist assemblers to improve quality and efficiencies
  • Ensure that all safety procedures are followed and adhered to
  • Inspect parts for quality and help employees to achieve top quality product
  • Spot check on parts to ensure a clean finish to products
  • Read and understand processes sheets, all drawings and set up instructions
  • Maintain the tool boards and their inventory
  • Support foreman as required
  • Responsible for accurately filling out process sheets and accurately counting number of pieces completed
  • Reports all damaged goods and or scrap to supervisor
  • Knows material sizes and specifications of product being worked on
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Must be able to perform all assembly functions at an acceptable standard level
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings
  • Must be knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of settings and operation of oxygen acetylene cutting torch, arc welder and mig welder
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment under this classification
  • Must be capable of working under minimum amount of supervision
  • Able to effectively communicate in both technical and user-friendly language when appropriate, with all types of staff, including technical, professional, and upper management
  • Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with business units, corporate departments, key managers, and other stakeholders
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Must have excellent attention to detail.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 

Responsibilities:

  • Printed circuit board, chassis and cable assembly
  • Read assembly drawings
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Experience with electronic components in an electronic manufacturing environment would be an asset
  • Hand soldering experience would be an asset
  • Strong attention to detail is required
  • High School Diploma

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Assembly Operators - Day shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift team.

Shift : Day - Monday to Friday 7am - 3pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications

Requirements :

  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Assembler
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Assembler at our 352 Arvin Ave. location.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Assembler is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to: assembly, training, inspecting, problem solving, machine operator as well as communicating manpower and scheduling issues with supervision. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the IATF Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer supplied automotive parts to meet specified quality standards.
  • Record daily production ensuring accuracy and submit to Supervisor.
  • Handle product properly at all times, and assemble according to specifications.
  • Ensure that materials or equipment required be kept in a clean manner before and after shifts and report any maintenance issues to Supervisor.
  • Conduct a final inspection before customer product is packed and/or labeled.
  • Handle product properly at all times and package according to specifications.
  • Ensure that work area is clean and orderly throughout and after the shift.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and potential hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined.
  • Perform duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal, and written
  • Interpret technical drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work rotating shifts, 1 week day shift (6:00am-3:00pm) and 1 week afternoon shift (3:30pm-12:15PM)

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: Electro-Mechanical Assembler
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Assembleur / Assembleuse (SOIR)
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

Travaille 36h - Payé 40h

Souper, fait sur place, inclus

 

SOMMAIRE DU POSTE

En tant qu’assembleur/assembleuse, vous devrez effectuer le montage, l’ajustement et l’installation des panneaux et de certaines composantes de l’unité de ventilation.

 

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Assembler, ajuster et installer les panneaux extérieurs et le plancher sur la structure;
  • Installer les panneaux et les composantes à l'intérieur de l'unité;
  • Préparer la structure en fonction du type de panneau à installer;
  • Sceller les panneaux et certaines composantes pour en assurer l'étanchéité;
  • Lire et interpréter les plans;
  • Effectuer toute autre tâche à la demande de son supérieur immédiat.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

  • Connaissance des unités de mesure (métrique et impérial);
  • Habileté à utiliser différents outils (manuels, pneumatiques et électriques);
  • Bonne condition physique;
  • Dextérité manuelle;
  • Aisance en hauteur (Maximum de 12 pieds).

AVANTAGES

  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • Vêtements fournis
  • Congés personnels
  • Cafétéria hors du commun (repas à moindre coût)
  • Programme d’aide aux employés
  • Club social
  • Environnement de travail ultra propre, vitré et usine climatisée
  • Prime pour référence d’employés
  • Travaille 36h payé 40h
  • Prime de soir
  • Souper, fait sur place, chaud et santé inclus

title: Machine Assembler (Custom)
description:
Machine Assembler (Custom)
Location: Mississauga, ON

Our client is looking for skilled Custom Machine Assemblers for brand new machinery, who have experience in customized machine assembly.
Our client operates a safe, clean facility and considers security and safety their top priority.

The Assembler would be working on various machines designed for the plastic industry.Some travel will be required once the Assembler is quite familiar and comfortable in the role.

Skills:
  • Extensive knowledge of custom equipment and machinery.
  • Some pneumatics experience and plastics industry knowledge is an asset
  • Efficient time-management skills
  • High school diploma/GED required

Responsibilities:
  • Read and interpret blueprints, schematics and detailed drawings for custom designed equipment and machinery. Plastics industry knowledge is an asset.
  • Assembling parts and fitting sections of productionmachinery.
  • Align and calibrate machinery and equipment parts as required for efficient and safe operation
  • Dismantle equipment when required for repair or transportation and reassemble it at the appropriate time.
  • Set up of equipment at designated location

Compensation and benefits
  • 100% company paid benefits (after probationary period)
  • 3 paid sick days per calendar year, vacation (2 weeks/3 weeks after 5 years/ 4 weeks after 10 years)
  • RRSP with company match at 2%

Day Shift only:
Monday to Thursday - 6:50am to 3:50pm
Friday - 6:50am to 12:50pm

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

title: Operator/Sub-Assembler
description:
Are you able to work in a fast-paced environment? Would you like to learn how to operate a variety of machines and be cross-trained in different tasks? Do you want to have a career in Manufacturing?  Do you have attention to detail, multitasking and the ability to be cross-trained and work with a variety of jobs?

If your response is yes, please keep reading!

About Metalumen

Metalumen is a family-owned company located in Guelph that has been designing, engineering, and manufacturing lighting solutions since 1977. Our products are customized and up to 97% system recyclable. We are committed to a culture based on communication, collaboration, product excellence, on-time delivery, and customer and agent satisfaction.

By applying for this position, you may have the chance to work as part of our family. We are constantly improving our processes to provide the best for our employees. We understand that our customers' satisfaction is the reflection of our employees' happiness.

About the Position

The  Operator/Assembler will report to the Team Lead and is responsible for operating machines-  and assembling parts, according to production needs.

Main Duties

  •  Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Read, understand and interpret drawings and blueprints and work according to the prints
  • Follow all routing on job travellers
  • Set up and operate robots, machines, jig
  • Participate in first offs, supporting the Lead Hand and Team Lead to properly establish processes and ensuring time studying is done.
  • Measure and suggest new processes to Sub-Assembly and Painting Department
  • Fasten parts according to the Bill of Material and drawings. Follow the Team Lead's orientations
  • Load and Unload and operate paint line
  • Maintain the workplace clean and organized
  • Ensure the projects are being delivered on time and with the expected quality
  • Other duties as per Team Lead and Production Manager requirements

Requirements

  • 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Secondary school
  • Setup and operate Weld stud /spot welder machine
  • Understand Diagrams and the use of different hand and measure tools
  • Ability to lift up to 30 pounds
  • Willing to train other employees
  • Willing to work in a team
  • Sense of urgency and ability to work with limited supervision  
  • Attention to detail, excellent attendance, multitask, organization, ability to deal with conflict, and math skills

Benefits

  • Health and Dental after probationary period – 3 months
  • Pension Plan after one year of employment

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code, Metalumen is committed to providing inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process. Please notify Human Resources of any accommodations you may require.

title: Assembler - Breaker Shop
description:
Assembler - Breaker ShopTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Distribution Solutions Division provides utility, industrial and commercial customers with safe, smart and sustainable technologies for the distribution of electricity. With ABB AbilityTM enabled digital solutions at its core, our extensive portfolio includes distribution automation products, switching, limiting, measuring and sensing devices, switchgear, modular substation packages, and related services.
Your responsibilities

  • Assembly : Conducts all types of disassembly and assembly work to produce a repaired, refurbished or upgraded product, including the packing where integrated with production lines. Work is typically done manually or by using light hand tools.
  • Quality : Perform duties in a manner compliant with prevailing quality procedures and policies . The job may include regular quality testing as part of a defined production process.
  • Continuous improvement : Suggest and support the implementation of improvement ideas.
  • Health & safety : Conducts shop floor operation in compliance with health & safety guidelines and reports any non-compliance.
  • Organization : Operates within standard operating procedures and maintains a clean work area. Perform other related duties as assigned by Team lead or management.
  • Inventory : Involvement with cycle inventory counts when needed.
  • Housekeeping : Maintain a clean and safe workplace in accordance with 6S protocol

Your background
  • Diploma in Electromechanical technology or similar background is an asset
  • 4-7 years' experience in MV circuit breakers service or manufacturing. Alternatively, a special combination of education and experience and/or demonstrated accomplishments
  • Knowledge of electrical and mechanical operation of modern and legacy breakers is an asset.
  • Thorough knowledge of assembly techniques, tools, materials, machines, and equipment.
  • Read and interpret engineering configuration and wiring drawings.
  • Works from engineering drawings, rough sketches, manuals or verbal instructions.
  • Read, interpret, and follow electrical drawings, understand the use of and is able to use electrical test equipment with minimal supervision.
  • Good oral and written communication skills
  • Good knowledge and use of MS office
  • Able to do repetitive work
  • Able to lift 40 lbs
  • Stand or sit for extended periods of time

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Manufacturing Positions
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth and expansion we are currently seeking Assemblers, Welders, Fitters, Machinists, Machine Operators, Powder Painters, Production Planners, Material Handlers, Kitting Technicians, Labourers, Lead Hands and many more for our manufacturing facilities located in Regina and Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Take your place in a strong stable company that offers long term employment and a comprehensive benefit program. At Brandt, you'll get the challenges that you've been looking for and your hard work will be rewarded. Join our team of experts and see for yourself on how far you can go. Please visit the career page on brandtjobs.com for a full list of job opportunities.

title: Production Assembler I
description:
WORK LOCATION: 7371 Vantage Way Delta BC, V4G 1C9

WORKING HOURS: 6:30AM to 3:00PM Monday thru Thursday and 6:30AM to 2:10PM
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic: Grade 12 diploma preferred. Courses in mechanical/electrical technology an asset. 

Work Experience: Minimum three years mechanical/electrical assembly and/or metal fabrication experience or equivalent required. Experience in use of pneumatic tools an asset. Forklift certification is required. 

Skills/Other: Ability to read blueprints, competence in mathematics, ability to lift 25 lbs, strong time management skills and ability to change priorities as required. Must have own tools.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Grinding, cleaning, pressure washing parts.
  • Parts assembly (mechanical, hydraulic, electrical) under supervision.
  • Pallet/ crate building.
  • Crating and packaging for shipping.
  • Keep an accurate record of time charged to each job.
  • General shop maintenance and participation in weekly shop cleanup. 
  • Full comprehension of safety requirements.
  • Participates in quality assurance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Complete electrical assembly as per engineering’s specifications and standards;
  • Proceed with the installation of the manufactured equipment’s control and distribution panels electrical components;
  • Proceed with interconnections between motor sensors and control panels;
  • Detect and communicate corrections to the engineering team;
  • Weld electrical components when required;
  • Actively participate to the equipment star-up and calibration using measuring tools;
  • Participate to weekly production meetings.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  •  College or professional diploma in automated systems electro-mechanic or college certification in troubleshooting and maintenance of industrial systems;
  • 2-3 years’ experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring;
  • Mastering measuring tools such as a multimeter;
  • Able to read and interpret electrical plans;
  • Knowledge of industrial programmable controllers such as Bradley and Siemens;
  • Experience in welding electrical components, an asset
  • French as a working language, English an asset.
  • High quality standards;

    NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

    BENEFITS:

    As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program. 

    Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

    ABOUT NJM

    The world’s proven, trusted, single-source provider of automated packaging machinery for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and personal care products, NJM offers both stand-alone solutions and integrated systems for packagers of solid dose and liquid pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, vitamins, and food supplements. As part of the ProMach Pharma business line, NJM helps our customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

    PMCA01

    Experience

    Preferred
    • 2 - 3 years: experience in assembly of industrial machinery electrical components and wiring

    Skills

    Preferred
    • Blueprint Reading
    See job description

title: Production Technician - Summer Student
description:
Production Technician - Summer Student

Maple Leaf Foods McLeod Plant in Saskatoon is Hiring!

General Information
  • Must be 16 years of age or older to work in a production environment
  • Starting wage of $13.60/hour
  • $1.00/hour shift premium for time worked between 6 pm – 6 am
  • A variety of shifts are available
  • Opportunities to learn and grow
  • Fast paced learning environment
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food
Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging. We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement.


Raise the Good in Food
We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values
Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility
The Opportunity
The Production Technician full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
  • Check and weigh materials and products
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products
  • Assist machine operators, assemblers and other workers
  • Clean work areas and equipment
  • Perform other general labour tasks
What we have to offer you:
  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
COVID-19 Safety Measures:
Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

title: journalier Monteur-assembleur
description:
Vous aimez le travail manuel ? Vous voulez travailler dans une nouvelle entreprise neuve avec une superbe ambiance de travail ?
Ce travail est pour vous alors !

Voici les tâches pour le poste de monteur-assembleur:
Effectuer l’assemblage des structures d’aluminium;
Effectuer le positionnement et l’installation des thermos et des vitres;
Installer les moulures, les joints d’étanchéités et la quincaillerie;
Procéder à des inspections et des contrôles qualités;
Compléter les produits selon les spécifications demandées;
Effectuer la coupe de moulures, de cornières et de renforts;
Effectuer l’usinage de pièces à l’aide de poinçons et de perceuses;

Nouvelle usine, qui fabrique des murs-fenêtres dans le quartier industriel de St-Hyacinthe recherche actuellement un monteur -assembleur de soir. Cette entreprise ou vous aurez un coup de coeur en arrivant par sa belle lumière intérieure, son équipe jeune et dynamique et avec un équipement à la fine pointe de la technologie n'attend que vous,

Poste permanent
Horaire de soir
Lundi au jeudi 17h-3h am
Salaire de 21.11$ + 1.65$ prime de soir
Assurance collective après 3 mois

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Do a minimum of 1 year of electrical assembly? Do you have experience in cable assembly and mechanical parts? Do you have amazing attention to detail? Do you have good dexterity skills? Are you enthusiasm to learn?
The Electrical Assembler will be responsible for routing, wiring, and installing electrical components as well as full functional and electrical testing on products.

We are currently staffing for a well-known company in the East that are expanding within their business!
Does this sound like you or someone you know? We want to hear from you!


Advantages

Salary: $20.35
Day shifts: Monday- Thursday: 7:30 AM-6:00 PM
Long weekends!
Working for a well-known company
Health Benefits after probation
Bus accessible


Responsibilities
Identifying electrical component
Reading and interpreting plans
Doing the cabling
Assembling the electrical components on the panel
Installation of the panels in the unit


Qualifications

A year or more within electrical assembly
Experience within routing wiring and installations of electrical components


Summary
If you, or anyone you know are interested, please apply by:

Visit www.randstad.ca and apply through the posting
Apply by e-mail at: indus.gl@randstad.ca
Call 613.726.0220 ext 2 and ask for Eldjie and Josee
We appreciate all applications; however only those who meet the requirements for the position of Assembler located in Ottawa will be contacted.


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Technician (AM Shift)
description:
About the Company:

Auxly is a leading Canadian cannabis company dedicated to bringing innovative, effective, and high-quality cannabis products to the wellness and adult-use markets. Auxly's experienced team of industry first-movers and enterprising visionaries have secured a diversified supply of raw cannabis, strong clinical, scientific and operating capabilities and leading research and development infrastructure in order to create trusted products and brands in an expanding global market. Learn more at www.auxly.com and stay up to date at Twitter: @AuxlyGroup;â€¯Instagram: @auxlygroup;â€¯Facebook: @auxlygroup; LinkedIn: company/auxlygroup/.â€¯  

Overview:

Reporting to the Manufacturing Manager, the Production Technician will work in and maintain the standards of a cGMP environment, ensure orders are done accurately and in a timely manner,  process component materials into finished products while maintaining high quality standards.

 

The key candidate will be well organized, have an eye for detail, be a team player, and a good communicator.

AM Shift is 8-430 pm

What can you expect to do:
  • Maintaining process batches within specifications to meet department batch execution targets by ensuring optimal run rates in support of schedule adherence.
  • Completing master batch records, and associated production documentation accurately; Providing Material Safety Data (MSD) sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Assisting with processing component martials into finished products while ensuring that quality standards are consistent.
  • Dismantling, cleaning, sanitizing, and assembling manufacturing equipment according to established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) to ensure GMP compliance and meet department changeover targets in support of department and productivity goals.
  • Setting up and operating machines on trial runs to verify accuracy process.
  • Ensuring the proper selection, care and use of tools, parts and equipment while performing all role-related tasks.
  • Supporting the implementation of initiatives that drive efficiency and increase product yield.
  • Preparing equipment and extracted oils for packaging, and operating packaging and labelling equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining packaging equipment and room facilities.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all dry materials, chemicals and equipment used in the clean room facility.
  • Washing and sterilizing formulation vessels used for packaging, storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping clean room, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Performing administrative tasks related to packing activities such as word processing, record keeping and filing.
  • Other related tasks as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Reporting and information management experience; must have proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with process management, team problem solving, and inventory control.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and evolving deadlines.
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
What will set you apart:
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
Ã‚  :

Auxly Cannabis Group Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.â€¯  

We provide accommodation for job applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.â€¯

title: Production Technician
description:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.


 

Job Purpose:

Supports manufacturing by providing assistance and support to other Production Technicians while maintaining environmental and sanitation standards according to cGMP guidelines to ensure that the facilities are kept clean to prevent contamination and cross-contamination of the department

Responsibilities:

  • Support Antigen production and freeze dried vaccines production according to Standard Operating Procedures and Protocols.
  • Environmental monitoring – viable and non-viable monitoring
  • Prepare materials for production needs
  • Organizing, labeling, wrapping and sterilization of materials
  • Ensure equipment and materials are in state of readiness for production technicians
  • Cleaning/disinfection of production areas and materials as outlined in specific Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Assist in Buffer preparation and other supporting activities related to down streaming process.
  • Perform routine activities such as recording temperatures and room pressures, performing purified water sampling and clean steam sampling.
  • Preparation and modification of Standard Operating Procedures as required
  • Complete other duties as necessary

Education and Experience:

  • Certificate, Post-Secondary Diploma or Degree
  • Some experience with cGMP manufacturing environment procedures and protocols is preferred.
  • Biotechnology or Biology considered an asset

Requirements:

  • Able to wear clean room garments.
  • Must be physically able to lift, move and maneuver medium sized equipment/ material for production.
  • Work to be performed outside of normal working hours including evenings and weekends (12 hour day shift rotation)
  • Must be able to read, write, understand, and comply with appropriate standard operating procedures.
  • Handling of disinfectants (will require the wearing of a respirator).

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Production Assembler/Technician's (Multiple Openings)
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

**Competitive Hourly Pay** Full time and contingent positions available

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Composite Technician
description:
Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fiberglass and metal components for local OEMs.

We are a family business committed to developing our team members to grow within our group of companies and develop their skills as much as possible. We enjoy company events whenever possible and are grateful for the wonderful team we have here at Eastside.

Eastside Industrial is committed to diversifying our customer base in class A coatings and composites manufacturing with our expanding our customer base throughout the continent.

Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings, and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.

POSITION PURPOSE:
This position will assist in all aspects of the Composite Technician which includes but not limited to prepping tools for gel coat, placing the fiberglass material load after gel coat and closing tooling, and injecting resin into the closed tool. In addition to this, operate machines or equipment or use hand tools to cut glass mat, shape, splice, and fit materials to form into tools. This job is for a reliable, hard-working individual that has a high level of attention to detail, excellent hand-eye coordination with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Ability to wear ½ mask face Respirator while performing specified work tasks.
  • Assist with tool movements and prep/cleaning for the gel coat booth.
  • Select and cut fiberglass mat and press / or lay mat over the gel-coated plug/tool.
  • Utilizing electric and pneumatic tools.
  • Seal / close tools and inject resin into tools at appropriate vacuum and injection volume.
  • Demold (Remove) the cured parts from the tool and clear excessive material from the edge of the tool.
  • Be prepared to lift 25 pounds from time to time in this role
  • Inspect tools to ensure it meets required specifications and identify any defects present
  • Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Keep all work areas including part storage area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Cleaning and maintaining work tools such as rollers, brushes, grinders, electric tools and other pieces of equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining safety equipment such as respirators and dust masks.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently. with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start/end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with FRP Materials, machining tools / equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Comfortable with repetitive tasks.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching, and standing.

BENEFITS:
  • Dental care.
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Life insurance.
  • On-site parking.
  • RRSP match.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families, and our customers.
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.

title: Electrical Assembler
description:
Eaton’s Electrical Division is currently seeking an Electrical Assembler to join our first shift team.

This position is based at our Perth, Ontario facility.

This position is responsible for assembly and wiring standard & engineered control assemblies as well as full functional and electrical testing on products.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

Position Overview:

  • Work from drawings, specifications, schematics, wiring diagrams as well as other verbal or written instructions and perform electrical and mechanical assembly.
  • Determine wiring sequence, layout and location.
  • Perform testing to verify work.
  • Work to CSA, UL, CEC codes and company quality requirements.
  • Provide input and recommendations to improve the effectiveness of work area.
  • Actively support and participate in corporate initiatives/programs including department meetings, safety programs, lean manufacturing, continuous improvement initiatives, and quality management programs.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned in the facility as required.
  • Comply with all safety requirements, including proper use of personal protective equipment and operation of equipment in a safe and competent manner.
  • Perform all job functions with adherence to Eaton’s Philosophy and Values, Code of Ethics as well as safety and environmental standards.

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • Minimum Grade 12 or equivalent level of education from an accredited institution
  • Must be able to work in Canada without corporate sponsorship now and within the future
  • No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within an 80-kilometer radius of the work location will be considered

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in a manufacturing / assembly environment will be an asset, but not required, as training will be provided
  • Two-year community college diploma, or greater
  • Minimum one year of manufacturing / assembly experience
  • Experience in machining operations, particularly in the use of milling and drilling equipment
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing/continuous improvement principles

Position Criteria:

  • Computer skills with a working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work efficiently as a team member
  • Ability to grasp new tasks and concepts quickly
  • Strong work ethic

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Production Technician
description:
Production TechnicianTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Measurement and Analytics (PAMA) develops, produces, sells, delivers and services products and solutions to enable industrial and energy customers to operate more efficiently and profitably. We are dedicated to serving our customers with the best digitally enabled solutions to meet their needs quickly and reliably, while providing the support of a global service network. Based in Quebec City and reporting to the production supervisor, the production technician supports the business unit in achieving the production objectives set by adhering to systems and processes. The business unit produces chemical product analyzers that target different markets.
Your responsibilities

  • Perform the optical, mechanical and electronic assembly of our analyzers.
  • Perform quality control of these same analyzers.
  • Conduct the final tests making sure to meet the quality standard.
  • Comply with the processes in place.
  • Troubleshoot problems encountered during assembly and testing.
  • Be consistent with ABB's core values of safety and integrity, that is, take responsibility for your own actions while taking care of your colleagues and the company.

Your background
  • College diploma (DEC) in physics, electronics or an appropriate field
  • High school diploma coupled with relevant experience will also be considered
  • Strong learning and analytical skills
  • High level of autonomy, responsibility and versatility
  • Strong concern for high quality and efficiency

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Assembleur mécanique
description:
Tu aimes voir un projet grandir grâce à ton travail et à tes efforts? Tu es passé maître dans l’assemblage de machines, la manipulation d’outils et la lecture de plans? Voici l’offre que tu attendais!

Ta future équipe

Chez Premier Tech Systèmes Automatisés, nous optimisons les installations manufacturières de nos clients grâce à des systèmes novateurs à haute valeur ajoutée qui exploitent le plein potentiel de la robotique. Nous faisons partie des plus importants fournisseurs d’équipements automatisés de conditionnement, de manutention et d’emballage au monde – que ce soit pour des produits alimentaires, agricoles, organiques ou industriels.

Ton futur rôle en quelques mots

  • Interpréter différents plans et instructions d’assemblage mécanique
  • Réaliser des assemblages et ajustements mécaniques sur des machines
  • Utiliser les outils usuels d’assemblage et d’ajustement mécanique
  • Exécuter des tâches reliées à l’intégration et au chargement des équipements fabriqués
  • Travailler de façon sécuritaire
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes – meuler, percer, couper et poinçonner

Compétences requises

  • Maîtrise en lecture de plan
  • Formation en montage-soudage ou en mécanique – ou toute autre formation reliée à l’assemblage mécanique
  • Esprit d’équipe
  • Débrouillardise
  • Bonnes habiletés communicationnelles

Ton futur environnement de travail

  • À la fine pointe de la technologie, nos usines sont pensées pour faciliter la collaboration et prioriser la santé, ainsi que la sécurité de nos équipiers. Travailler chez Premier Tech, c’est avoir la possibilité de toujours apprendre, d’améliorer ses compétences et de se spécialiser.
  • Tu évolueras dans un milieu multiculturel qui favorise pleinement le partage d’expériences et de connaissances.

Informations supplémentaires 

  • Rémunération globale avantageuse
  • Prime de soir et de nuit
  • Usines à la fine pointe de la technologie
  • Assurances collectives et REER disponibles
  • Horaires de jour, de soir et de nuit

Ces mots te parlent?

mécanique, assemblage, travail d’équipe, polyvalence, production, manufacturier

Envie d’en savoir plus? Postule dès maintenant, nous attendons ta candidature avec impatience!

title: Assembly Operator - Evening Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Building Products - Windows Division is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking Assembly Operators to complete our day shift and evening shift teams.

Shift : Evening - Monday to Friday - 3pm to 11pm

We offer :

  • Salary : 15$/hr
  • Evening shift premium : 0.45$/hr
  • Flexible group insurance program
  • Pension plan
  • Work boot allowance
  • Opportunity for growth and development

Duties:

  • Handle power tools and small hand tool
  • Operate machines and equipment
  • Assemble material and parts
  • Inspect manufactured products for defects and conformance to specifications
  • Reroute defective products

Requirements : 

  • High school diploma
  • No experience required - Full training will be provided
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to work standing for extended periods
  • Languages: French or English

While we appreciate all expressed interest in joining our team, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Production Assembler - Server Chassis
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 
 

Responsibilities:

  • Preparing and installing cabling

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Electro-Mechanical Assembler
description:
The Job

You will be performing detailed electronic and electro-mechanical assembly in sub-assembly or assembly units, as well as bench testing of Integrated Navigation Bridge System components. In building and testing of electro-mechanical assemblies, the incumbent will hold tolerances to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications.
You will also be responsible for performing parts installation, wiring, cable harnessing and hand soldering using standard sequence and also perform repairs to legacy/customer equipment.

The main responsibilities are:
  • Organize and verify components for assembly or installation
  • Assemble sub-assembly and/or final assembly units in a timely fashion
  • Solder wires and assembly of cable connections as required
  • Build and/or test electro-mechanical assemblies to blueprint and/or oral and written specifications
  • Maintain accurate records of all quality, operations and assembly related documentation and procedures
  • Ensure high quality of executed duties on an ongoing basis to support exceptional standards of quality, delivery, compliance and excellence
  • Comply with OSI Maritime Systems established ISO-9001-compliant development guidelines and standards
  • Comply with workplace operational, environmental, health and safety procedure guidelines
 

You bring

  • 3-5 years’ electro-mechanical experience in detailed soldering
  • Knowledge of hand tools, power tools, fixtures and measuring devices including DVMs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Microsoft ExcelAttention to detail in ensuring that quality and efficiency standards are met or exceeded
  • Excellent oral and written English communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Adequate close vision and color & depth perception
  • This position may require lifting and moving products of up to 50 lbs
  • May be required to work overtime as needed
  • Some domestic travel may be required from time to time
  • Experience in electro-mechanical assembly, testing along with following schematics, experience working in an ISO 9001 compliant environment would be an asset.
 

About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.  Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits: 
  • Extended healthcare 
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: General Labour/Assembler
description:
General Labour/Assembler

Brampton, ON, Canada Req #3993

Wednesday, January 19, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!


$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for General Labourers/Assemblers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k with company match, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints

Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

#LI-TK1

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly

title: Assemblers
description:
Brandt Industries Canada Ltd. is currently looking for reliable and experiencedAssemblers to startimmediatelyat our manufacturing facilities in Regina, Saskatchewan.

The right candidates will have the opportunity to be trained in-house working alongside our highly specialized team. We are looking for ambitious, hardworking individuals that want to build their career with a company that will provide advancement and security for them for the long haul while gaining all the experience needed to become a highly specialized professional in the industry.

We are an industry leader that employs the very latest technologies and equipment to build the best products out there andpride ourselves on delivering a safe, clean work environment for all of ouremployees.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • General assembly work for agricultural & material handling equipment, trailers and attachments at our various manufacturing facilities
  • Handles, bundles and stacks finished goods
  • Stencils, decals and adds material to finished products
  • Loads and unloads materials
  • Accurately counts and records material as required
  • Moves and stage materials as required using a forklift at some divisions
  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Operate hoisting and lifting devices to position machinery and parts during the installation, setup and repair of machinery
  • Become an active participant in our lean manufacturing culture
  • Use power tools as required
  • Work with minimal supervision
  • Attention to detail
  • Mechanically inclined; relatable experience working with equipment, trailers and/or attachments
  • Must be reliable and work under minimal supervision
  • Excellent communications and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent organization skills
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds

title: Assembleur / Assembleuse
description:
Boni de rétention après 1 an - 2000$

500$ -  payable après 6 mois travaillés

1 500$ - payable après 1 an travaillé

On reconnait l’expérience! 

Semaine de 40 heures sur 4 jours et ½ ou 36 heures payés 40 sur 4 soirs!

Boni de rétention l’intérieur d’un an - 2000$

 

À la recherche d'un emploi d’usine stimulant?

Tu souhaites avoir un impact positif sur l'environnement?

Tu désires travailler dans la plus belle usine moderne du Centre-Du-Québec?

Arrête de chercher, vient-en chez nous!

 

Avantages d’être dans notre équipe

  • Pas besoin d’un lunch! Cafétéria subventionnée avec option végé
  • Environnement de travail ultra confortable, propre, vitré et usine climatisée
  • Bonus de rétention après 1 an 2000$
  • 2 semaines de fermeture durant l’été + congés payés à Noël!
  • Assurance collective
  • REER
  • Prime pour référence d’employés de 500$

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Assembler, ajuster et installer les panneaux extérieurs et le plancher sur la structure;

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES

title: Assembler
description:
AssemblerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Buildings (ELSB) digitally transforms commercial, industrial and residential buildings for the highest comfort, efficiency, safety and security - enhancing quality of life in the buildings of the future, through sustainable electrification solutions, services and products. Working at ABB means having access to a complete benefit package, a group pension plan as well as growth opportunities within the company.
Your responsibilities

  • Assemble components in order to make emergency lighting finished goods;
  • Respect quality standards;
  • Apply quality, health, safety and environmental procedures and policies and participate in the various activities that flow from them;
  • Perform other related tasks;
  • Living ABB's core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues, and the business.

Your background
  • Ability to read and follow work instructions;
  • Ability to interpret a work order, parts lists and assembly drawing;
  • Read assembly drawings;
  • Ability to use hand tools, power or compressed air tools;
  • Capacity to work standing up all day;
  • Good dexterity;
  • Meticulousness;
  • Ability to maintain the workflow according to the established objectives;
  • Autonomy and versatility
  • Team spirit
  • French or English, spoken, written and read

Benefits
  • Medical insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Retirement plan
  • Schooling allowance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
• Manually perform mechanical assembly projects respecting the allowed schedule and budget and meeting the company's quality standards
  • Read plans of mechanical assembly of machinery
  • Perform very precise marking (at 64th)
  • Solve assembly problems
  • Collaborate in preparation for the shipping of assembled equipment
  • Minimize unproductive time

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Professional diploma, or equivalent, in industrial mechanics or other related field;
  • Ability to understand mechanical and electrical plans
  • 2-3 years of experience in mechanical assembly, preferably in the packaging industry
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Good knowledge of French language, bilingualism is an asset.
  • Able to work long hours in a standing position and lifting heavy equipment 

BENEFITS:

As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program.

Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

ABOUT NJM

The world’s proven, trusted, single-source provider of automated packaging machinery for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and personal care products, NJM offers both stand-alone solutions and integrated systems for packagers of solid dose and liquid pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, vitamins, and food supplements. As part of the ProMach Pharma business line, NJM helps our customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

PMCA01

Experience

Preferred
  • 3 - 5 years: mechanical assembly

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better in Other
